Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Thus begins Albucasis' words.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	O, son, I have completed this book to you, which is the last of medical science, because its end is accomplished by it, and for its explanations, and its declarations, I see that I accomplish that to you from this treatise, which is a beginning of surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	For surgery is laid down in our region and in our time totally deprived, except that very much the science of it, and its traces remain; and they do not end except in a few small descriptions in books of the Ancients, which have altered their more and are mistaken and wrong within that they are closed the expressions of it, and is elongated the force of it and art.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And it seems to me that I animate that with an order of this treatise in that second way of expression and declaration and abbreviation; and because it comes with the forms of tools of cauterization and other instruments of the work by addition of the declaration, and by preparation of it, which necessary cause is.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	The cause why the good artisan does not master himself in our time, is that the art of medicine is long, and that his actor goes before being exercised in the science of anatomy which connects Gualia within that he knows the springs of the limbs and their forms, and the connection and separation of them; and has the knowledge of bones, nerves, and ligaments, and their names, and the structure of them; and of the pulsating veins and the quiet ones, and places of their impression.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And therefore says Iopracras that by a name is meant, more in the small work and more in the art of surgery.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	But we have said of that in the entrance of this book; for who does not know that I have told him about anatomy, it is not understood that he falls into error by which men may die, so often as I have seen examples thereof, because they are formed in this science and get from that other science and those experiments.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	For I saw a doctor who was learned and experienced to have cut an ulcerous sore in the neck of a woman, and cut some arteries in the neck because they flowed with great blood, so that the woman died among her more.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And I saw another doctor who was learned and experienced to have cut off a great stone from a man which had passed in his state, and the stone was large, and he brought it off him by a thread of the bladder, so that that man died at the third day.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And I have called it away to extract that; and I saw that by the size of the stone and the disposition of the patient under him that he would die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And I saw another doctor who took a fee from a duke of our land for surgery; and in the same way he fractured him in the crotch; and prepared the doctor with his ignorance, cut off the fracture, on the skin, with dust and needles to strengthen it, and did not leave the skin breathing.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	Then he took off the bandage according to his desires, and then he prayed, and then he left it off by some days and commanded that we take off the joint; and so came within that the crotch and the foot hole sore, and came into destruction.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And I was called away to it, and I prepared myself to take off the bandage, and I got quiet and peaceful relief from his pains.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	But the corruption was confirmed in the member, so that I could not restrain it, and did not walk because of the corruption in the member until the patient perished.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And I saw another doctor who pierced a cancerous sore, and became ulcerated by some days, so that the evil of it spread out to his lord.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	For the cause is because the cold cautery is pure of melancholic humors, therefore it seems that it does not cover to him in all ways, but it is a member which you suffer that of all ways it is host.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And therefore, son, it is necessary to you that the operation to the hand be divided into two operations: if it is an operation which is associated with health, and work in which there is danger in most dispositions.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And I have already established this book here in all places of that treatise in which there is an operation in which it is error and fear; for it seems necessary to you that you guard this one and let those go, so that the pages do not prevent your speaking and displease you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	And therefore take your weapons with diligence and with protection of God, and your evils with help and with steadfastness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And use the best way by the grace of God, so that you obtain health and praiseworthy succession, and leave behind you terrible evils of difficult healing, and retain your weapons from here that you are afraid; for it seems remaining to your glory, and later in the world and after your sanctities.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	Gualia has said in some of his instructions:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	"Do not make bad surgery, so that bad sutures do not go."
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And I have divided this book according to three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	Begin the division of the book, and first of the first part.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter begins with the head, in the forms of instruments and tools of cauterization, and from that which is necessary in the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	Begin the division of the second part.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter begins with a comparison between operations on the hand and those on the foot, and in causes and dispositions which you must prevent and avoid.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	Begin the division of the third part.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The final chapter, which is the fifth, is about the extraction of arteries and general surgery; and from that which is necessary that the operation be divided into two parts.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	Of fire cauterization and acute medicine and recurrence of the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	In that way begins the treatise of the whole book.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	It seems that I say the quality of the springs of cauterization and the knowledge of noxious things, and in what way it is forbidden to cauterize.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Then I say that the speech of the quality of the spring of cauterization and the knowledge of noxious things is long and prolix, and subtle by science, and hidden; and already he has talked of a great many of these wise men, and they disagree with each other, and for me it is enough of a small part of their speeches, in fear of lengthiness.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And therefore I say that cauterization confers on the whole complex of things universally the same quality, except for two complexes, which are complex things of different qualities.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the complex of tail and dry things there is disagreement; for some say that cauterization is helpful to this, and others say that it is contrary to it, which cauterization is not convenient in a tail and dry disease of quality and dryness, since the nature of fire is quality and dryness, and it is not suitable that such a disease be cured.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And he who says that the opposite of this is true, that it rejuvenates all maladies of the body and dryness that occurs in the bodies of men, for when you compare the bodies of men with the moisture of fire, you find that the bodies of men are parched.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And I tell by the words of him, who has already experienced this several times and discovered it.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	But moreover I do not know that this comes about on him who has already been exhausted and exercised in the chapter of cauterization by subsequent exercise, and has recognized the diversity of the complexions of men and the causes of those maladies, and the accidents of their own, and the space of time of those.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	But in the other complexions, there is no fear on you, and more in the wet and sore diseases, for all doctors have agreed about those, and they are not agreed as to the rejuvenation by cauterization in those.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	And know, children, that of the secret of cure by fire cauterization and of the goodness of it, is about fire being simple, the action of which does not reach but to the member that is cauterized, and does not hurt the other member with the medicine applied until there is a small damage.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	But the action of the burning medicine reaches to that in the members which makes him bleed, and it is very strong to bring about the member with difficult cure and very strong to hear.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	But fire, for its smallness and the goodness of its substance, does not do this, but makes it superfluous; and it is already known to us by experience and by the long service of study on the truth of causes; and by this I am absolved from the length of speech; And if it were not that it is not legible at my free hand in this pause to you secret-keeping with fire, and the quality of the operation of it in the bodies and of its expulsion through which are expelled the diseases, in philosophical demonstrative speech, which would serve well in your ears.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And know, children, that they disagree about the time when it is convenient to make cauterization and pause; the best time is in early spring.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	And I say that cauterization is convenient at all times, so that the damage by time's accident is submerged in the rejuvenation of him who undergoes cauterization; and more so if the cauterization is for pains or necessary pains, which do not suffer from delay because it is feared that those which come about are worse than small injury caused by fire entering through time.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And thus, in your cases, or children, this is not held but by the common people and foolish doctors; therefore, for that disease which is cured by cauterization, it is convenient to pause at all times, and do so for the consequence.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the cause is not good in such a way that they guard against it by fire; for cauterization is only a place of medicine which alters the complexions and dries up the moisture which is the cause from which pains come.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	But, moreover, cauterization in excess over medicine by the virtue of its usefulness and the worth of its operation and the greatness of its lord.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	And it is possible that the disease in which it has been given cauterization returns at any hour of time, according to the complexion of the disease and the location of the disease, and the virtue of it; and that which is prepared in his bodies by the addition of the superfluities in them, and that which is received into him by the acquisition in food and semblant things of those causes; but if the disease in which cauterization has been given is a subtle one in a member of few superfluities and moisture, then, when it has been given cauterization for toothache and similar to it, it is possible that, in his body, it does not return that pain, but remains there.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	And moreover, common speech is that cauterization is the last remedy of medicine, and it is a quick speech not suited to him who understands it, for they think that it is no cure which adds benefit by medicine or any other cause; but that cauterization is suited to him.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	And the cause is contrary to this; and the intention that cauterization is the last remedy of medicine is only when we administer the ways of cure in certain diseases, and those medicines do not benefit, and appropriately at the end of the disease give him cauterization, and add it to that.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And from here I will explain why cauterization is the last remedy of medicine, not according to the intention which the common people and foolish doctors understand.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And they say that fire cauterization for gold is better than fire cauterization for iron; and do not say this except for the equality of gold and the smallness of its substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they say that the place of cauterization does not make it break, for when it is absolutely true, for I have seen fire prove and turn away that which does not make it break; but when you give cauterization by fire on gold, it is not known to you, for it is according to the quantity which you wish to make strong because of the roughness of gold, and because it prepares itself to receive; and if you put over it fire, then gold goes into the fire, and the metal-worker uses his hand as he wishes for the occupation of that.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And by this is made cauterization on iron, we must place it with care and correctly to the operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	And I have ordered this chapter on cauterization according to the other chapters, and I have ordered those of the following chapters within the chapters, so that I answer the question which asks it.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	Of cauterization for headache by cold and moisture.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cauterization confers on moisture and cold the second accident of which there are two causes, so it is a cause of soda and many types of flux from blood, that flows from the head to the parts of hair and ears; and many types of sleep, and pain of teeth and throat, and generally of all diseases that come by cold; as, if it makes one paralytic, or sickly, and apoplexial, and similar in those diseases.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The form of this cauterization is that, first of all, you order to the patient who is evacuated by lacative medicine the head in a cap, for three or four nights, according to whether you require the virtue of the medicine, and the age and custom of him; then you give a small amount of it.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And then order him to shave his head, and then place the razor between your two palms on a bench that is levelled; and place his hands over the sides of his skull.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And then pause the razor from your palm placed on the edge of the razor between the side of his nose and his hairline.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	But, moreover, when the boy says about his place it has come, he marks that place with a trial, and then he gives cauterization by olive oil; for this is the form:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And then place him on that place by trial, in such a way that it sinks little by little, and you turn him around.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	And then lift your hand lightly and look at the place, and if you see any quantity of hair from the skull, then, as much grain of sand as needed to fill that space, raise your hand; and if it does not go up by fire, but another from it, if it is cold, until it is visible hair from the bone which I have told you.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And then take a little salt and dissolve him on that place and leave him there for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	Then place over the cut in border and leave that inside which is destroyed the staircase of fire.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And then cure the area with a fourfold bitter medicine so that it is healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And also they say that when the plague of Rome opens, so much honey is obtained from it, that it is better and more healing.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	And they also say that the joint should be cauterized inside the bone, and that cauterization inside should be had so that some part of the flesh of the bone is scorched.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	Then let water be poured which is close to the bone, and then let it be cured.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	And others say that the cauterization should reach the back, inside that it presses strongly against the bone, and this is the way of small animal:
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	They estimate that the vapors of the head are exhaled from that location.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And let the opened plague be held for a long time, and then let it be cured inside so that it is hardened.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	More to me these two species of cauterization do not seem to me, but in some people according to the way of fear; and leave that, certainly, better is it for salvation, when it is; because the head is a division by solution of continuity of its own as we have testified in the other members, and more so when the head of the patient is of a fiery nature.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	And the first species of cauterization is more saved and better to me; and from that one use I do this work for salvation.
Capitol segon.	I capitulate second.
Del cauteri del cap.	Of the head's cauterization.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When in all the head happens chronic and long pain and water is present in the patient for a long time, and it uses fire and knives and plasters and ointments and oils and similar things, and most if it has already been cauterized with another cautery which they tell and do not profit from any of those causes, then consider that since the head of the patient is of a strong creation in its nature; and it is not pleasant or causes much pain, then let that be cauterized with another cautery which leaves that a little.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	And then cauterize that over the corner of his head with another cautery inside so that the joint is broken.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa. Capitol ters.	I capitulate third.
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	Of cauterization of a migraine not ancient.

Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	More cauterization with burning medicine is that you take a glass of wine, and pour it out and rub the ends of both hands.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	And then incision on the location of the pain with a needle inside so that it is inside its location, and let the joint be uncovered.

And then press down on it with a strong constriction, and leave it in this state for three hours; and then after that pour wine out, and let the plague be held for two or three days, and then place over the cut in border, inside which it is healing.

E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	If you see this, bring some of the burning medicines which I have written in the two treatises about burning medicines.

e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	and it is called a small ring, because the head's shape is like this in its form of a small ring, and in the middle place of it is a small prominence.

And if the quantity of that which is taken away by the side of the joint is so much that the majority of it, and return your hand so that the artery is not taken away from that which is left, so that there does not come a flow of blood.

And then incision on the cut in salt water and place that over the location, and leave it for three days; and then incision on the cut in border, and then cure that with cold water so that it is healed.

Capitol .vi.	Chapter. VI.
De cauterizacio de turtura.	Of Cauterizing a Wound.
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	Turtura that is cured and the cauterization is not so much of the spices that come by blood, according to what we have said in the divisions of the malignancies.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Avoid cauterizing the spice that comes by dryness or by spasm of the nerve.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When you treat this species of turtura with the sucking and burrowing and gargling, and you do not confer your cure, then you must cauterize the patient's ear with three cauterizations: the first with a razur, and the second with a small needle, and the third with the union of the two lips.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	And pause the little cauterization according to the opposite part of the malignancy, for softening does not happen except in the part that appears healed.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	And the form of cauterization is that you cauterize that with a razur at the top of the ear's tip and place a little one on the hair of the head, and long-shaped one, whose length is according to the length of the said foot, and pause your hand so that the quantity of the spice of the wound is burned.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	And this is the form of the cauterization, and it is special with a razur, the shape of which is before a table.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	But yet more subtle it is that this little one should go to the places, and when it goes in the place of superfluous grossness, a little.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	Then return the place with water that is before procided within so that it is healed.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter. VII.
De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	Of Cauterizing an Old Stroke.

De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	Of Cauterizing an Oblvious Wound by Blood.

Capitol .x.	Chapter. X.
De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	Of Cauterizing an Epileptic.
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	It is not cauterized the epileptic, but this epilepsy is by blood.

Capitol .xi.	Chapter. XI.

E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	And some veins are cauterized in the neck, leaving two bones with two pointed cauterizations.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter XIII.
