E si la corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denol, lahoras en lu no es engen sino dimissio, e layssar le malaute a la mort.	And if corruption has already taken hold on the knee, then it is only to be cut off, and let the patient die.
E la manieyra de inscidir le membre o de serrar lu es que tu strenhas le liament en la partida pus dejos la qual voles inscidir, e strenh autre liament sobre le loc; e extenda le ministre un liament a las partidas dejos, e extenda le ministra autra liament en sus; e tu separa la carn la qual es entre dos liamentz ain spatum lat entro que sia descuberta tota la carn; e aprop sia inscidit o serrat.	And the way of incising the member or sawing it is that you strengthen the joint in the part where you want to cut, and strengthen another joint over that location; and extend the minister a joint to the split parts, and extend another joint on them; and you separate the meat which is between two joints in such a way that all of the meat is exposed; and it is incised or sawed.
E cove que sia pausat drap de li de totas partidas per so que no toque le loc sa, e que vengua al malaute lesio ajustada e apostema caut.	And as soon as you cut off the joint completely so that it does not touch the location, and bring to the patient's injury a correct apothecary and blister.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc quan obras, lahoras tu cauteriza le loc coytadament, o pausa sus lu alcunas polveras restrenhentz le sanc; e aprop retorna a la tua medicacio entro que sia complida.	May also happen to you a flux of blood when it works, then you cauterize the location carefully, or pour on it some powders that restrain the blood; and return to your medicine as soon as possible.
E aprop lia le membre plaguat am liament al u convenient, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And tie up the troubled member with a strong joint, and cure that one within which it is healed.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc a un home en le sieu pe, aquest meteys accident le qual yeu e a tu recomtat, le qual es quar accidic a lu negror en le sieu pe am adustio que era asemblada a combustio de foc.	And I will tell you that in an old man's foot, this accident which is said to have happened to him is due to the heat of a fire, and it is said that he is not able to walk.
E aquela corrupcio accidic primierament en le sieu dit entro que tendec tot le pe.	That corruption first happened in his foot while it was extended.
E adonc aquel home preparec per si meteys pus que vic la curacio anar al membre am la vehemencia de lu que atrobec de dolor e de adustrio de lu, e el inscidic aquel pe entro a la junctura, e foc sanat.	And then that man prepared himself for this purpose that the cure would come to the member with the urgency of his pain and the rustling of him, and he cut off that foot at the junction, and fire healed it.
Lonc temps accidic a lu aquela meteyssa corrupcio en le dit de la ma indic.	Long time ago, an accident happened to him in his leg while he was walking:
E adonc venc a mi, e so me perforsat repercutir aquela superfluitat am aquo que pausegui sobre la ma de las medicinas, aprop la mundificacio del cos de lu; e no es repercussa la superfluitat e comensec anar al autra dit entro que comensec en la ma.	And then he came to me, and so I repaired myself by applying those medicines to the body of him, according to his need; and that superfluity did not recur to me, and I began to apply it in another leg which had begun to hurt in my body.
E el apelec me a inscidir la ma de lu, e yeu no volgui far aquo sperant sobre la repercussio de aquela superfluitat, e mays que temegui deves la inscizio de la ma de lu mort, quar la vertut del malaute era sobre cazement.	And he called me to cut off his body, and I did not want to do so in the hope of preventing that superfluity from recurring to him, but rather I killed him first, because the virtue of the patient was over death.
E pus que el se desperec de mi, es retornat en la sua terra e pervenguec a mi que aquel home preparec e inscidic la sua ma tota, e es sanat.	And then he left me in peace, and he returned to his own land, and I healed him by cutting off all of his body, and it was healed.
E no he adhuzida aquesta narracio sino per que sia adjutori sobre aquo que catz de aquesta malautia, e que sia significacio per la qual sia significada e segon la qual sia obrat.	And I will not add to this story unless it is helpful for me to explain what this malady means and how it relates to the other; and according to that I will speak.
De cura sinuum et qualitate clisterizationis cum medicinis.	Of cures, their qualities, and the use of blistering.
Quan accideys apostema en alcus membres carnozes e·l spazi de l’apostema es prolonguat entro que fa colleccio de sania, e aprop es romput e perforat, e es eyssida de lu la sania, e roman le loc vuoyt quays cum si era vayssel, e la codena que es desobre lu ayssi cum drap subtiliat, e no es pervengut a deriera corrupcio, e no inprimeys en le os o en nervi ni en liament, es apelat sinu, e no es nompnat fistula.	When an apothecary is applied to large joints of the body and the blister is extended within that location, then it is broken and pierced, and the blisters are opened by applying a soft cloth, and it does not spread to the bone or to the nerves or joints; it is called a pimple, and it is not called a fistula.
Mays empero si le spazi es prolonguat entro que la corrupcio enprema en alcun membre, lahoras es appelada fistula e no zukem.	May also be if the space is prolonged before the corruption goes forward to some member, then it is called a fistula; and it does not get worse.
E la cura de lu es que inscidas aquela codena tota ayssi cum es revolvut, e majorment quan es subtiliada e es fayta cum drap, e comfizas que no adhereys al loc per la sua corrupcio.	The cure of it is that you cut off all of the blister as it is coming out, and mainly when it is softened and cut with a cloth, and confirm that it does not stick to the location because of its corruption.
Mays si tu speras que la codena adheresca e que aquela corrupcio no aja conseguit per deriera consecucio, e en la codena ha spassitut de cara, lahoras tu cura aquel am clisteri.	May also be if you hope that the blister will adhere and that the corruption has not spread to the next location, and in the blister is opened from the back, then you heal it with blistering.
E es que consideras al sinu, e lahoras si es gran, e·l brac que yeys es de fetent odor, lahoras clisteriza aquel am medicament egipciac le qual es de oli e vi agre e ziniar recebent partidas enguals, e sian ajustadas en un vayssel, e sian coytas sobre le foc entro que’l medicament se fassa rog e pervengua a specitut de mel.	And consider the skin, and if it is large, and the arm that you hold is of a fetid odor, then cut it with an Egyptian medicine consisting of oil, vinegar, and honey; let it be split into two parts, and let them be tied on a board, and let them be placed over fire so that the medicine becomes robust and spreads to the skin.
E aprop tu pren de lu aquo que es necessari e dissolveys lu am aygua e mel; e clisteriza am aquel le sinu, e strenh le orrifici de lu, e layssa la medicina en lu per la quantitat de doas horas.	And you give him this water that is necessary and dissolve it with honey; then clistenize his sinews, and tighten the orifices of his body, and leave the medicine in him for two hours.
E aprop extratz aquela am sprecio; e fay aquo per tantz dias entro que sia mundificat le sinu e sia remauguda la pudor.	And remove that with waste; and make water for so many days within that it purifies the sinews and restores the humors.
E alcunas veguadas es clisterizat am aygua de cendre, quan no es a tu prezent aquest medicament; e es que tu prenguas la cendra de vitz, e met sobre lu aygua; e aprop cola aquela e clisteriza aquel am ela entro que te confizes que·l sinu lahoras es ostat.	And some are clistenized with ash water, when you do not present this medicine to him; and it is because you take the ash of wine, and put on it water; and clistenize that within him so that he tells you that the sinews will go away then.
E si le malaute no ha tollerancia sobre le medicament egipciac ni l’aygua de la cendre, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aygua e mel e quays sia mesclat ziniar trissat, e clisteriza aquel am vi e mel mesclat, quar de proprietat de mel es que mondifique e lave, e le vi fa adherir le sinu, e majorment quan en le vi ha superfluitat de stipticitat e de siccitat.	And if the patient does not have tolerance for Egyptian medicine or ash water, then clistenize that with honey water and mixed zingiber three times, and clistenize that with wine and honey mixed, because of the property of honey is that it purifies and washes, and the wine makes the sinews adhere, and most when there is excess of stipticity and dryness.
E cum tu fas aquo alcunas veguadas e te comfizes que·l sinu ja es remaugut, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aquo que fa naysser la carn en lu.	And when you make water a few times and are convinced that the sinews have been restored, then clistenize that with water that makes the flesh come out of him.
E es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e dissolveys aquel am oli rozat e vi stiptic; o que clisterizas aquel am alcunas medicinas e enguentz autres que hajan las proprietatz les quals ja he yeu scritz en le tractat dels enguents.	And it is because you take dyaphinic ointment and dissolve that with rose water and wine stiptic; or you clistenize that with some medicines and ointments that already have the properties that I have written in the treatise of ointments.
E si le orrifici del sinu es streyt en le qual no es recebuda la canula del clisteri, lahoras tu le amplifique aquel am ferr petit a petit, e pausa en lu calgua envolopada en enguent egipciac o en enguent basilicon entro que sia amplificat.	And if the orifices of the sinews are narrow in which the canal of the clisteric does not enter, then you widen that little by little, and pause it with a little envelope of Egyptian ointment or basilic ointment so that it is widened.
E semblantment si le orrifici es ample, lahoras tu agregua las labias de lu am sutura e layssa de lu quantitat en la qual intre le clisteri ses addicio.	And if the orifices are wide, then you add a stitch to his lips and leave the quantity in which the clisteric is added.
E si le orrifici de lu del qual corr le brac es elevat a las partidas desus, lahoras secca aquel en le pus bas loc que es en lu per que le brac corra entro dejos, quar quan le brac es coartat en la preondeza de sinu la carn esser en lu engendrada.	And if the orifice of his leg that runs up to the thigh is high in the middle of it, then dry that place with a hole that is in him so that the leg runs into it, because when the leg is constricted in the sinew's thickness, the flesh is raised up.
E si no es a tu possible seccar le sinu entro al enviro del os pus bas segon que voles, lahoras te perforssa que prepares le membre am preparacio per la qual corr de lu le brac leugierament segon que es a tu apparelhat e que no sia en lu retengut alcuna causa del brac.	And if it is not possible for you to dry the sinew within the area of the bone according to your will, then pierce that member with preparation so that the leg runs out smoothly according to what is appropriate for your clothing and does not hold back the leg for any reason.
E pren medicinas consolidativas que sian pausadas sobre le sinu convenientz ad aquo que vols exxten aquelas sobre drap de li.	And take consolidating medicines that are placed over the sinew conveniently with water that you want to extend those on a cloth.
E le drap sia de tan gran quantitat cum fa la comunicacio de tot le sinu; e aprop inscidey am las forfexs en le dreyt del orrifici del sinu un trauc pus ample un pauc que l’orrifici del sinu; e aprop exten sobre autre drap de li dels enguentz leons segon la quantitat del trauc, e pausa le sobre aquel per posicio longinqua del orrifici del sinu per que sia aleujat le eyssiment del brac de lu e no ostes le drap gran sino aprop alcus dyas una veguada.	And the cloth be of such a quantity that it makes communication with all the sinew; and you cut a little pair of scissors on the right side of the orifice of the sinew a very small piece that the orifice of the sinew; and you extend over another cloth of him the leon ointments according to the quantity of the cut, and pause it on him for a distant position from the orifice of the sinew so that the leg does not feel any pain, and do not hold back the cloth except after a few days.
Mays aquel que es sobre le orrifici del sinu, le qual remauguas en tota hora per so que yesca aquo que es ajust en lu del brac.	And remove that which is on the orifice of the sinew, which you restore in all hours so that it does not hurt that leg.
E per que sapias si aquo que corr de lu del brac es mot o pauc, o es digest, o es no-digest.	And so that you know if the water that runs from his leg is much or little, or whether it digests or does not digest.
E am aysso tu considera le loc de aquel sinu, si en lu sent le pacient dolor o no, e si es en lu apostema.	And consider the place of that sinew on him, if the patient feels pain there or not, and if it is in apoplexy.
E cum la tua medicacio es prolonguada en la tal manieyra, e vesas la matiera que es gitada sobre le orrifici del sinu ja adhereys, o se apropria adherencia, lahoras le mayti tu le deslia o le tertz dia, e quan deslias la plagua, lahoras muda le drap per autre e renova le enguent.	And when your medicine is prolonged in such a way, and you see the matter that is adhering to the orifice of the sinew already adheres, or appropriates adherence, then change the cloth after two days, and when you change the cloth, replace it with another and renew the ointment.
Mays si del sinu aprop lon spazi yeys virus subtil, lahoras no te desperes de la adherencia de li, quar la sanacio de lu se apropria, quar so alcus homes en les quals tarda generacio de carn en las lors plaguas, e de aquels so en les quals es fayt le contrari de lu.	May if from the sinew comes a long thin virus, then do not despair of the adherence to him, because the cure appropriates itself, for such men there is a generation of flesh in their joints plagues, and of those is made the opposite.
E si del sinu aprop motz dias es yssit brac indigest, lahoras sapias que·l sinu no adhereys; e si es tardada la adherencia del sinu e es la causa prolonguada, lahoras tu ajusta en exsiccacio de las medicinas, e si las medicinas so humidas en lor substancia e en la sua vertut, son seccas ayssi cum enguent dyafinicon, quan es en lu ajustada superfluitat de addicio de zegi.	And if from the sinew comes a lot of days' indigest leg, then you know that the sinew does not adhere; and if the adherence of the sinew is prolonged, then adjust in desiccation of medicines, and if those medicines are wet in their substance and virtue, then they are dried with ointment of dyaphinic, when there is a surplus of addition of zigi.
E le mays derier am le qual es curat, es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e sia dissout en oli rozat, e sia sobre lu vojat vi antic engual en la sua substancia, e aprop comfeys aquel am lu, e usa de aquel.	And the following to cure him is that you take ointment of dyaphinic and dissolve it in rose oil, and put on him wine of stiptic in its substance, and use that; and use it on him.
E ja fa semblant en aquela accio, quan no y a brac, enguent dyafinicon, mel quan es coyt entro que sia engrossat, e usa de lu; o que prenguas mirra e aloen e enses, e trissa tot e polveriza sobre le mel quan es sus le foc, e aprop lineys aquo sobre drap e strenh aquel sobre le sinu; e lineys aquel am le mel le qual has cuoyt entro que es engrossat, e polveriza sobre drap e strenh aquel.	And it already makes a similar thing, when there is no leg, ointment of dyaphinic, honey when it is thick inside that it be thick, and use that; or you take myrrh and aloe and knead it, and triss all and powder it over the cloth, and pour water on it over a cloth, and tighten that on the sinew; and pour the honey that has gathered inside, and powder over the cloth, and tighten it.
E alcunas veguadas so administratz am lu aristologia longua e razitz de lili celesti (e es lili celesti) e farina de errs e centaurea, e usa de aquels simples o ajustatz, trissa aquels e cribela e polveriza sobre le mel le qual he recomtat; e husa de lu.	And some are given him long Aristotle and razines of celestial lily (and it is the lily celestial) and flour of eres and centaurea, and use those simple or adjust them, and triss those and sift them and powder over the honey that has been remembered; and use that.
E si es prolonguat le sinu, e no es sanat per aquesta curacio, lahoras sapias que la corrupcio es en le preon de lu, e ja fa enquisicio en les osses o en les autres membres durs o als liaments; lahoras tu le cura am curacio fistular, ayssi cum desus es dit.	And if the sinew is prolonged, and does not heal with this cure, then you know that the corruption is in its head, and has already been made an investigation in the bones or in other hard members; then you treat it with a cure of fistular, such as when the sun rises.
De curacio de panarici et unguis attritae et incisione digiti additi et sectione.	Of cure of paronychia and scraped nails and cutting the finger added and sectioning.
Panarici es apostema le qual nays dejos la ungla del dit pous de la ma o del pe, e fort leu nays en les autres ditz, e cum es prolonguat e la sua curacio es mens prezada, o es apostemat de apostema caut, o es corrumput, e gieta brac entro que corrodeys la razitz de la ungla, e fort leu corromp aquela tota, e fort leu perve la sua corrupcio al os entro que es a lu odor fetent, e es fayta la extremitat del dit lada, e la color de lu es fayta fusca.	Paronychia is an apoplexy that does not separate the nail of the toe from the foot of the hand or from the leg, and strongly hurts it in the other toes; and when it is prolonged and its cure is a painful thing, or is an apoplexy of apoplexia, or is corrupted, and the nail is cut, and strongly hurts that whole, and strongly changes the color of it.
E donc quan tu auras aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas am ferr tota la superfluitat que es romasa de la ungla e aprop cauteriza la plagla aprop aquo, quar cauteri mot es juvatiu en aysso.	And therefore when you have that water which we have said in the division and do not find your cure, then remember to remove all the surplus of the nail and cut it with water; because cauterization is helpful in plagues.
Mays si le os es sa e la ungla es sana, e las addicios de la ungla vuoydas ja compremen las carns a las partidas dedintz, e comensan lu punger e ledeysso aquela, lahoras cove que tu pauses ray subtil dejos le angle de la ungla que pungeys la carn, e impelleys aquela sus e inscideys aquela carn am facilitat, e pausa sobre aquo que roman de la carn de las medicinas comburentz corrosivas entro que sia tot remaugut; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	May if the bone is healthy and the nail is sound, and the additions of the nail have already affected the flesh at its beginnings, and it begins to hurt and it hurts those, then remember that you pause a thin thread from the angle of the nail that hurts the flesh, and push that above; and push the flesh above and cut it with ease; and pause over that water from the medicine that burns corrosively so that it is all healed; and cure that with ointment.
Mays si la corrupcio ja enprem en le os, lahoras cove que tu inscidas le os aquel e le extraguas, car nul temps no es sanat que sia en lu le os corrumput.	May if corruption has already entered the bone, then remember to remove that bone and extract it, for no time is cured that is not in its bone corrupted.
E si vezes la corrozio e la corupcio anar en le dit, lahoras tu inscideys aquel en un dels nozes segons que es premesa la sua rememoracio, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if corruption and corruption go into the finger, then you cut that in one of the nuts according to what is appropriate for its memory; and cure that within that it be healed.
Mays si a la ungla endeve percussio o atricio, e endeve en aquela dolor vehement, lahoras cove que tu al comensament fleubotomes le malaute, e aprop secca la ungla am spatum agut am seccio transversa desus en jus, e guarda te que la seccio no pervengua entro a la carn que es dejos la ungla, quar tu faras accidir al malaute dolor vehement, e sira causa a nativitat de la carn ajustada superflua en le loc; e aprop cura aquel loc am aquo que ceda dolor.	If however the nail has been struck by a hammer or an awl, and there is great pain in it, then when you begin to bleed the patient, dry the nail with a sharp scissor cut across it from above, and take care that the cut does not go into the flesh which is underneath the nail, for you would make more severe pain in the patient and cause the birth of excess flesh at that site; and then treat that site with water which softens the pain.
Mays dit ajustat, le qual es nat en las mas de alcus homes, fort leu es carnos tot, e fort leu so en lu osses, o fort leu es en lu ungla.	Then put it on a flat surface, which is born in the flesh of most people, very firm is the flesh everywhere, and very firm is the bone, or very firm is the nail.
E alcus de lu son natz en la razit de la junctura, o es la nativitat de lu en alcus nozes dels ditz.	And some of them are born in the root of a joint, or their birth is in some nuts from this.
Mays aquel que es nat en alcus nozes del dit no se mau, e aquest que es nat en las juncturas fort leu es maugut.	Then that which is born in some nuts of the above is not bad, and that which is born in joints is very hard to be cut.
E de aquels que son natz carnoses, la seccio es leugiera, e es que tu inscidas aquel deves la sua razitz am spatum lat.	And of those that are born flesh, the cut is light, and it is because you cut the root of this with a sharp scissor.
Mays de aquel que es nat en la razitz de la junctura, la curacio es dificil; e donc guarda te de la abscizio de lu.	Then from that which is born in the root of a joint, the cure is difficult; and therefore you should guard against the cutting off of it.
Mays en aquel que es nat en dit deves les nozes, cove que tu inscidas al comensament la carn de lu am inscizio redonda entro al os, e aprop serra am una de aquelas serras convenientz ad aquo, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Then from those nuts of the above, when you begin to cut the flesh of it with a round scissors into the bone, and then tie it up with one of those cords to water, and then treat that inside which is healed.
Mays consolidacio la qual accideys als ditz entre lor motas veguadas o per nativitat del home que nays enayssi, o per consolidacio de plagua o per combustio de foc, o per semblantz, adonc cove que secces aquela consolidacio entro que les ditz retorno a la sua forma natural.	Then the consolidation which happens to these between certain muscles or by the birth of a person who has not yet been born, or by the consolidation of plague or by fire, or by similarity, so that you dry up that consolidation within which those things return to their natural form.
E aprop pausa entre lor draps de li enfuzes en oli rozat per que no sian consolidatz leugierament, e separa entre aquels, o pausa entre aquels una lamina de plom subtil entro que sia consolidat segon que cove.	Then leave between them, or a leaf of lead between them, so that it is not consolidated lightly, and separate between them, or leave between them a thin layer of lead within which is consolidated as needed.
E semblantment si accideys consolidacio en alcus ditz am la palma, lahoras tu secca aquela consolidacio segon que es preparada e conveneys a la figura del membre.	And if consolidation happens in some nuts by the palm, then you dry up that consolidation according to what it is prepared and adapt it to the form of the limb.
De inscizio de vices, so son varicas.	Of scissor cuts, such are varicose veins.
Vices so son varicas, e so venas envolutas grossas plenas de superfluitatz melencolicas las quals veno en motz dels membres del cors, e le major adveniment de lor en las cambas, e majorment en las cambas dels itinerantz e dels laborantz e dels portantz.	Then such are varicose veins, and those are thick veins full of superfluous melancholy blood which comes to the legs, and most of all in the legs of travelers and laborers and carriers.
Adonc cove que tu administres purguacio del cors de colera negra alcunas veguadas am expulcio fort, e aprop sangna le pacient de la vena basilica.	Then you administer a purge of black cholera several times a day by strong vomiting, and then draw blood from the patient's basilic vein.
Mays la curacio de lor am ferr es segon dos manieyras: la una es que sia inscizas e sia atirat aquel sanc negre, e l’autra manieyra es que sia elevada la vena e sia extrayta tota.	Then the cure of them by iron is according to two ways: one is that it be cut and that black blood be drawn from it, and the other way is that it be raised and all that blood be drawn out.
La seccio de lu es segon aquesta manieyra: embroca al comensament la camba am aygua cauda mot entro que le sanc gros sia resolvut, que es feculent de la camba, e aprop strenh la camba del malaute a la partida pus sobirana de la coyssa entro a la partida dejos del denol am una benda, e aprop secca la vena en un loc, o en dos, o en tres am seccio ampla, e aprop eleva le sanc negra am la tieua ma de la partida dejos de la camba entro en sus, e desus en jus, entro que del sanc sia yssida la quantitat que voles e que vezes habastar, e la qual tollera la vertut del malaute.	Then the cutting of it is according to this way: immerse at the beginning the foot in cold water so that black blood is resolved, which is ferment from the foot, and then tighten the foot of the patient with a bandage at the top of the foot up to the toe, and then dry the vein in one, or two, or three places by cutting it wide, and then raise the black blood to the top of the foot up to the toe, and then take out the same quantity that you want and which is sufficient for the medicine, and that tolerates the power of the patient.
E aprop lia aquela, e comanda a lu que abstengua de las viandas colera negra engendrantz.	Then you prepare it, and order to him that he abstains from black cholera-producing foods.
E itera la curacio per fleubotomia quan las venas so umplidas e aquo notz al malaute.	Then the cure is by bleeding when veins are filled with blood, and feel the patient.
Mays la elevacio de lor es segon aquesta manieyra: tu que razas la camba del malaute, si en lu so motz pels, e aprop met le en banh e embroca la camba de lu am aygua cauda entro que s’enrogesesca e las venas sian exuberadas; o que sia exercitat per exercici fort, si banh no es a tu present, entro que·l membre sia scalfat.	Then the raising of them is according to this way: you that you rub the foot of the patient, if it is wet with water, and then immerse the foot in a bath and dry the foot with a cloth so that it cools off and the veins swell; or that it be exercised by strong exercise, if a bath is not at your disposal, so that the limb is scarred.
E aprop secsa la codena en le dreyt de la vena per seccio en le lonc o en le derier de lu deves le denol, o en le pus bas de lu deves lo talo.	Then dry the vein on the right side of the blood vessel by cutting it from behind to the front or from the back to the front of it, or cut it at the top or bottom of it with a sharp scissor.
E aprop uobre la codena am uncis e excorja la vena de tota part entro que appara al sentiment, e es deves la appericio de lu que vezes aquela roga declinant a negror.	Then cut the vein with nails and squeeze the vein from all parts until it appears on the surface, and it is necessary that that blood be black.
E donc cum evazeys e de la codena tu vezes aquela blanca quays sia corda.	Then therefore you empty, and of that vein sometimes that white thread is drawn out.
E aprop tu met dejos aquela le ray entro que sia elevada e sia gitada de la codena, e sospen aquela am onci orp leon.	Then you take off that bandage so that it is lifted and taken away from the vein, and suspend that with an orange-colored cord.
E aprop secsa autra seccio aprop aquela seccio per tres ditz, e aprop excorja la codena de la partida desus de la vena entro que apparia.	Then you dry another cut near that cut, and then squeeze the vein from above the vein where it appears.
E aprop eleva aquela e inscideys aquela en deriera seccio deves le talo, e aprop extratz aquela e eleva aquela entro que sia yssida per la seccio segonda, e aprop extratz aquela de la seccio que es sobre aquela.	Then you raise that and cut it from behind where the vein appears at the top of it, and then take out that from the second cutting where it appears, and then take out that from the cutting which is above it.
E fay aquo entro que extraguas aquela de la seccio que es pus sobirana o pus auta de totas las seccios, entro que tota es yssida; e lahoras inscideys aquela.	Then draw that out where you take it out of the second cutting which is higher or lower than all the cuts, so that all of it is taken out; and then cut it.
E si no obezeys a tu ad extrayre e elevar, lahoras intromet una agulha am fiel fort doble e ligua aquela e extratz la, o intromet dejos lu le ray e revolveys la tua ma a tota part entro qu’en sia getada.	Then if you do not obey me in taking out and raising it, then insert a double sharp hook into the vein with force and take it out, or turn the patient's hand over completely so that it is raised.
E guarda te que no sia inscidida; quar si es trencada, es fayt a tu dificil elevar aquela mot e es vengut sobre le malaute per aquela nocument.	Then take care that it is not cut; for if it is torn, then it is difficult to lift that part and it comes back on the foot by that wound.
E cum aquela tota auras fora-gitada, lahoras pausa sobre le loc de la plagua lana submerssa en vi e oli rozat e oli no-rozat, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Then when all of it is taken out, then you leave that place where plague lies in water and oil red and not red, and cure that inside which is healed.
E si la vit es contrayta havent tortuositat a la qual sia envolucio a las partidas, e no es segon rectitut segon que havem dit, lahoras cove que tu fendas sobre aquela a tota partida de tortuositat de lu e als locs de envolucio de lu, e aprop suspen aquela am uncis entro que eleves aquela tota.	Then if the wine is contracted by tortuosity on which those parts are wrapped, and it is not according to rectitude as we have said, then when you cut that completely at all parts of that tortuosity and those sites where those things are wrapped, and then suspend that with nails so that it is raised completely.
E guarda te deves la tua seccio que no inscidas la vena e que no plagues aquela, quar dificil sira a tu elevar aquela; e serva la tua prudencia en aquela.	Then you take care that your cutting of the vein does not hurt it and do not wound that, for it is difficult to lift that; and then serve your prudence in that.
Forma del inscident am le qual es seccada vit:	Form of the Scissor which is Dried Wine:
Forma de unci orp:	Form of Orange Cord:
No es a lu accuitat ayssi cum als uncis ni es de aguda extremitat per so que no plague la vena; e es de grossa flexibilitat leon, quar si era subtil, inscidira la vena per la sua subtilitat; habantz es en lu superflua grosseza ayssi cum havem dit.	It is not at your disposal accuti with nails, or it is of acute extremities so that the vein does not plague; and it is of coarse flexibility, for if it were subtle, it would cut the vein because of its subtility; it has superfluous coarseness in this way as well.
De extraccio venae cruris.	Of Vein Ex extraction
Aquesta vena es engendrada en las cambas en terras caudas ayssi cum al- Ategi en terra de Arabics e en las terras de India caudas e aridas de pauca teneritat e en las quals no nays erba ni aybre.	This vein is generated in the legs in tail-like shapes so that it is not at your disposal, as we have said, and in Arab lands and arid lands of little moisture and where there is no grass or shade.
E fort leu es engendrada en autres locs del cors otra las cambas.	Then very firm is generated in other parts of the body besides the legs.
E la gestacio de lu es de putrefaccio que ve dejos la codena ayssi cum venen dedintz le cors serpentz e vermps e scarides e verms engendrantz entre la codena e la carn.	Then the conception of it is from decay which comes from within the body, as we have said, and from snake-like, worm-like, scaly, and vermin-like things that are generated between the vein and the flesh.
E senhal de la suscepcio de l’adveniment de lu es de aquesta vena que accideys en la camba enflammacio vehement; e aprop le loc es vesicat; e aprop comensa la vena yssir del loc de aquela vesicacio quays sembla razit de planta.	Then the indication of the coming of it is from this vein which happens in the foot with violent swelling; and then that place is irritated; and then the vein swells from that place which seems like a root of a plant.
E adonc cum appar de lu la extremitat, lahoras cove que tu envolvas sobre aquela una pessa de plom del qual sia le pes de una drac. entro a ii drac., e noza aquela e layssa le plom suspendut de la camba.	And then bring out the end from him and cover it with a silver ring of which the weight is one dragon from two dragons, and let it hang from the chest.
E tantas veguadas cum yeys de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, envolveys aquo em plom e noza aquel.	And when you see any cause of the matter outside, wrap it in plumm and now take that.
E si mot es prolonguat, lahoras tu inscideys una partida de lu e envolopa le romanent; e no inscidas aquela de razit entro que sia fora yssida, quar si inscideys aquela es contrayta e intra en la carn e fa accidir apostema e poyredura en le loc e ulceracio mala.	And if it is prolonged, then you shall incise a part of the leg and wrap it around; and do not incise that which is inside unless it comes out, for if you incise that which is inside it will contract and go into the flesh and cause pus and corruption in the place and a bad ulcer.
Per que cove que sia tractada suaument e sia extrayta petit a petit, entro que sia fora-gitada del derier de lu e no remangua de lu alcuna causa en le cors.	So that it be treated smoothly and be taken out little by little, unless it comes out from behind the leg and does not remain stuck to anything in the body.
E de aquesta vena es yssit en alcus homes que es en la sua longitut de v palms e de detz e ja es pervengut a mi que yssic un de xx palms.	And of this vein I have seen in certain men who are of the length of five palms and of these I have already seen one that is of twenty palms.
E si es inscidida en la hora de la sua medicacio, lahoras intromet lo ray en le trauc de lu e perfora aquela am lonc trauc am le cors, entro que sia evacuat tot aquo que es en la materia, e administra putrefaccio del loc per alcus dias am medicinas; e aprop cura aquela per la curacio de apostemas.	And if it is incised at the time of its medicine, then you shall insert a long tool into the leg's hole and pierce that with a long instrument through the body, so that all the matter be evacuated, and administer corruption of the place for some days by medicines; and afterwards cure that by the cure of ulcers.
E aquesta vena alcunas veguadas ha motz ramps, e majorment quan apar a la junctura del pe o en le pe, e veno a lu motz orrificis, e es yssit de quascu orrifici ram.	And this vein sometimes has ramification, and more often when it appears in the joint of the foot or in the foot itself, and comes out through certain orifices, and from each orifice comes a ramification.
E donc cura aquela ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio e am aquo que es desus dit.	And therefore cure that in this way as we have said above in the division and at the water that is above it.
De sectione super vermes generatos sub cute et dicitur aegritudo bovina.	Of the section over worms that are generated under the skin and is called bovine disease.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en alcuna terra deves nos malautia bovina per so quar motas veguadas endeve als bious e es verm pauc un le qual es nat entre la codena e la carn, e va en tot le cos pujan e devalan, e es mostrat al sentiment deves le sieu anament de membre en membre entro que disromp la codena e yeys fora.	This disease is called in certain countries bovine disease because the worms are found only in cattle and are born between the skin and flesh, go throughout the body and break the skin and come out.
E la generacio de lu es per putrefaccio de alcunas humors ayssi cum accideysso verms e serpentz e lombrics e ascaridas en le ventre.	And the generation of these comes from the corruption of certain humours, as when worms and snakes and earthworms and ascarians come into the belly.
E es temut per la malicia de lu, quar quan el va en le cors e es elevat al cap, e es pervengut al huel, lahoras fort leu uebre en lu e intra e destruzeys le huel, e aquo endeve motas veguadas.	And it is feared because when it enters the body and rises to the head, and comes out into the air, then a strong fever will fall on it and destroy the brain, and in that place certain worms are seen.
E donc quan tu voles curar aquel e extraire lu, lahoras no se fa si no deves la sieua ambulacio e apparacio de lu al sentiment, e adonc cove que tu strenhas aquo que es sobre lu e aquo que es dejos lu am liament e constriccio fort, e aprop secca sobre lu e extratz aquel.	And therefore when you want to cure that and remove it, then do not go there unless you are aware of its movement and appearance, and afterwards tie what is above it tightly and with a strong grip, and then dry it out on it and take it away.
E si es preondat en la carn e no le atrobes, lahoras tu pausa cauteri am foc sobre le loc entro que mora, e la major causa que es temuda es corrupcio de lu am la qual corrump le loc ayssi cum havem dit.	And if it is hidden in the flesh and does not appear to you, then you shall make a cauterization on the place where it is, as we have said above. And the most common cause is the corruption of the wind that corrupts the place in this way.
May si tu vezes aquel esser pervengut al cap prop del huel, lahoras strenh sobre le sobrecil am fort strictura, e aprop secsa sobre lu, e extratz aquel; e cove que·l malaute use de mondificacio del sieu cors am medicinas evacuantz humors putridas malas, e guarda se de viandas generantz putrefaccio.	And if you find that it has come out to the head close to the belly, then tie it tightly above it with a strong grip and then dry it out on it; and when the patient uses digestive medicines to expel rotten bad humours, and keeps away from foods that generate corruption.
De sectione super aegritudinem nafir.	Of the section over the disease of nafir.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en nostra terra nafir, e es dolor la qual ve en alcus membres, e aprop es permudada de membre en membre.	This disease is called in our country nafir, and it is a painful disease that appears in several limbs, and sometimes changes from one limb to another.
E yeu ja e vista aquela segon que yeu te recomtare.	And you have already seen this as I recommended to you.
Yeu fu apelat a una femna malauta ad una vila, e descubric le sieu bras e vi una imflacio petita en la vena funis del bras, e pus que fu romas per una hora, vi aquela imflacio anar ayssi cum va verm pujan ad aquest, mays pus leugierament que esser por, ayssi cum si fos argent viu quan corr de loc en loc.	A woman with the disease was brought to a town, and I discovered her arm and saw a small swelling in the vein of the arm, and after an hour it had become much bigger, as if it were living silver running from place to place.
E adonc anet s’en la dolor de aquel loc e fiquet se en le muscle, e aprop aqui stec per una hora.	Then he sat down in that place of pain and put it in the muscle, and after an hour it became smaller.
E aprop correc en l’autre cors entro que pervenc al autre bras.	And then it healed in the other side, reaching the other arm.
E aprop recomtec a mi que revolvia se per tot le cors sieu segon que yeu vi; e fo trop meravelat de la permutacio de lu e de la velocitat de membre en membre.	And then I told him to turn himself around from side to side as you have seen me; and he was very amazed by the change of place and the speed from one limb to another.
E yeu ja havia vist denant aquo en les mieus huels segon aquela manieyra, empero yeu he vistz motz les quals atroban dolor esser permutada de membra a membre.	And you have already seen ahead of me in this way, but you have not seen the many changes that I make when the disease changes from one limb to another.
Mays no vi aquo am les huels ayssi cum en la femna.	However, in that woman.
E yeu no cogiti esser aquo sino que es per aquo quar la femna era de viela, on so de secs cors e de venas descubertas, e en aquesta apparec al sentiment aquela ventositat permutada.	And you did not think that it was me, but by the water because the woman was of an age when the body is dry and the veins are exposed, and in this way the disease appears to the sense.
E es necessari que no apparesca segon aquesta retro-curacio en aquels que son delicioses e am cors humitz de venas ameguadas.	And it is necessary that you do not appear according to this reverse cure in those who are delightful and have soft veins.
E cum tu voles la curacio de lu, e le pacient sent aquela dolor, lahoras no es a tu aparent al huel ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras tu strenh sobre aquel e dejos lu leugierament e secse sobre aquel entro que sia yssida aquela ventositat coartada, e cauterize le loc.	And when you want to cure it and the patient feels pain, then do not appear to him at the water as we have said above; then tie it tightly and dry it out on it, and then stop the wind by cauterizing the place.
Mays si tu no la vezes am los tieus huels, alhoras tu cura aquel am excussio del cors e am aquo que expelleys ventositatz, e carmina aquelas am pillulas fetidas e am pillulas de serapi e semblantz.	However, if you do not see it in the exposed veins, then heal it by draining the body and expelling the winds, and use pills of fermented wine and similar ones.
De extraccio de sagetas.	Of the extraction of arrows.
Sagetas son diversificadas segon las specias, e segon les locs dels cors en les quals cazo, quar la lor diversitat es que de aquellas so que han grans puntas, e petitas, e concavas, e sordas, so es solidas; e de lor so que han tres angles, e de aquelas a las quals so que han lenguas; e de aquelas a las quals so astelas.	Arrows are different depending on the type of wood they are made from, and depending on their position in the body, since their variety is that some have large points, others small, and concavity, and others flatness, and some have three angles, and those to which it has tongues; and those by which they are star-shaped.
E aquela que es segon les membres e las pessas en las quals cazo es segon dos manieyras: quar les membres o so membres principals concaus, ayssi cum le cervel, le cor, e·l fitge, e le pulmo, e les ronhos, e les budels, e la vezica, e a lor semblantz; e donc quan catz en alcu de aquestz membres e aparo a tu senhals de mort, la qual causa yeu recomtare aprop, lahoras cove que tu evites extraccio de aquela sageta en aquels quar la mort siec aquel en le qual en las majors disposicios, e quan a tu no appareysso aquestz mals senhals, e la sageta no es amaguada en la profunditat del membre, lahoras tu extratz aquela e cura la plagua.	And that which is according to the limbs and feet in which it appears is according to two ways: because these members or principal members are concaved, as the brain, heart, neck, lung, air sacs, bowels, bladder, and their likenesses; and then when you avoid the extraction of that arrow from those who die with the symptoms of death that I have recommended, then, if you do not appear to these evil signs, and the arrow is not buried in the depth of the member, then extract it and heal the plague.
E dels senhals del servel es quan catz en lu sageta, e trespassa le os, e es yssit del cyphac le qual es sobre le cervel, quar accideys per lu soda vehement, e scotomia, e vertige, e rogor en les huels, e imflamacio e rogor de la lengua, e spasme e permixtio de entendament e vomi de colera, e fort leu es abscindida la paraula e es destruida la votz, e es yssit del loc de la plagua humiditat blanca semblant a pols, e yeys de lu semblant ad aquositat de la carn.	And of the signs of death are when an arrow pierces the skull, and passes through the bone, and is extracted from the nape which is over the brain, for this happens because of the violent heat, and convulsions, and stiffness of the tongue, and spasms, and confusion of thought, and vomiting of colera, and a strong pain is cut off the word, and it is destroyed at the place of the disease. It leaves a white moisture like sweat, and there remains in it the appearance of water from the flesh.
E donc si appareyso a tu aquestz senhals, lahoras tu abste de la curacio e de la extraccio de la sageta, si non es fora.	And therefore, if you show these signs to me, then you should abstain from the cure and from extracting the arrow, unless it comes out.
Mays les senhals de la sageta quan catz en le cor, so que ela es prop de la mamila senestra, e sent am aquela quays sia ficada en causa dura, e no es causa vueda; e fort leu le movement de la sageta es semblant a movement del pols, e corr de la plagua sanc negra, e siec aquel fregiditat de las extremitatz, e suzor freja, e sincopi; e donc sapias que la mort descen ses tot dopte.	However, the signs of death are when an arrow pierces the heart, so that it is close to the left side, and you feel a pain in it as if it were stuck in hard ground, and there is no feeling of sight; and a strong movement of the arrow seems like a movement of pulse, and the disease of black blood comes out, and a coldness of the extremities, and a strange rattle, and fainting; and then know that death has come.
E les senhals quan la sageta ha plaglat le pulmo so eyssiment de sanc spumos de la plagua, e les vayssels que so prop del col so apostematz, e es mudada la color del malaute, e expira sperit gran aut, e demanda atraccio de ayre freg.	And when the arrow has struck the lung, then it feels a pain in it as if water were coming out, and the vessels that are close to it put forth pus, and the color of the man is changed, and he breathes deeply and asks for air.
E si catz la sageta en le velament le qual es en le pietz, e la dolor lahoras es prop de las costas petitas, e es fayt le ale gran am vehement dolor e am sospir, e no so maugutz totz les membres dels muscles.	And if he catches the arrow in the veil that is on his foot, and the pain is then near his small ribs, and it is done with great sharp pain and sighing, and does not hurt all the members of the muscles.
E si catz la sageta en le stomac, lahoras fort leu yeys de la plagua vianda alcuna indigesta.	And if he catches the arrow in his stomach, then strong vomiting will follow from the digestive disease.
E si catz la sageta en le ventre, e es ficada en lu, yeys alcuna fenda de la plagua, o la tela, o budel le qual es disromput, e no es speransa en la curacio de lu extraccio de la sageta.	And if he catches the arrow in his belly, and it is stuck there, then there is a tear of the plague, or the hernia, or the bowel that has ruptured, and there is no hope for the extraction of the arrow.
E si la sageta catz en la vesica, e es yssida defora urina, e procesesca de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, e fort leu es dolor sobre le malaute, lahoras sapias que es mortal.	And if the arrow catches in the bladder, and it comes out with urine, and there is some cause for it to come out quickly, and the pain is very sharp on the thigh, then know that it is deadly.
Mays les autres membres ayssi cum es la cara, le col, e·l golayro, e las spallas e le adjutori, e les spondils del dos, e la furcula, e la coysa, e la camba e a lor semblantz dels membres, son salvatz segon las majors disposicios quan la sageta no atroba vena ni arteria e no es sageta venenosa.	May the other members also be saved if it is the face, the neck, the throat, and the back, and the assistant, and the spinal bones of the back, and the hernia, and the crotch, and the hips, and similar members, are saved according to the greatest dispositions when the arrow does not hit a vein or artery, and is not a poisoned arrow.
E yeu recomtare aquo a tu que he vist del esser de aquestas sagetas, per que signifiques per aquo sobre la curacio tieua.	And I recommend that you see the nature of these arrows, so that you may be aware of their treatment.
La qual causa es, quar en un home cazec sageta en le lacrimal del huel de lu en la razitz del nas, e yeu extrayssi aquela a lu del autra partida, dejos le grays de l’aurelha de lu, e es sanat, e no accidic en le huel de lu nocument.	That is the cause, for when a man catches an arrow in his eye at the root of his nose, and I extracted it from him without any injury to his eye, and I healed it, and nothing happened to his eye.
E extrayssi autra sageta a un Juzeu la qual cazec en lu en lo grays del sieu huel, dejos la palpebra pus dejos, e la sageta ja era occultada e no so conseguit de aquela sino una petita extremitat am la qual adhereys al sieu fust, e era gran sageta de las sagetas agudas dels Turcs , am ferr leon en la qual no havia aurelhas.	And I extracted another arrow from a judge who caught it in his eye at the roots of his eyebrows, leaving his eyelids intact, and the arrow was hidden, and there was not even a small piece of it left; it was a sharp arrow of the Turks, with a lion's head attached to it.
E senat es le Juzieu , e no accidic en le sieu huel mal accident.	And that judge was old, and nothing bad happened to his eye.
E extrayssi una autra sageta a un home Crestia la qual era cazuta en le golayro, e era sageta arabica, e es aquela a la qual so aurelhas; e adonc yeu inscidegui sobre aquela entre doas guidegi, e ja era submersa en le golayro de lu; e adonc yeu so subtiliat am aquela, e aprop extraxi aquela, e es sanat le Crestia .	And I extracted another arrow from a Christian who fell in his throat; it was an Arabic arrow, and it had two auras; and then I cut it between the two guides, and it was already submerged in his throat; and then I carefully removed that one, and it healed the Christian.
E extraxi autra sageta a un home la qual era cazuta en le sieu ventre, e cogitegui que moris per aquela; e donc, pus que foro passatz xxx dias e no es mudat sobre lu alcuna causa de las suas disposicios, inscidegui sobre la sageta e engenagui sobre aquela, e es sanat, e no accidic a lu accident mal.	And I extracted another arrow from a man who fell in his belly; I thought he would die because of the arrow, and then, since it did not change its position for thirty days for any cause of its dispositions, I cut it with a knife and removed it, and it healed him, and nothing bad happened to him.
E vi mays un home en le qual cazec una sageta en le dos de lu, e consolidada es la plagua sobre lu, e pus que foc aprop set ans, yssic la sageta en la razitz de la coyssa.	And I saw another man who caught an arrow in his thigh, and the plague was established on him, and then, after seven years, he caught the arrow in the surface of his crotch.
E vi una femna a la qual cazec sageta en le sieu ventre, e la plagua es consolidada dedintz lu, e no es mudada en las suas disposicios en re, e la femna no atrobec nocument en alcunas de las suas opperacios naturals.	And I saw a woman who caught an arrow in her belly, and the plague was established inside her, and did not change its dispositions in regard to the natural order of things, and the woman did not suffer any harm in some of her natural qualities.
E vi un autre home al qual cazec sageta en la sua cara e consolidada es la plagua e romas la sageta, no atrobant aqui mota dolor, e motz semblantz ad aquestz.	And I saw another man who caught an arrow in his face, and the plague was established on him, and it split the arrow, causing him no pain, but he looked similar to those people.
E extrayssi la sageta del home dels princeps del rey que era cazuda en le mieg loc del nas sieu e ja havia declinat a la partida dreyta un petit, e occultada era tota la sageta.	And I extracted the arrow from the prince of the king that fell in his right nostril, and it had already fallen to the right side a little, and the entire arrow was hidden.
E yeu fu appelat a la curacio de lu aprop le cazement de la sageta entro a tres dias.	And I was called to heal him from the moment when the arrow hit him.
E adonc yeu atrobegui la plagua de la sageta mot streyta; e adonc yeu inquirigui aquela am tenta subtil, e no sentigui aquela; mays el la sentia puncio dejos la aurelha dreyta, e adonc speregui que aquela punccio era per la extremitat de la sageta.	And then I turned the arrow slightly to the right; and then I felt that it was a sharp point; but the man could not feel the touch of the point, but he felt a pain in his ear on the right side, and then I understood that it was because of the arrow's head.
E amplastregui le loc am emplaustre en le qual es vertut atrectiva e digestiva, confizant de mi que·l loc se apostemes per que appares a mi le loc de la sageta, per que secces sobre aquela.	And I applied an ointment to the place with a plaster that is active and digestive, assuring myself that the place will be kept so that it appears to me the place of the arrow, so that it heals on top of it.
E no accidic en le loc accident significant que la sageta hagues conseguit aquel loc; e yeu continuegui am le emplaustre sobre lu per motz dias e no accidic accident; e consolidada es la plagua entretant, e romas le malaute de la extreccio de lu per spazi de motz dias entro que un jorn sentic la sageta dintz le sieu nas e recontec aquo a mi.	And nothing bad happened in that place, which was the place where the arrow had been caught; and I continued to apply the plaster to it for many days, and the plague was established during that time, and it split his nose from one side to another in the space of five days, until one day he felt the arrow hit his nose again, and then I understood where the arrow was.
E adonc yeu pausegui sobre la plagua medicina acuta corrosiva per motz dias entro que foc ubert, e am la tenta yeu assagegui aquel, e atrobegui la extremitat de la sageta subtil, la qual adhereys al fust.	And then I applied an acute corrosive medicine to the plague for several days, until it was well healed, and then, at my request, he felt that medicine, and I discovered the tip of the arrow, which was attached to the bone.
E aprop yeu ajustegui en la apersio de la plagua per aquela medicina acuta entro que apparec a mi visiblament la extremitat de la sageta, e passec a mi temps am aquo per le spazi de temps entro quatre meses.	And then I applied an acute medicine to the plague, which appeared to me clearly the tip of the arrow, and then it disappeared from my sight for four months.
E aprop pus que la plagua foc amplificada, e foc a mi possible entrometre las forfexs en lu, e remaure aquela, e no obezic ad eyssiment, lahoras yeu no cessegui subtiliar e ingeniar sobre aquela am manieyras de engen, entro que comensegui un dia sobre aquela am manieyras de engens pendre lu am forceps descentment faytas, segon que vindra la forma de aquelas en la fi del capitol, entro que extraxi aquela; e aprop restauregui aquela plagua.	And then the plague became more severe, and I entered it with my instruments, and removed it, and I did not cut off a little of it, but I carefully removed it with forceps that made small cuts, according as the shape of those came at the end of this chapter, until I extracted it; and then I healed the plague.
E alcus metges jutgavan que la cartillage del nas no es restaurada, e yeu restauregui aquela e la plagua es consolidada, e sanat es le malaute per sanetat entiera, e no noguec en lu en deguna causa.	And some doctors said that the cartilage of the nose had not been restored, and I restored it, and the plague was established, and it healed completely, and did not leave any mark on it for any cause.
E yeu recomti a tu la qualitat de extraccio de alcunas sagetas per que pauses aquo regla e significacio sobre aquo que no he dit, quar las partidas de aquesta art e las difinicios de aquela no so conprehendudas am narracio ni no comprehen aquelas le libre.	And I recommend to you the nature of extracting some arrows from the nose, so that you pause here with me, and understand it, because the nature of this art and the definitions of those things are not understood by me, for I have not studied them in writing.
E le artifexs savi compara am pauc sobre mot; e am aquo que es present sobre aquo que es absent; e atroba operacio novela e instrument novel deves le descendement de las causas extranhas del art quan accideysso.	And the skilled workers know by little, and here what is known is more than what is not known, and they have new operations and new instruments to remove foreign causes of the disease when it occurs.
E donc yeu dic que sagetas no son fora-gitadas dels membres en les quals son ficadas sino segon dos manieyras: o per atraccio del loc en le qual intrec; o per le contrari de la autra partida.	And therefore I say that arrows are not caused by foreign objects in the members where they are stuck, but only by two ways: either because of the attraction of the place where they are fixed; or because of the opposite of their departure.
E aquela que es gitada per le loc don es intrada, o es sageta procedent en loc carnos, e es atirada e fora-gitada.	And that which is caused by the attraction of the place where it is fixed is called an internal cause; and that which proceeds from a different location is called an external cause, and that which is shot out and then becomes foreign is called an projected cause.
E si no obezeys a eyssiment de la hora en la qual catz, lahoras cove que tu la laysses per alcus dias entro que poyresca la carn que es al enviro de lu, e sia alleujada l‘atraccio de lu e la sua egressio.	And if you do not respond to it immediately, then know that the arrow will remain in place for several days before you can examine the flesh that is around it, and that the attraction of it will be removed, and its exit from the body will be stopped.
E semblantment si es ficada en os e no obezeys a tu a eyssiment, lahoras layssa aquela per alcus dias e itera aquela am atraccio e mocio en quascun dia, e ja es fora-gitada.	And seemingly, if it is stuck in the bone and you do not respond to it immediately, then leave it for several days, and repeat applying attraction and moisture to it every day; and then it will be shot out.
E si no obezeys a tu eyssiment aprop alcus dias, lahoras cove que tu perforas en le circuit de la sageta en aquel os de tota partida am taravel subtil entro que·l loc sia amplificat de la sageta, e aprop extratz aquela.	And if you do not respond to it immediately for several days, then know that you must pierce the path of the arrow in that bone completely with a very sharp instrument, so that the place is enlarged where the arrow is, and then extract it.
E si la sageta es ficada en le os del cap e ja ha procezit en un dels ventres del cervel, e apparo en le malaute alcus de aquels accidentz les quals yeu e ditz, lahoras abste de la extraccio de la sageta e layssa aquela entro que·l sieu esser sia equat aprop alcus dias; quar si la sageta perve al ciphac, lahoras la mort no es a lu prolonguada.	And if the arrow is stuck in the bone of the head and has already reached one of the vessels of the brain, and appears in the headache that I described, then abstain from extracting the arrow, and leave it for several days; because, if the arrow has reached the center of life, then death will be prolonged for him.
E si la sageta no es ficada sino en le cors del os tant solament e no passa entro al ciphac, e roman le malaute per alcus dias, e no accideys a lu denguna causa de aquels accidentz, lahoras tu engenia en la atraccio de la sageta e en la atraccio de lu.	And if the arrow is not stuck in any of the bones, but only in the middle of life and has not reached the center of death yet, and remains in place for several days without causing any cause of those accidents, then you will be able to extract it with your skills and with your abilities.
Mays si es mot ficada e no obezeys a tu a extraccio, lahoras tu aministra taravels en le circuit de la sageta ayssi cum havem recomtat, e aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat.	If it is mot and does not obey your extract, then you administer taravels on the path of the arrow as I have described, and then care for the site until it is healed.
Mays si la sageta ja es amaguada en le loc del cors, e es amaguada del sentiment, lahoras tu inquireys aquela am tenta, e si tu sentas aquela, lahoras atira aquela am alcus sturmentz les quals so convenientz a la atraccio de lu.	If the arrow has already entered the body and is embedded in the flesh, then you will examine that area and if you feel it, then shoot it with a sharp instrument suitable for the draw of the arrow.
E si no podes sobre lu per la constriccio de la plagua e per la longitut del preon, e aqui no es os ni nervi ni vena, lahoras tu fen sobre la plagua entro que sia amplificada e que sia possible extrayre la sageta.	And if you cannot get to it due to the constriction of the wound and its length, and there is no fat, nerve, or vein here, then you will come from above, into the wound, so that it expands and the arrow can be extracted.
E si so a lu aurelhas am las quals sia tenguda, lahoras tu deliura la carn en la qual es ficada de tota partida am tot le engen que poyras far; e ingenia sobre aquo, si no podes sobre la evasio de la carn en la fractura de las aurelhas e en torssio de aquelas entro que obezesca.	And if it has been inserted into the auricle which is held in place, then you will free the flesh where it is stuck from all sides as much as you can; and devise a way to extract it, if you cannot do so due to the flesh's attachment in the fracture of the auricle and its torsion within.
E quan tu administras la extraccio de la sageta en quascun loc on sia, lahoras tu usa am torcio de la tua ma am forceps a totas partidas entro que fassa aquela obezir; e subtilia am deriera subtilitat que la sageta no sia trencada e que sia fayta a tu dificil atraccio de lu e de aquela extraccio.	And when you administer the extraction of the arrow from any location, then use your hand with forceps at all times until it causes that person pain; and do this very carefully so that the arrow does not break and becomes difficult to extract.
E si no podes sobre aquela de la tua hora, lahoras tu layssa per alcus dias entro que se poyrescan las partidas que so en le circuit de lu, e aprop itera aquela quar lahoras es alleujada.	And if you cannot get to that person due to the time, then leave it for a few days until the parts heal up again from their movement in the path of the arrow; and then repeat what you did when it was relieved.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat flux de sanc, lahoras tu administra aquo que havem dit de curacio en le sieu capitol.	If it causes the patient discomfort during the treatment, then you will administer the water that I have mentioned for cure in this chapter.
E guarda la tua vertut de inscizio de vena o de nervi, o de corda, e aministra engen en tota manieyra a tu possibla de la evasio de la sageta; e fay aquo am facilitat e tranquillitat e tarditat e fermetat ayssi cum yeu e a tu recomtat.	And keep your skill of incision of veins or nerves, or strings, and administer it to all possible ways of the arrow's extraction; and do so with ease, quietness, slowness, and firm determination, as well as you can and I will describe.
E donc que fassas contrayre la sageta per so que·l malaute sia segon la figura segon la qual foc deves le cazement de la sageta en lu, quar es mays juvatiu.	And therefore you will extract the arrow in such a way that the patient is comfortable; for it is more convenient to place it according to the figure that I have described, as it is easier to heal.
Mays si aquo no es a tu possible, lahoras tu aministra aquo que es a tu possible per las figuras.	If this water is not possible for you, then administer what is possible for you according to the figures.
Mays las sagetas que son fora-gitadas per le contrari del autra partida, o que ja de lu procezeys alcuna partida a las partidas de fora, o fa gilbositat la extramitat de la sageta per sentiment de la partida pus desus de la codena propdana e vezes aquela eminent; adonc tu secsa sobre aquela; e sia la seccio segon la quantitat en la qual prenguan las forceps; e aprop atira aquela, quar ela es fayta leugiera a eyssiment.	If the arrows that are shot out of the body are opposite to another part, or if you already feel any pain in the parts above the armpit, and if the tip of the arrow is protruding from under the skin near the base, then cut it off; and do so according to how much your forceps reach; and then throw it away, for it is done lightly without causing too much pain.
Mays si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu tortz lama segon contrarietat entro que la sageta enprema en le os, e amplifique a si meteys, e aprop extratz aquela.	If it is stuck in the bone, then you will twist your hand according to the pain within which the arrow pushes into the bone, and increase the twisting; and then extract it.
E sino, layssa aquela per alcus dias, e aprop itera aquela entro qu’en yesca.	And if not, leave it for a few days, and then repeat what you did until it burns.
E si le fust de la sageta es en aquela, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am lu.	If the tip of the arrow is in that person's head, then you will push it with your hand.
Mays si le fust es cazut e voles aministrar inpulsio, lahoras tu intromet e aquela, si es sorda, sturment concau per so que intre la concavitat de lu en la coa de la sageta e aprop impelleys aquela am lu.	If the tip is stuck and you want to administer impact, then place your hand on its head, if it is deaf, and strike with a sharp instrument so that it enters between the hollow of the skull and the arrow's base; and then push it with your hand.
Mays si la sageta es concava, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am sturment fort intrant en aquela, quar la sageta es alleujada per aquela.	If the arrow is hollow, then you will push it with a strong instrument entering into that person, for the arrow is relieved by that person.
E si la sageta es entoxiguada, lahoras cove que tu concaves tota la carn en la qual es le vere, si es a tu possible aquo, e aprop cura aquela am aquo que si conveneys.	And if the arrow is poisoned, then cover all the flesh with water where it is stuck, if you can; and then care for that person with water.
E si la sageta catz en le pietz, o en le ventre, o en la vesica, o en le costat, e es propinqua per so que tu tocas aquela am la tenta, e es a tu possible secsar sobre aquela, lahoras secsa sobre aquela e guarda te de inscizio de vena o de nervi, e extratz aquela, e aprop cos la plagua si indigeys, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	If the arrow enters into the foot, or the belly, or the bladder, or the rib, and it is close to your hand, and you can cut it off with a sharp instrument, then do so; and then, if it causes pain, care for that area until it is healed.
Forma de forceps am las quals so atiradas las sagetas:	Form of forceps which the arrows are thrown:
Sian las extremitatz de lor cum a bec de ausel que son faytas cum serra quan prendon sobre la sageta per so que no la layssen.	Keep both hands on the ends of the pliers which are used to throw the arrows with a serrated edge, so that they do not let go of the arrow.
E de aquelas son faytas motas specias, grans, paucas e migieras, segon la quantitat de la grandeza de la sageta e de la sieua pauqueza, e de la amplitud de la plagua, e de la constriccio de lu.	And of those special types are made: large, small, few, and many, according to the size of the arrow and its power, and the width of the wound, and the constriction of the flesh.
Forma de impellent concau de aquesta extremitat conquava ayssi cum pena de ausel per so que sia alleujat le intrament de la sageta en lu, e impulcio de aquela sorda:	Form of sharp instrument coming from this convex end which is used to push the arrow into the flesh, and pushing with that deaf one:
Forma de impellent de sorda extremitat:	Form of pushing with a deaf end:
ayssi cum ray per so que sia alleujat le intrament de lu en la sageta concava e es impellida am aquel.	so that the instrument is pushed into the flesh, and it pushes with that one.
De fleubotomia de las venas.	Of bloodletting from veins.
Las venas de fleubotomia de las quals corr costuma de fleubotomar so .xxx., de las quals so en le cap .xvi., so es doas venas pulsatils las quals so aprop las aurelhas, dic alhasisain; doas herbas que so en les dos templars apparentz; e doas venas que so en dos lacrimals de dos huels que son appeladas aspicientz; e la vena preparada en le mieg loc del front, e la vena que es en la extremitat del nas; e doas guidegi que so al col; e doas venas que so en la labia desus; e doas venas que so en la labia dejos; e — aquestas so las venas que so appeladas algelic —; e so doas venas que so dejos la lengua.	The veins from which bloodletting is done from those which commonly bleed: 1, 2, 3. of those which are in the head. The following veins are in the head: those which pulse at the ears, they are called auricular; those which come from the temples, they are called temporal; those which come from the two holes of the nose, they are called nasal; and those which come from the lips on the left side, they are called labial-left; and those which come from the lips on the right side, they are called labial-right.
Mays las venas que so fleubotomadas en les brasses so .v.; quar de aquelas es una cephalica, e es deves le latz silvestre; e le poble appela “la vena del cap”, e sorda, e es vena migiera, e es composta de un ram de la basilica, e de autre ram de la cephalica; e nomna aquela le poble “vena de tot le cors”, e basilica es vena la qual es pausada en le latz domestic, e es nomnada “citillar”, e nompnan aquela les vulguars “vena del ventre”; e funis del bras, e es pausada sobre le focil, e es aquela en la qual es fleubotomat, e es aquela que appar sobre le poutz per apparicio manifesta; e salvatella, e es la vena que es entre lo dit auricular e·l pus petit dit, e so en lu dos ramps.	If there is a pulse in the arms, it is five; and if there is a pulse in the legs, it is six. This head vein is one that is wild, and it is called the wild vein; and the people call it "the head vein", and it is deaf, and it is a major vein, and it consists of one branch from the temple, and another from the head; and this branch is called "citillar"; and this other one is called by the common people "the navel vein"; and that which comes from the arm, and it is paused on the breast, and this is the vein that is stopped in the rib; and this one is in front of the armpit, and it has two branches.
E en le pe e la camba so tres venas; la una de aquelas es que es dejos la curvatura del denolh del latz silvestre; e la segonda es sophena, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz domestic; e la vena sciatica, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz silvestre; e en la camba son autras venas semblantz ad aquelas.	In the chest and on the back there are three veins: one of those is located under the rib cage to the left side of the body; a second one is called a small vein, and its location is next to the rib cage on the right side of the body; and a third one is called the sciatic vein, and its location is next to the back of the rib cage on the left side of the body; and in the back there are other veins similar to those.
Le juvament de las venas que so aprop las aurelhas es a cataris antics e emigranea e sahafati e ulceracios del cap malas antiquas.	The healing of veins which are cut near the ears is made with small, emigrant, and sanguineous bloodletting from the head's bad old wounds.
E la qualitat de sagnar aquelas es segon que yeu recomti a tu: es que sia ras le cap del malaute, e sia freguat le cap del malaute en le occipiti en le loc de amdoas las venas am drap ample am bona fricacio; aprop strenha le malaute le sieu col am una benda entro que apparan las doas e les locs de lor so aprop las aurelhas en dos locs depremegutz del cap; e quereys aquela am le tieu dit, e si tu sentes le pols de aquelas am le dit tieu, aqui senha am tenta.	And the quality of healing such wounds is according to whether you have looked at them again: if it is a hair from the head, and that hair has been cut on the back of the head in the location of both veins next to the ears with a sharp scissors, then you will tie that head with a bandage tightly, so that there is no movement; and you will massage the head with good oil; and if you feel the pulse of those veins with your finger, then you will try again.
Aprop tu pren la lancea cutellar, e es aquela que es inscident, e aprop tu intromet aquel dejos la vena en la codena entro que·l fleubotomi vengua al os.	Then you will take the knife, and it is sharp, then try again; and if you do not feel the pulse of that vein with your finger, then cut off that one from within the joint until it comes out; and place your hand over the site so that the blood does not come out.
E aprop eleva la tua ma am la vena e la codena a las partidas desus e inscideys la vena am inscizio inscident.	And then you will raise your hand to the vein and the joint above, and cut off that vein with a sharp knife; and make an incision in the vein with a sharp scalpel.
E sia la longitut de la inscizio la quantitat de dos ditz ajustatz o entorn de aquo; e fay yssir del sanc atant quant voles.	And the length of the incision is the quantity of two dizajustats or around water; and make it from the sankat as many as you want.
E aprop strenh am pulvils e layssa aquela entro que sia sanada.	Then tie him with the pulleys and leave that in place which is to be healed.
E ja e precedit en le comensament del libre la inscizio de aquelas e de lor la cauterizacio.	And already at the beginning of this book, we have described the incision of those and their cauterization.
Mays de las doas venas arterias que so als templars le juvament de la fleubotomia es a emigranea antiqua e sode malvada e obtalmia assidua e cors de superfluitatz acutas effusas als huels.	More than two blood vessels that are used in the cauterization of the veins is to emigrant ancient and persistent evil and frequent headaches and sharp fluid flowing into the skin.
E la qualitat de fleubotomar aquelas es segon que yeu recomti a tu: constrengua le malaute le sieu col mot entro que apparan las doas venas al sentiment per appericio manifesta e sia demonstrat le pols de lor dejos le tieu dit; e lahoras tu senha am tenta.	And the quality of bloodletting is according to that which I recommend to you: Tie up the patient's legs with a rope so that their two veins appear on the surface by visible movement and are demonstrated by the pulse at their feet, and then try it yourself.
E aprop tu eleva la codena desobre la vena a las partidas desus am le tieu dit indic, e intromet le fleubotomi inscident dejos, e eleva la vena en sus; e inscidey aquela ayssi cum has fayt en las doas venas autras; e fay correr del sanc segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	Then you shall raise the rope so that the vein is opened from above with your finger, and insert the bloodletting needle into it, and raise the vein up; and cut those too with what you have done in the two veins; and let run the blood according to the quantity of your need.
E aprop deslia la coartacio del malaute, e pausa le tieu dit sobre la vena per una hora, e aprop pausa sobre aquela coto e pulvils e strenh aquela desus am fort constriccio, e layssa aquela entro que sia sanada.	Then take off the patient' bandage, and place your finger on the vein for an hour, and then place the pulleys and strings on it and tighten them strongly, and leave that in place which is to be healed.
E ja es precedida la rememoracio de lor, e de aquelas la inscizio, e la atraccio en le comensament del libre.	And already at the beginning of this book, we have recalled their healing, and their incision, and their cauterization.
E donc le juvament de fleubotomia de la vena del front es aprop la fleubotomia de la cephalica a las malautias antiquas de la cara e a emigranea e rogor e ulceracios fetidas.	And therefore the healing of bloodletting from the forehead vein is to the bloodletting of the cerebral veins for ancient headaches and emigrant, rigor and putrid ulcers.

Pausa la puncta eminent la qual es al cap del fossori sobre aquela vena e percuteys sobre lu am penche o am autre causa en la manieyra de lu, e layssa lo sanc correr segon la quantitat la qual voles; e aprop deslia la perforacio del malaute e strenh aquela entro que sia sanada. E alcunas veguadas es uberta am fleubotomi lat, empero no cove que·l fleubotomi sia de acuta extremitat ayssi cum les autres fleubotomis, abantz sia de lada extremitat, e fleubotoma aquela segon le tranvers, quar le os es propda e fort leu trencaria en lu le fleubotomi quan es subtil.	And some blood has been opened with a needle, but it is not known that the bloodletting is of acute extremities as well as the others bloodletting; unless it is on one side, because the bone is strong and hard it would break in it the bloodletting if subtile.
Mays le juvament de las duas venas que so als lacrimals de dos huels per scabia del huels per rogor e sebol en les huels, e a las malautias de la cara.	More than two veins that are on the eyelids of two eyes because of the skin's roughness due to rigor and seborrhea in the eyelids, and for ancient headaches in the face.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia es que·l malaute strenha le col sieu am una benda, e aprop fleubotoma aquelas, e tu sias stant sobre le cap de lu.	And the quality of bloodletting is that the patient ties himself with a rope, and then bloodletting those, and you are standing on its head.
