Mays le fleubotomi de la vena del nas es conferent a febre acuta e a soda vehement, e a las malautias de la cara e emigranea e rogor que accideys en la cara, e majorment quan es antiqua.	More than the bloodletting of the nose is appropriate for acute fever and intense pain, and for ancient headaches and emigrant that occur in the face, especially when it is old.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute strenha le sieu col e aprop te le sieu nas am la tua ma sinistra, e pren le fleubotomi subtil lonc e fica aquela en le mieg loc del cap del nas segon rectitut, quar la vena no appar al sentiment aqui, e quar le sanc comensa a fluir tantost.	And the quality of bloodletting is that the patient ties himself with a rope and then holds his left nose with your right hand, and take the subtle needle long and hold it in its place on the nose according to the direction, because the vein does not appear by feeling here, and because the blood begins to run as soon as possible.
Cove que tu ultimes la tua ma am le fleubotomi petit a petit e fassas correr del sanc segon la tua necessitat; e aprop lia aquela per una nuoyt, quar aquela es restaurada leugierament. Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de las doas guidegui a constriccio de ale e a comensament de lepra e a motas malautias e inpetige e malas ulceracios corrosivas ayssi cum herpotromeno.	More than the healing of bloodletting is to the constriction of blood, and to the beginning of leprosy and the movement of ancient headaches and violent diseases and bad corrosive ulcers as well as herpes.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquelas es que el malaute strenha dejos quascuna en le sieu col am liament; e estia le artifexs sobre le cap del malaute, e le malaute sia sezent sobre una sezela.	And the quality of bloodletting is that the patient ties himself with a rope, each one in its own bandage; and place the artisan on the head of the patient, and the patient be seated on a stool.
E aprop fleubotoma la vena al lonc am fleubotomi ample petit a petit; e aprop extratz de sanc segon temprada quantitat o segon aquo que vezes de necessitat que es ad aquo; e aprop fay semblant del autra vena.	Then take the vein long with a wide needle little at a time; then let run the blood according to the season or quantity as many times as your need, and then do the same for the other vein.
E aprop deslia le liament e strenh las doas venas am strictura migiera per so que·l malaute no sia prefocat, e laysa entro al mati quar la plagua es sanada.	Then take off the bandage and tighten the two veins with a moderate constriction because the patient is not choking, and leave that within to rest because the plague is healed.
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de las venas algerich, comfereys a petitas apostemas e pustulas de la boca e corrupcio de las gengivas e malas ulceracios e fissuras, e a malas ulceracios que so en le nas e en le circuit de lu.	And the healing of bloodletting is for ancient diseases, namely to small sores and pustules in the mouth and corruption of the gums and bad ulcers and cracks, and to bad ulcers that are on the nose and on its circle.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquelas es que fases cezer le malaute denant tu, e strenh le col de lu am una benda, e aprop revolveys las labias de lu e reguarda a doas venas de las quals la una es de la dextra de la labia e la segonda de la senestra; e la demonstracio de quascuna es per la negror de quascuna de amdos, e aquo mays es quar en le circuit de aquelas so venas menudas negras; e adonc inscideys cascuna per inscizio inscident.	And the quality of bloodletting is that you cut the patient' nose before you, and tie his neck with a bandage, and then turn the patient' lips to one side and look at two veins from which one is on the right side of the lip and the other on the left; and demonstrate each by its darkness, and more because in the circle of those are small black veins; and then cut each according to an incised incision.
Mays si dubitacio es dejos tu, e no sabes qual es de aquelas, lahoras tu enten a inscisio de la major de aquelas, e de la pus manifesta de aquelas.	Then if you are in doubt, leave it to me; and I will know which is which, and the most manifest form of those.
E fay le semblant de las doas venas que so en las labias desus.	And then make the incision of the two veins that are on the patient' lips.
Mays costuma corr mays a inscidir las doas venas que so en la labia dejos.	More often than not, cut more to incise those.

sia le latz de lu ayssi cum vezes, e conveneys a obrir las venas concavas plenas procedentz apparentz grossas, e ad aquelas que conteno sanc gros torbat.	And the cut is made times, and it leads to opening the concave veins full of blood, and at those that contain large blood.

May's if you want to do the flebotomy on him, then you should know that the place that you touch in front of the bicep is where you can see the vein clearly; and you should hold the arm down; and cut off the vein with a sharp cut at the hollow end of the arm, as I have said before; and be careful not to make a mistake in the cut.

Mays de la vena fusca la fleubotomia es juvament que extratz lo sanc de la partida subirana del cap e a la partida dejos del cors; per aquo quar es composta de ram de la basilica e de ram de cephalica, ayssi cum havem dit. Le primier de lu es del qual cove que sapias que fleubotomia no es aministrada sino en conservacio de sanetat e per speransa de lu e cautela de aveniment de malautias, e que sia fayta fleubotomia en la una de las venas que so en le coyde, so es: cephalica, fusca e basilica; e que sia fayta fleubotomia al comensament de primaveyra, sobre dejun en primaviera e autunppne, e en invern aprop la comestio, quan apparo significacios de replecio. E usa de las autras causas que havem ditas en la divisio en le capitol de sincopi per evacuacio.	And use of the other causes which we have said in the division in the chapter of fainting because of evacuation.
E qui vol eventar le sieu bras e dissolver le sieu sanc segonda veguada, cove a lu del qual la fleubotomia es per mota evacuacio, e la vertut de lu es freol, que evacue le sanc petit a petit, so es segon la quantitat de la vertut en les dias continuables.	And who wants to test the strength of his arms and dissolve his pain according to the second place, then do flubotomy because it is an evasive movement, and its virtue is freewill; let him evacuate the wound little by little, so that its quantity depends on the virtue in the continuous days.
Mays qui vol eventar le sieu bras, e gitar lo sieu sanc segonda vetz, e le sieu cors es fort, lahoras fassa aquo aprop vii horas o ix de la primieyra fleubotomia. And if necessity forces you to evacuate the second time, and there is no excuse, then let him urinate on that place or in another limb on another vein.

E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intrometa la sua ma en aygua cauda entro que·l focil se enrogezesca e que la vena apparia manifestament.	And the quality of the bloodletting is that the patient's hand enters in water until the vein appears clearly.

If you were in the summer days, then you are excused from dipping your hand in water; but the season is paused in the wintertime.
E la fleubotomia de aquesta vena es pus salva que de totas las autras venas, quar dejos lu no ha vena pulsatil, ni nervi.	And the bloodletting from this vein is more valuable than from all the other veins, for there are no pulsating veins or nerves.
E la fleubotomia de la savatella de la ma dreyta es conferent a las malautias del fetge.	And the bloodletting from the wrist of the right hand is sent to the feverish parts of the body.

And the quality of the bloodletting is that you strengthen your hand with a bandage or with your own, for it was dipped in water, until the vein swells and is clearly seen; and then let blood be taken transversely; and if you cut that one from top to bottom, no one would see it.

De ventozacio e de las qualitatz de uzar de aquelas.	Of windiness and of the qualities of using those.
Ventozas so de corns, o de eram, o de veyre.	Windiness so from corns, or from earache, or from cold.
E ventozacio es fayta segon doas manieyras: la una de lor es am scarificacio e extracio de sanc, e l’autra es ventozacio ses scarificacio.	Windiness is caused by two things: the first one is bloodletting and extraction of blood; and the other is windiness from scratching.
E aquesta ventozacio que es ses scarificacio es segon doas manieyras, quar o es am foc o ses foc.	And this windiness that is caused by scratching is due to two things: either it is fire and fire; or it is heat and heat.
E a las ventozas que so administradas am scarificacio e extraccio de sanc son xiiii locs del cors, dels quals la un en lo qual so pausadas ventozas es alnocrati, e es la deriera partida del cap; e le mieg loc d’el de doas partz del col ensemp; e ventozas del mento dejos la mandibula pus dejos de la boca; e ventozas de doas spatulas; e ventozas de alohoster, e es sobre la fi de la coeta; e ventozas de dos focils, e so de dos brasses; e ventozas de doas cavilhas; e ventozas de doas cuoyssas.	And the places that are used for windiness by bloodletting and extraction of blood are twelve parts of the body, of which one is at the nape of the neck, and is the last division of the head; and the second part from the jaw; and windiness from the chin, leaving the mouth; and windiness from two spatulas; and windiness from hollows, and it is at the end of the collar; and windiness from two bracers; and windiness from two cheeks.
E ventozacio no extratz le sanc sino de las venas menudas sparssas en la carn, e per aquo no catz la vertut per aquelas, ayssi cum es cazement per fleubotomia; ni no cove que ventozacio sia fayta am foc o ses foc en alcuna malautia fayta per replecio entro que le cors tot sia evacuat.	And windiness does not extract blood except from small veins in the flesh, and it does not stop virtue by those veins; or it stops by fire or hot food; nor does it stop unless all the body is evacuated.
Mays si necessitat provoca a ventozacio per malautia o per continua, aministrem aquela en tota hora al comensament del mes e en la fi de lu, e en le mieg loc de lu e en qualque temps sia.	If necessity forces windiness because of fever or continuous pain, then let it be given in one hour at the beginning of the meal and at the end, and in the middle place; and in the middle part, whenever it is necessary.
La qual causa es quar dels homes es en les quals es sanc multiplicat entro que indigeys de extraccio de lu per ventozacio e atroba en le sieu cap graveza e soda; e de aquels es que atroba replecio e rogor en la sua cara e en le sieu cap, e en le sieu col; e de aquels es que atroba pruziment en la sua cara e en le sieu front e tenebrositat e hebetut en les sieus huels; e de aquels que gieta le loc de la sua ventozacio; e de aquels es que le lor ris es multiplicat; e de aquels es que atroba gustament de sanc en la sua boca, o que la lengua es apostemada e escup sanc; e de aquels es que lor dormir es multiplicat, e de aquels que vetz sanc en lo dormir rogor e antics e plaguas e autras causas a lor semblantz.	And the cause of this is that in men for whom blood multiplies within them before excreting it by windiness, and they feel tired because of it; or it stops by fire or hot food; nor does it stop unless all the body is evacuated.

E aquesta ventoza es en le loc de fleubotomia de la cephalica.	This ventouse is in the place of phlebotomy of the cephalic.

Mays si le ventozador es de amples pors de tendra carn, lahoras cove que sia prohibit de oli, e cove que ad aquest les locs de ventozas de lor aprop la ventozacio sian lavatz am ayguaros o am aygua freja de solatrum, o am aygua de coja, o am aygua de bordolaguas, e semblantz ad aquelas.	But if the ventouse is of large size, then it should be prohibited from oil, and if these places of ventoses of their own are applied quickly with a warm water or with cold water of seltzer, or with water of chamomile, and to those who resemble them.
E aquel del qual le sanc es de mota humiditat, lava las suas ventozas am vi agre, o am aygua de mirt e sumac e semblant ad aquels.	And if that man's blood is of a moist nature, then wash his ventoses with wine or water of mirth or pomegranate and to those who resemble them.
E de aquel del qual las superfluitatz son grossas, lava las suas ventozas am vi antic, o am aygua de sansuc, que es majorana, o de decoccio de anet, o de camamilla, e a lor semblantz.	And if the superfluities are thick, then wash his ventoses with wine of ancient, or water of sansuc (which is marjoram), or aniseed tea, or chamomile tea, and to those who resemble them.
E cove que la ventozacio sia guardada denant de banh; habantz cove que sia aministrada aprop issiment del banh per una hora o per doas, e cove que dorma aprop la ventozacio.	And if the ventose is kept in front of a bath; having it administered early before the bath for an hour or two, and if he sleeps near the ventose.
Quid est quo oportet ut regatur ventosandus aus phlebotomatus ante ventosationem.	What is needed so that it is regulated to be applied before wound treatment.
Cove que consideras al comensament: lahoras si le ventozador o aquel que·s deu fleubotomar es coleric e ventz sobre lu sanc agut e imflamacio, lahoras cove que prengua causas infrigidantz, ayssi cum milgranas acetosas, e endivia an vi agre e laytuguas, e secanabin, e julep, e a lor semblantz.	And consider at the beginning: then if the ventouse or that who is to be phlebotomized is coleric and apply on the head pain and inflammation, then you take causes of cold drinks, such as wine of mirth and lemon, and mint tea, and black currant tea, and julep, and to those who resemble them.
E pausa a lor viandas ayssi cum poletz, e carns de auzels serbiges, e viandas conditas am agras, e a lu semblantz.	And pause their food such as potatoes, and meat of spring lamb, and prepared foods with sweetness, and to them who resemble them.
E de aquel del qual la compleccio es freja, cove que prengua en beure eyssarop almiva, o eyssarop de alsecanabin de semensas, e sumac, e vi mot odorant migier entre viel et noel; e que a lu sia comendat que use de paucitat de beure e de mangar, e pausa las viandas de lu poletz e canabir e pissers e petitz auzels e colombat.	And if that man's complex is strong, then take in drinking honey syrup, or almond syrup of astringent taste, and pomegranate, and a little smell of mint among the food; and it is recommended to him that he use scarcity of drink and eating, and pause his meals such as potatoes, and canaries, and pisons, and petitzals.
E cove que en lo dia de ventozacio e de fleubotomia le beure sia major que la vianda.	And where, on the day of venerection and phlebotomy, the drink is greater than the food.
E cove que sia donat en beure en alcunas horas ad alcus homes tyriaca alpharac, o medicamentz de musc, so es muscada, o alcelita denant la ventozacio o denant fleubotomia o aprop, per so que·ls membres principals sian confortatz e que·l sanc sia subtiliat; e no cove que prenguan aquela scalfatz.	And where, at certain times of the day, to certain men, is given the wine of tarry alkanol, or a medicine of musk, or muscadine, or acacia, before venerection or phlebotomy or close by, so that the main members are comforted and the blood is thinned; and do not take those scalps.
Mays las ventozas que so ses scarificacio sian ventozas que so pausadas sus le fetge, e sobre la melsa e podagra, e sobre le umbelic, en les locs dels jonolhs, e la pixida del ancha, quar aquestz membres no suffertan scarificacio sobre si.	May the venerections that are to be sacrificed be those that are paused on the member itself and on the podagra and on the navel, in the places of the joints, and the incision of the anus, because these members do not suffer sacrifice over themselves.
E no es querit per aquelas sino atraccio de sanc de membre, ayssi cum pausam ventosa sobre mamilha en malautia de flux de sanc del sanc de las nars; e usam de aquela per que sia dissolvuda ventositat freja inviscade del membre, ayssi cum pausam sobre le ventre e l’umbelic; quar aquela rarifique le membre e scalfa lu e ramau la dolor quar resolveys ventositat.	And do not wish it by those but a attraction of the member's blood, so if you pause venerection on the breast in the malady of the flow of blood from the member's wound; and use that because it dissolves a frizzy unsightly member, so if you pause on the navel and the womb, for that attracts the member and scars it and hurts it because it resolves venerection.
E ja es pausada sobre les ronhos quan accideys en lor opilacio o poyra, quar per vertut de atraccio fort leu huobre opilacio e erradica le poyra de son loc.	And it is paused on the cheeks when it happens to their opium or pox, for by virtue of a strong attraction, the opium is greatly alleviated and the pox is eradicated from its place.
E semblantment fa quan es pausada sobre le fetge e la melsa deves ventositat en aquels enclausa.	And apparently it happens when it is paused on the member and the navel, a venerection in those confined.
E aquestas ventozas so administradas vuedas amb succio tant solament; e alcunas veguadas so administradas am foc.	And these venerections are administered with water only; and some venerections are administered with fire.
E alcunas veguadas so administradas plenas de aygua tebeza en las malautias de la melsa.	And some venerections are administered full of hot water in the navel' malady.
E aquo es per que la ventoza sia umplida e sia pus gran, so es aygua cauda sola o aygua en la qual sian cuytas herbas ad aquo convenientz.	And water is so that the venerection is filled and is larger, either is hot water alone or water in which herbs have been boiled to suit.
Forma de ventoza aministrada am foc: sia la amplitud del orrifici de dos ditz, segon que nos la havem formada; e la quantitat del preon sia la maytat de un palm; e sia en lo latz de lu, en le loc que es en le circuit, la maytat de lu, le trauc sia petit segon la quantitat que intre en lu una agulha.	Form of venerection administered with fire: is the breadth of the orifice of two fingers, according to which we have formed it; and the quantity of the liquid be most of a palm; and be in the height of it, in the place that is in the circuit, most of it, the trail be small according to the quantity that enters into it an needle.
Sia fayta de eram rog o citri, de grosses marges, leon, enguals e terses per so que no leda le membre deves la sua posicio sobre lu.	It is made from a small amount of sweet oil or lemon, large margins, lion, owl and third for that it does not lead the member out of its position on it.
E sia al mieg de lu vergua transversa de eram o de ferr, on es pausada candela am lo foc.	And be at mid-leg from a transverse pole of iron or wood, where it is paused lit to the fire.
E ja sia aquesta ventoza gran major de aquela la qual havem recomtat; e la pauca mendre de aquela segon las malautias e la etat de aquel que usa de aquela.	And this venerection is much greater than that which we have just mentioned; and the little less of that according to the malady and the state of the one who uses it.
E las ventosas dels efantz e extenuatz so autres que las ventozas dels joves e de grosses corssas.	And the venerections of the old and exhausted are other than the venerections of the young and strong bodies.
E la qualitat de pausar aquesta ventoza am foc sobre le membre es que extenda la meca am foc de lenha decentment denant una pauca candela de cera, e pausa aquela sobre le mieg de la vergua transversa en le mieg loc de la ventoza, per que le foc sia accendut enviro la partida dejos per que no sia comburit le cors del malaute.	And the quality of pausing this venerection with fire on the member is that it extend the hand to the hand of the pole with a decently lit candle, and pause it on the middle of the opposite side of the member of the venerection, so that the fire be lit around the place where the candle leaves for it not to be extinguished the body of the patient.
E aprop sia pausada sobre le membre del malaute, e le dit sia sobre le trauc que havem dit, entro que quan tenem las ventozas e non indigem que osten le dit e que yesca la vapor sobre aquel trauc, lahoras la ventoza sira tantost dissolvuda.	And then be paused on the member of the patient, and the hand be placed on the place that we have said, until when we have the venerections and do not feel the hand holding them, and the vapor is heated above this hand, then the venerection is dried.
E prop igneys la meca segon la sua manieyra, e itera aquela si indigeyssas de aquela.	And light the fire according to its way, and repeat that if you do not like it.
Mays en ventosa que es aministrada en la malautia de plauressi, am aygua, en la qual no ha vergua transversa ni trauc, e no es aministrada sino que sia umplida de aygua, e es pausada sobre le membre tant solament.	May the venerection that is administered in the malady of the woman, with water, and which does not have a transverse pole or a hand, and is not administered except to be filled with water, and it is paused on the member only.
E aquesta es la forma de lu: E aquesta ventoza quant plus es gran, tant es milhor, per que puya recebre gran quantitat de aygua.	And this is its form: And this venerection, how much it is greater, so much is better, so that it receive a great quantity of water.
Capitol .xcvii.	Chapter .xciii.
Sanguissuguas no so administradas en motz membres sino en les membres en les quals non es possible posicio de ventosas, per la parvitat de aquels, ayssi cum le pot e gingiva e semblantz a lor; o en membre denudat de carn, ayssi cum le dit e·l nas e lors semblantz.	Sanguineous venerections are not administered in the members but in the members where it is impossible to place venerections, because of their poverty, or apparently so; or in a naked member of meat, apparently so.
E la qualitat de usar de aquelas que si has trobadas sanguisugas que so en las ayguas dossas de poyredura mundas.	And the quality of using those that if they have been found to be sanguiniferous, which are in the clean waters of the world.
E aprop sian layssadas le dia e la nueyt en aygua dossa entro que sian famolentas, e que no romangua alcuna causa en le ventre de aquelas; e aprop sia evacuat le cors en le comensament am fleubotomia e am ventozas; e aprop fregua le membre del malaute entro que s’enrojezesca; e aprop sian pausadas sobre lu.	And then are let go on the day and at night in water that is clean before they become hungry, and do not cause any trouble in the belly of those; and then be evacuated the body in the beginning with phlebotomy and venerection; and then are rubbed the member of the patient before it becomes red; and then be paused on it.
E cum son umplidas e caso.	And then are filled, and here ends.
E si es possible succio del loc am ventoza, es mays derier en juvament.	And if it is possible to take the place with venerection, so much more will be gained in a long time.
E sino, lahoras lava le loc am vi agre e aprop am mota aygua; e sia freguat e expremut.	Or, then wash the place with water and knead it up; and pour out water on it; and rub it, and squeeze it.
E si es prolonguat le cors del sanc aprop le cazement de las sanguissuguas, e es aquo resudan, lahoras tu enfon un drap de li en aygua freja, e pausa aquel de sobre entro que sia abdida la resudacio.	And if it is prolonged the member of the wound, so that the blood is not separated, then dip a cloth in water and pause it on the wound; and let it sit until it is dried up.
E si le sanc es multiplicat, lahoras polveriza sobre lu vitriol trissat, o guallas e semblantz a lor de las causas stipticas, entro que·l sanc sia abscidit; o sian pausadas sobre le loc las maytatz de favas excocicadas, e sian layssadas entro que las favas aderescan al loc, e es le sanc abscidit.	And if the wound is repeated, then sprinkle on it vitriol that has been triturated, or grind and make similar to those causes of the stinging ones, so that the wound is dried up; or be let go on the place the last of the cooked beans, and be let go until the beans adhere to the place, and the wound is dried up.
E cove, si es necessaria, iteracio de sanguissuguas, quan es possible mudar aquelas.	And where, if necessary, the repetition of venerections, when it is possible to change those.
E si las sanguissuguas son prohibidas de suspenssio, lahoras sia freguat le loc am sanc recent o fique una agulha en les locs entro que yesca sanc; e aprop sian pausadas, quar aquelas quan sento alcun sanc tantost adarysso.	And if venerections are forbidden by suspension, then rub the place with fresh blood or a needle is placed in the places where it hurts; and then be paused on it because those when they feel any pain, so soon after that.
E quan voles que cajan, polveriza sobre aquelas un pauc de aloen trissat, o sal, o cendre, e cazo tantost.	And when you want to make them fall, sprinkle on those a little amount of aloe that has been triturated, or salt or ash, and soon after.
Ayssi comensa lo prolec de la tersa partida: de restauracio.	Thus begins the process of the third part: of restoration.
Aquest capitol es motas veguadas necessari en la art de medicina; e es restauracio de fractura e de dislocacio accident en les osses.	This chapter is necessary in the art of medicine; and it is a restoration of fracture and an accidental dislocation of bones.
O, filh, sapiatz que jactan se de aquest capitol les fols metges e les vulguars e aquels que degun temps no reguardero les libres dels Antics ni legiro de aquels una letra.	Or, son you aware that this chapter is not pleasant to read, nor do those common physicians understand it, and no one will ever read it again.
E per aquesta causa es fayt que aquesta manieyra dels scients in terra nostra es privat; e yeu no ho e obliat en aquo degun temps be de tot; e no he adhibit aquo que apres, sino per longitut de lectio dels libres dels Antics e studi sobre le entendement de aquels, entro que extrayssi la sciencia de aquels.	And for this reason it is done that this way of the sciences in our land is secret; and I have not forgotten it because of all the books of the Ancients and study on the understanding of those, so that I extracted the science from them.
E aprop adirigui a experiment e studi en la longitut de la mieua vida.	And then I will begin to teach experiments and studies in the length of my life.
E yeu ja he de aquo descrit en aquest capitol tot aquo que conte la mieua sciencia e sobre le qual es passat lo mieu experiment; pus que agui abreujat aquo a vos autres e deliuregui aquo de occupacio de elonguacio; e abreujegui aquo en la fi de abreujacio; et e monstrat aquo en la fi de declaracio; e formegui en aquo motas formas dels sturmentz que so administratz en aquel, cum es fayt per addicio de declaracio, ayssi cum he fayt en dos capitols precedentz.	And I have already written this in this chapter all that my science contains and upon which is passed my greatest experiment; because it has opened to you a new field and freed me from the occupation of elaborating; and I have renewed it at the end of the declaration; and I have formed it from two previous chapters.
Capitol primier.	Chapter first.
Summae et collectiones ex esse fracturae ossium, ex eis quarum praemissio necessaria est, antequam incipiamus rememorationem membrorum fraftorum et diversorum si uniuscuiusque.	A summary of the cause of bone fractures, and from that which is necessary, before we begin to reminisce about broken limbs and diverse stories of each one.
Cove donc que diguam en le prohemi de aquest capitol las summas del sermo; e les capitols al entendament dels quals en le comensament es forsat le artifexs e a stacio sobre la veritat de aquels; so es vos e aquels que so promptz que sapian o aprenguan aquesta art nobla autres de vos.	And where, then, I will tell at the beginning of this chapter the highest points of speech; and which are certainly understood by those who master this noble art; and not by others who simply speak or learn it.
E donc dic que quan accideys a alcu fractura o dislocacio o torcio o cazement, lahoras cove que tu te coytes al comensament am fleubotomia o aleyar aquel, o quascu ensemps, si no prohibeys alcuna causa, ayssi cum debelitat de vertut, o es aquel al qual accideys effant, o viel en decrepitat, o es temps de vehement calor, o de vehement freg.	And therefore I say that when there is a fracture or dislocation or twist or fall, you should cover yourself with bloodletting or drawing it out or any time without prohibition, and the remedy of virtue will come, or whether it happens to you or you are old, or there is hot weather or a cold one.
E aprop sia content en vianda sieua de erbas frejas e de carns de auzels e de crabotz; e prohibem carns grossas e umplir si de viandas e de tota vianda que umple las venas de sanc, entro que siras segurat de apostema caut, e si no temes efusio de materia al membre.	And let it be ready in a bowl of herbs and meat of birds and crabs; and prohibit thick meats and filling with food and all food that fills the veins of blood, until you are certain of an embolism, and if you do not fear an outflow of substance to the limb.
E lahoras retorne le malaute al sieu regiment primier am le qual corr costuma de lu.	Then return the patient to his usual position first with the one that he usually sleeps on.
E donc cum le os trencat comensa esser restaurat, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia pascut de viandas nutritivas de nutriment mot e gros e greu en les quals sia viscositat, ayssi cum so viandas faytas de froment cueyt am aygua, e ris, e caps, e pes, e ventres de vacas, e huous, e peys fresc, e vi gros e semblants ad aquels, e am aquest regiment es fayta coagulacio de fractura pus leugierament e miels.	And therefore when the broken bone begins to be restored, you should feed him with nutritious food that is thick and heavy and has viscosity, so that with food made from wheat cooked in water, and rice, and garlic, and feet, and bellies of cows, and hen, and fresh milk, and large and similar foods, and this diet causes coagulation of the fracture slightly and better.
E sapias que les osses trinquatz quan so en les homes que so en la primiera vilura e en los decrepitz, no es possible que sian continuatz e sian consolidatz segon lur natura per la exsiccacio dels membres de lor.	And know that when the bones are broken in men who are in their early years and in old age, it is not possible for them to continue and be consolidated according to their nature by the drying out of the limbs.
E son consolidatz e continuatz segon lor natura tot temps per la exsiccacio de aquels membres, e so continuatz e consolidatz aquels que so de lor en la fi de la lenitat, ayssi cum les osses dels petitz effantz.	And they are consolidated and continued according to their nature at all times by the drying out of those limbs, and they continue and are consolidated that are theirs in the end of languid heat, so with the bones of small children.
Mays empero natura ajusta e amnecteys sobre le os trencat de tota partida alcuna causa semblant a glut en le qual es grossitut que adhereys e strenh aquel entro que so ensemps conglutinatz e liatz ensemps, entro que venen la fi de fortitut e de fermesa, ayssi cum foc al comensament, entro que denguna causa no prohibeys aquel de las suas obres.	But nature adjusts and heals the broken bone from the beginning of any similar cause to glut that adheres and strengthens it within that it becomes united and bound together, so that it comes to its end of strength and stability, as with fire at the beginning, so that no prohibition causes it to stop from its works.
E per aquesta causa es necessari que pauses las viandas del malaute, viandas en las quals so gravitat e viscozitat e grosseza, ayssi cum havem dit.	And for this reason it is necessary that you pause the patient's food, food in which there is gravity and viscosity and thickness, as I have said.
Mota diversitat de fractura segon diversitat del membre.	A variety of fractures according to the variety of the limb.
E sapias que las specias de fractura son diversas segon la diversitat dels membres, quar fractura del os de la camba es diversa de la fractura del os del cap; e la fractura del os del pietz es divers de la fractura del os del dos; e semblantment totz les autres membres son diverses entre lor.	And know that the types of fractures are different according to the difference of limbs, a fracture of the hip bone is different from a fracture of the head bone; and a fracture of the foot bone is different from a fracture of the thigh bone; and similar to all the other limbs are different from each other.
E yeu venc am rememoracio de tota specia de fractura, expausada en le sieu capitol distincta del autre.	And I give you a summary of all kinds of fractures, described in the separate chapter of another book.
Mota diversitat de fractura en si meteyssa.	A variety of fractures within itself.
E son diversificadas las specias de fractura del os en lor meteyssas; quar es fayta fractura arcuada otra aquo que accidan en lu stellas; e alcunas veguadas es fayta fractura segon la longitut del os: e so las fracturas de lu satagia e astelhas e addicios procedentz e no-procedentz, ayssi cum es fayt en la pena quan es preparada a escriure, e es fractura am plagua e disrupcio en le cap, e es fractura fissura petita.	And the types of fractures of bones within themselves are different; for some it happens in the shape of an arch and others that it happens at the ends of the bone: and those are the fractures of the knee and the feet and the additions, proceeding and not proceeding, as when it is broken by a blow while writing, and a small fracture in the head and disruption.
E a tota specia es engen o turment propri en restauracio de lu segon que vindra rememoracio de lu distincta en les sieus locs.	And to all kinds of fractures is given a certain type of treatment in its restoration, as it comes to be remembered separately in its place.
Mota senhal de fractura del os.	A symbol of a fracture of the bone.
E per aquo es conoguda fractura del os: es tortuositat de lu, e de aquel eminencia e appericio de lu al sentiment, e so de lu quan compremes aquel am la tua ma.	And this is how a broken bone is known: it is a twist and a prominence and an appearance that can be felt with your hand.
E donc quan no es en le loc tortuositat apparent ni so no es feyt deves le tieu tocament quan toques le os am agitacio e le malaute no atroba gran dolor, lahoras no es aqui fractura.	And therefore when it is not in the twisted place that appears or does not appear, and it does not cause great pain when you touch the bone with movement, then there is no fracture.
Habantz es possible que sia tortuositat o petita fissura, adon no cove que tu mauguas aquel am la tua ma e am compressio de tot; habantz pausa sobre lu de las medicinas de las quals ve rememoracio aprop aquel moment le qual conveneys al loc; e aprop sia streyt per strictura subtil.	And while it is possible that it is a twist or a small crack, so that you do not feel it when you touch it with your hand and press all over it; and if you pause for a moment from the medicines of which you have a memory of that moment that you bring to its place; and if it becomes tight by a subtle tightening.
E sapias que·l loc quan es arcuat e no es scindit en dos o otra aquo que no accidan en lu satagie, cum es remauguda tota partida de la sua compar, lahoras cove que comenses de la tua hora a rectificacio de lu habantz que a lu accida apostema caut.	And know that the place is when it is curved and does not split into two or another that happens to its knee, as it is raised from all its sides, then begin the hour of correction of it, because if you happen to it an embolism of blood.
E si a lu accida apostema caut, lahoras layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que cesse le apostema; e aprop engualha aquel segon quascuna manieyra que podes de levitat e de engen.	And if an embolism of blood happens to it, then leave it for a few days until it stops; and if you can hide it in any way that you can imagine using levitation or invention.
E sapias que restauracio de lu e agulacio de lu es pus leugiera que del os en le qual accideysso sathagie.	And know that the restoration of it and the tightening up of it is more difficult than that of the bone in which this happens to the knee.
E aprop strenh aquel segon que vindra la rememoracio de lu.	And leave it as best you can remember it coming.
Mays si en le os so satagias, lahoras es necessaria extencio de aquest membre trencat de doas partz, si es la ma o le pe; o am la tua ma si le membre es petit; o am doas cordas o am una corda e la ma.	But if in the bone there are two satagies, then leave it as broken into two parts, whether it is the hand or the foot; or at the wrist or at the ankle and at the leg.
E sia la tua posicio am la qual pauses le membre loc engual segon la sua figura natural, mentre que las partidas so extandudas del membre trenquat, lahoras te perforsa que fassas retornar aquelas addicios am engen e segon quascuna manieyra que poyras en lor locs.	And be the position of your hand in which you pause the limb extended as natural, while the breaks of the limb are extended, then know that you must return those additions to their places by invention and according to any way that you can imagine putting them in place.
E guarda te segon la tua forssa que no accida sobre le malaute per la tua operacio delor ni lesio; e perforsa te segon le tieu poder que tu appliques la un os am l’autre son companho segon lors milhors formas.	And protect yourself according to your strength so that it does not happen to you through your operation or injury; and by the power of the one bone, apply to the other its shape according to its best forms.
E cove que en aquela hora aprofitablament tu toques am la tua ma aquel, e si vezes aqui alcuna causa diversa, rectifiqua aquel e enguala aquel per la quantitat de la tua vertut.	And if at that hour you take advantage of touching it with your hand, and if there is no other cause, then correct it and hide it according to the amount of your strength.
E exquiva vehement extenssio e compressio, ayssi cum fan mots fols metges que motas veguadas fan accidir apostema caut per la sua operacio, o fan accidir contraccio en le membre ayssi cum havem vist aquo per la operacio de lor motas veguadas.	And with violent extension and compression, as when foolish movements cause the appearance of an embolism of blood to happen through their operation, or cause a contraction in the limb to occur, as we have seen by the sight of it for the operation of their foolish movements.
E aprop annecteys, aprop equacio e decent operacio e strictura de aquel membre, e repaus e tranquilitat; amoneste le malaute sobre aquo e fay le squivar que no maugua aquel en la hora de las suas vigilias e del sieu dormir, e ves la sua revolucio e agitacio, e deves la sua egestio, e deves totz les sieus movementz am tota la sua vertut; e aguarda se que la posicio del membre sia posicio am la qual sia asegurada la dolor, la qual causa es quar quan sent en la disposicio de la posicio del membre delor o lesio; lahoras cove que permutes aquel ad autra disposicio de aquela am la qual non senta dolor; e guarda am aquo que la posicio de lu aquela sia dreyta e engual, per so que al membre non accida tortuositat quan es restaurat.	And leave it connected, and connect it properly and tightly; and rest and quietness; order the patient in this regard and do not allow it to feel pain when you put it in this position, for this is when they are in a position that causes pain to them, and if you change it to another position that does not cause pain, then know that their position is wrong and that this causes pain. And know that when the limb is restored to its original place, then do not allow it to feel pain; and know that if you put it in a certain position, it will not feel pain; and protect it from feeling pain by changing its position.
E la qualitat de la strictura del membre tranquat es aquela que yeu recomti; per que sapias que·ls membres trencatz so diversificatz en lor parvitat e en lor grandeza e en la forma de aquels.	And the quality of the tightening of the limb is that which I recommend; so that you know that broken limbs are different in their smallness and size and in the form of those.

Method of embowelling as a shower of restoration of a fracture, suitable for complicated cases and mostly for women and children, because it is not hot on that which moves the mill; and it is that you take powder of corn meal, and that is the flour's medulla which the movement of the mill causes in the parts of the mill.

Capitol segon: De fractura quan accideys en le cap.	Chapter according: Of fractures when they occur on the head.
Las specias de fracturas son motas, e las figuras de lor son diversas, e las causas son distinctas, quar de fracturas alcuna es fayta per percussio de spaza, e la percussio osta tot le os entro al ciphac, le qual es dejos le os, ayssi cum fay ayssa en le fust, e per aquo aquesta specia es nompnada ascial; o la spaza inscideys alcuna partida del os, e inscideys la carn de lu e no passa la inscizio entro al derier de lu; e aquesta specia de fractura es nompnada levatio absoluta.	The types of fractures are various, and the causes are distinct, since some fractures are caused by impact with a hard object, and the impact stops all the way down to the root of the bone, leaving it intact, as if there had been a cut in one part of the bone, but not in another; and that type of fracture is called a complete levitation.
E la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca, e de fractura que es contricio o atricio; e causa de lu es percussio am poyra o cazement sobre peyra, e a lor semblantz.	And the pain of these two types of fractures is great or small, and the cause of them is impact with fire or stone on the head, and their appearance is similar.
E aquesta fractura o es penetrant que ja apropinqua al pannicol le qual es dejos le os; o es en la facia del os, e la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca.	And this fracture is either penetrating, so that the skin is already separating from the bone, or it is on the face of the bone, and the pain of these two types of fractures is great or small.
E de fractura es que es ameguada en le os, en la subtilitat del cabel petita, e per aquo es nompnada aquesta specia fractura capillar.	And some fracture is that it is absorbed in the bone, in the subtlety of the hair, and this type of fracture is called a capillary fracture.
E es fractura que es fayta o per cazement o per percussio de peyra e a lu semblantz, que fa intrar alcuna lamina del os a las partidas dedintz, e es fayta en le loc concavitat ayssi cum accideys als payroles de eram quan accideys a lor percussio e es partida de lor intrada a las partidas dedintz.	And it is a fracture that has been caused by impact with stone or impact with fire, and its appearance is similar, so that one layer of the bone enters into another place inside; and it is made in the concave part, as if there had been an entrance into the inside when the impact occurs on the sides.
E majorment es fayt aquo en les cors de osses humitz, ayssi cum so caps de efantz.	And most often it is made on the bones of humans, as if they were heads of youth.
E so a totas aquestas specias fracturas satagias, so son pessas ayssi cum stelhas separadas.	And therefore all these types of fractures are bad, and that is why they are called such.
E yeu vindre am reremoracio de tot aquo en son loc.	I come with the memory of all this in my mind.

E specia capillar es conoguda per aysso que es descubert sobre le os, e es abstergit, e linit sobre lu am tentha, quar la fractura appar negra.	And the capillary specialty has been known through a discovery that is found on the bone, and it is dried out, and appears black.
Mays en la curacio de fractura considera al comensament les accidentz del malaute, e lahoras si tu vezes per los accidentz que signifique per significacio manifesta sobre paor, ayssi cum es vomit de colera, e extencio, e perdement de entendament, e abscizio de votz, e sincopi, e febre acuta, e eyssiment dels huels e rogor de aquels, e semblantz a lor dels accidentz en las majors disposicios, ses dopte no es sanat.	More in the treatment of fractures, at the beginning, consider the patient' accidents, and if you find by means of manifest signs that they refer to pain, then know that vomiting of cholera, ekstasis, loss of reason, confusion, fainting, high fever, and a similar appearance to these are not cured.

The reason is that if it has come to you in the beginning with pain and it is in winter, then know that you study the structure of the bone before the thirteenth day according to all dispositions.

E la una manieyra es que tu inscidas le os am inscisori de streyt tal, e aquesta es la forma de lu: E aprop administra un autre inscissori aquest, un pauc pus lat que aquel; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And the first method is that you cut the bone with a straight chisel, and this is its form: And then you administer another one that is slightly less than that; and this is its form.
E aprop administra mays le inscissori pus lat que·l segon.	And then you administer a wider one again.

And then know the names of various chisels, some of which are wider than others; and some of them are narrower than others, and they are on the sharp end of their edges, and they are made of iron or steel.

E si le os es fort, dur, lahoras cove que perfores en le circuit de lu denant que tu administres los inscissoris am les taravels, les quals so nomnatz taravels no-profundantz.	And if the bone is strong and hard, then know that you pierce in front of it before administering chisels; those are called non-deep knives.
E no so nomnatz ayssi sino quar aquels no pausan le terme de l’os del test ad aquo que es aprop lu, per so quar al taravel es redonda extremitat o marge sobre aquel que es dejos le cap de lu agut semblant a marge o a cercle petit, le qual prohibeys esser submergit e passar la spissitut del os.	And they are not called that way because those do not stop the term of the bone's head in water that is next to it; however, since the taravel has a round extreme or edge on the bone that is left, this resembles a small circle, and it prohibits being submerged and passing through the bone' structure.
E es convenient que tu prenguas de aquestz taravels gran nombre dels quals quascu convenesca a la spicitut de quascun os, entro que sia a tu present en tottz testz del cervel la extremitat del qual sia aguda, la quantitat en longitut e brevitat sia segon la quantitat de spicitut de aquest test.	And it is convenient that you take a great number of these knives, as many as are needed for the bone' structure; except in the case of the head's extreme part, since its quantity in length and brevity depends on the amount of the bone' structure's smoothness.
E aquesta es la forma de tres specias de teravels: La qualitat de perforar en le circuit del os trencat es que pauses le teravel sobre le os e revolvas aquel am les tieus ditz entro que sapias que l’os ja es penetrat; e aprop permuda le terevel ad autre loc, e pausa aquo que es entre tot trauc la quantitat de la grosseza del ray o enviro aquo.	And this is the form of three types of knives: The quality of piercing in front of the broken bone is that you place the knife on the bone and move it with a twisting motion so that it does not stop; then return it to another location, and pause it so that water passes through its width, if possible.
E aprop inscideys am inscissoris aquo que es entre quascun trauc del os, e fay aquel pus subtil que podes sobre aquo en fi de levitat, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que erradiques le os, o am la tua ma, o am alcuna autra causa per alcus sturmentz les quals auras apparelhatz ad aquo, ayssi cum tanalhas e forceps subtils.	And then you insert a chisel between each part of the bone, and make it so thin that you can work on it; as we have said: provided that you remove the bone, or your hand, or another cause with some instruments that you will prepare for water, as tongs and forceps that are thin.
E cove que tu guardes am tota cautela que l’inscissori no toque alcuna causa del ciphac.	And so that the incision does not touch any cause of the patient's chest, keep all your caution.
E donc cum auras circuit le os perforan, e sira separat del ciphac si es continuat am lu, e auras aquel extrayt, cove que razas e enguales aquel en la asperitat de lu de aquo que es en le os am autra sturment semblant a inscissori, mays empero cove que sia pus teon e pus subtil que les autres inscissoris.	And so when you have pierced the bone, if it continues to grow, separate it from the patient's chest as much as possible, and remove it, provided that you cut it with a sharp instrument like an incision, but more carefully than the others, since it is located in the area of the foot where there are other instruments resembling incisions.
E si roman alcuna partida dels osses petitz e satagias, lahoras pren aquela am facilitat am aquo que es deves tu dels sturmentz; e aprop aquo cura la plagua am lichinis e enguentz les quals havem ditz.	And if any part of the small bones is left loose and unstable, then take that easily with a sharp instrument, which you will use for cutting; and then care for the wound with lime and smear on the ointment we have mentioned.
E l’autra manieyra de operacio es leugiera, longinqua de paor, la qual diyssec Gualia e la lauzec per gran lausor; e aquest es le sermo de lu: necessari es a tu en le comensament que comenses descobrir la partida del os del loc en le qual es la fractura pus vehement e pus manifesta, entro que quan auras descubert aquela partida e auras pausat dejos lu la extremitat de aquest inscissori lent e alegre del qual aquesta es la forma:	And another way of operating is to cut through the skin, far from fear, which was used by Guaglia and the knife in long strokes; and this is what he said: it is necessary for you to start revealing the fracture's break, as much as possible, until you have revealed that break and have paused there the tip of a slow and gentle incision, through which this is the form:
E es que la partida lenticular es leon e no inscideys alcuna causa, e la partida aguda es de lu en dos latz avantz en longitut, ayssi cum vezes; que la partida lenticular sia ajustada al ciphac am la facia de lu inscident aguda en le os.	And it is that a rounded break is strong and does not cut into any cause, and an acute break is in two places ahead of each other in length, so that the rounded break is adjusted to the chest with its face facing the acute break in the bone.
E aprop percuteys sobre le inscissori de una partida am un petit malhet entro que inscidas tot le os am facilitat ayssi cum es revolvut, e tu sias segur del pannicol que no accida en lu accident que temas en denguna manieyra, e si le medicant14 era le pus fol de totz les homes e le mays ignorant de lor; certament, e si era dorment.	And so you hit the incision with a small hammer until it is completely broken, and you will be sure that such an accident does not happen to you in any way, and if the medicine was the most effective for all people and the most ignorant of them; certainly, and if it was sleep-inducing.
Lahoras si romania alcuna causa annexa al os del pannicol en alcus locs de os, inscidira aquel de lu am la extremitat del inscissori aquel lenticular, e deliuraria aquel de lu am facilitat, quar es deliurat de lu ses nocument e ses paor.	And if any cause is attached to the patient' s chest bone in several places, cut it with a knife at the end of the incision, and release it easily, because it is released by itself and does not cause pain or fear.
E si fractura del os no penetra entro al pannicol, e aquo que es abscidit o es ostat del os es la facia de lu, e roman en lu asperitat e satagias subtils, lahoras cove que razas aquela asperitat e erradiques aquelas satagias am razoris subtils per les quals tu has preparat le nombre, de diversas quantitatz per que sia a tu possible administrar de aquels en tot loc les pus convenientz de lor e le pus dreyt de aquels segon aquo en que te perduzeys la tua operacio aquel os trencat e la figura de lu.	And if the bone's fracture does not penetrate into the chest, and what is broken or left out of the bone is its surface, and there are thin and sharp points in that area, then cut those points with very sharp points that you have prepared, in various quantities so that you can administer them in all places where they are most convenient for you and most appropriate for applying them according to what you need;
E cove que administres en la tua razio am la qual razes le os al comensament le pus lat de aquels razoris, e aprop usa aprop lu del pus subtil de lu, e no cesses far aquo segon continuitat entro que pervenguas ad aministrar le pus teon e·l pus subtil de totz aquels.	And when you administer the sharpest points with which to cut the bone at the beginning, and then use very sharp ones in succession, and do not stop until you have finished applying them all;
Mays en quascuna de las autras fracturas petitas capillars e fractura subtil, cove que administres cura segon aquo que perduseys ad rectificacio de lu.	But in any of the other small fractures or subtle breaks, administer care according to what you need to correct it.
E es causa que no es ameguada sobre totz les quals han studi en aquela art.	And that is why all those who have studied this art are not familiar with it.
E stec sobre aquo que nos scriut havem mostrat en grans fracturas.	But he has shown us how to operate in great fractures.
E si le pannicol es retangut quan tu erradiques le os, lahoras cove que prenguas drap de li segon la quantitat de la plagua, e submergeys aquel en oli rozat, e pausa aquel sobre le orrifici de la plagua; e aprop pren autre drap doblat o triplicat e submergeys lu en vi e oli rozat e pausa aquel sobre drap prim e fay aquo al pus leugierament que podes sobre aquel, que no graves le ciphac; e aprop administra sobre aquel liament lat, e no strenhas aquel sino per quantitat que tengua la plagua tant solament.	And if the chest is stretched when you cut the bone, then take a cloth according to the amount of wound, and dip it in hot and oily rosin, and pause it over the wound' s orifice; and then take another cloth, folded or tri-fold, and dip it in oil and rosin, and pause it over the first cloth with great care so that the chest is not injured; and then administer a very thin fabric over it, and do not stretch it except by the amount of wound.
E layssa aquel am aquesta cura per un dia o per dos entro que sias segur de apostema caut; e aprop deslia aquel e aprop aministra medicinas am las quals es superflua siccitat, ayssi cum razitz de lin e farina de errs, e polvera de enses e de aristologia, e de semblantz ad aquels.	And leave that wound with this care for a day or two until you are sure that there will be no suppuration; and then wash it off and administer medicines that are superfluous, such as rye flour and bread crumbs, and powder of onions and aromatics, and similar to those.
E es que tu fassas de aquestas medicinas polvera que sia pulverizada sobre la plagua, ayssi cum son secas; e universalment, administra en aquel tota medicina de proprietat de la qual es que abstergesca e no mordique.	And it is that you sprinkle the powder of these medicines over the wound when they are dry; and generally, administer all medicines of their properties which cause constipation and not chewing.
E guarda te segon la tua vertut que la plagua en la tua curacio sia neta; e no sia en lu surdicia de enguent ni autra; ni no layssas agreguar virulencia en lu; quar quan es ajustada sobre le pannicol del cervel, corromp aquel e poyreys aquel, e accideys sobre le malaute aprop aquo malicia maligna.	And keep your word that the wound in your treatment be clean; and is not in a layer of ointment or any other thing; nor do you add virulence to it; because when it is adjusted on the patient' s chest, he corrupts it and destroys it, and it causes malice and evil.
E accideys en le ciphac del cap, cum de lu es mondificat le os e majorment quan es menspresada la cura de lu, e es negror en la superficia de lu; e donc considera lahoras si accideys al malaute les accidentz que havem ditz, sapias que es parnicios ses tot dopte.	And it happens in the patient' s head, and when it is separated from the bone, and more importantly when its treatment is finished, and it is blacker on its surface; and then consider, at that time, whether it happens to the man that we have mentioned, that you know that it is dangerous.
E si no accideys negror sino de la medicina que es pausada desus, e es en vertut de aquela medicina que fassa aquela negror, lahoras cove que tu prenguas de mel una partida e de oli rozat partidas .iii., e am aquels linieys un drap, e aprop pausa aquel sobre le ciphac; e aprop cura aquel am las specias de curacio que conveneys entro que sia sanat.	And if it does not happen to be black due to the medicine that is applied to it, and it is because of the virtue of that medicine that causes that blackness; then take a cloth of honey and some oil of roses. and put a cloth on it, and then pause that over the wound; and then cure it with the medicines we have mentioned to you in order to heal it.
Capitol .iii.	Chapter III.
De restauracio del nas quan es trincat.	Of Restoring a Broken Nose.
Sapias que no es trencat del nas sino doas partidas ensemps pus sobiranas, o una de aquelas alcunas veguadas, per so quar en lu has dos osses, quar la partida dejos es cartillaginosa, e no es trencada e no accideys a lu sino atricio e tortuositat e sinuitat.	You should know that the nose is not broken in two parts separately, and one of those small bones is separated from its cavity, or one of those small bones is fractured, because there are two bones; because the break of the bone is cartilage-like, and it is not broken, but happens to the nose only a little bit of twisting and tortuosity and uneasiness.
Mays si es trencada la una de las doas partidas de lu, lahoras cove que tu intrometas le dit petit en le sieu nas, e que engualhas aquela fractura dedintz am le tieu dit indic, e am le dit pous defora, entro que retorne le nas segon la sua figura natural.	But if one of the two small bones is broken, then insert a very small thing into its nose, and fix that fracture inside with a very small needle, and push it from outside towards the tip of the nose, so that it returns to its natural shape.
E sia fayt aquo per tu am facilitat, e guarda te que no caja per aquela tua operacio sobre le malaute delor.	And do it easily for you, and be careful not to hurt yourself with your operation on the man's face.
E si la fractura es en la pus sobirana partida del nas, e le dit no perve ad aquela, lahoras cove que sia equat am la extremitat del ray en le qual sia petita grossitut.	And if the fracture is in the uppermost part of the nose, and does not reach that bone, then fix it to the tip of the nose with a very small needle.
E si la fractura es en doas partidas, lahoras tu fay le semblant de aquo.	And if the fracture is in two parts, then you make a similar shape for that.
E coyta te am restauracio de lu en le primier dia de la fractura, si es possible; e sino, lahoras aprop le vii o·l x deves le repaus del apostema caut.	And do not delay in repairing it on the first day of the fracture if possible; and otherwise, then wash it with oil to relieve suppuration.
E aprop entromet en la extremitat del nas una meca de drap de li, si la fractura es en una partida, o metz doas calguas, si la fractura es en doas partidas, e sia en la calgua grossitut de tanta quantitat que umpla le trauc del nas.	And then insert a cloth hook into the tip of the nose with great care if the fracture is in one part, or with two hooks if the fracture is in two parts, and fill it with the thickness of as much as the width of the nose fills.
E diysso alcus dels antics restauradors que las calguas sian enfundudas en boder, e sian permudadas en tot dia, mays no es vist a mi; habantz cove que la meca sia enfunduda en album de huou comfit am polvera de moli; e aprop layssa la qualgua entro que l’os sia fermat e sia endurazida la cartillage.	And I have said about the ancient restorative techniques that the hooks are wrapped in cloth, and they are changed every day, but I do not see them; provided that the hook is wrapped in album with oil of roses to harden cartilage. And then leave it alone until the bone has been fixed and hardened.
E alcunas veguadas sia entromes en le nas, en loc de calgua, pena de auca pus que es envolopada de drap de li leon; e sia que ja te la fractura del nas pus vehement e que le malaute no sia prohibit de inspiracio.	And some small bones are caught in the nose, instead of one, because they are wrapped in cloth of lion; and it is that you know that this fracture of the nose is very violent, and that the man' s life is not at risk from breathing.
E aquesta causa no es a tu necessaria; e si voles, fay aquo, e si voles, fay calguas.	And this reason is not necessary for you; and if you want, make one, and if you want, make two.
E si accideys autra veguada apostema caut, emplastra le nas am cerot o am coto enfus en vi agre e oli rozat, o am diaquilon.	And if there is another suppuration, then fill the nose with wax in oil and rosin, or with a cotton swab in linseed oil, or with powder of onions and aromatics, and similar to those.
Mays si no accideys apostema caut, lahoras cove que emplaustres aquel defora am farina de sizami e am polvera de enses cofitz am album de huou; e aprop pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e no lies le nas am alcuna causa.	But if there is not suppuration, then take a cloth of lion and wrap it around the nose, and do not tie it too tightly; and place your hand over the area so that the nose does not move.
Mays si so trencats les osses del nas am fractura petita o so conminuitz, lahoras cove que scindas sobre aquels, e extraguas aquels am insturmentz que conveno ad aquels; e aprop cos la scissura, e cura aquela am aquo que encarna e consolida, e am emplastres ad aquo convenientz.	If the bones of the nose are broken or shattered, then cut them out with a scalpel and remove them with instruments suitable for the job. Then close up the wound, and treat it with oil that soothes and hardens it, as well as with ointments suitable for the wound.
E si accideys plagua dedintz le nas, lahoras cove que cures aquela am calguas e administra canulas de plom entro que sia de tot sanat.	And if there is a plague inside the nose, then cut off that part with calques and introduce lead tubes into it to make it sound; administer ointment for a while until it heals completely.
Capitol .iiii.	Chapter .iiii.
De restauracio de la mandibula quan es trincada.	On the restoration of the jaw when it is dislocated.
Quan la mandibula dejos es rompuda e la fractura de lu no es am plagua, reguarda lahoras si la fractura es deforas tant solament, e no es trencada en dos e es curvada a las partidas dedintz, lahoras la sua cognicio es leugiera.	When the jaw is broken and the fracture is not out of place, nor has it been twisted so much that it is curved at one end; then its recovery will be easy.
E cove donc, si la fractura es en la part dreyta, que tu intrometas le tieu indic senestre en la boca del malaute; e semblantment si la fractura es an la mandibula senestra, lahoras intromet le dit indic de la ma dreyta; e impelleys am aquel la gilbositat de la fractura dedintz am facilitat a las partidas defora, am la tua autra ma de la partida defora del os; am aquel decentment equa aquelam.	And so, if the fracture is on the right side, then insert the little finger of your left hand into the mouth of the patient; and likewise, if the fracture is on the left side, then insert the little finger of your right hand; and push the fracture from the inside with ease towards the outside, with your other hand at the outside end of the bone; and hold it in place firmly.
E si la fractura de la mandibula ja es separada en doas, lahoras cove que administres extensio de doas partz segon rectitut entro que sia possibla la equacio de lu.	And if the jaw fracture has separated into two parts, then cut away two strips according to their length on both sides so that you can restore the alignment of the bone.
E si accideys conmocio de dentz a disrupcio, lahoras strenh aquelas de las quals speras que romandran am fil de aur o de argent o de ceda; e aprop pausa sobre la mandibula trencada cerot, e aprop pausa sobre lu drap duplicat, e pausa sobre le drap gran stelha decentment fayta, o una pessa de sola engual a la longitut de la mandibula; e aprop lia aquela desus segon que a tu es apparelhada la liadura de lu e que conveneys la applicacio, entro que no es destruida.	And if there is a concussion or a dislocation of the teeth, then strengthen those which you hope will hold fast with gold, silver, or ivory; and place wax over the broken jaw, and place a double cloth over it, and put on a large star-shaped cloth neatly folded, or a single weight according to its length; and tie it firmly so that it does not break.
E comanda al malaute que use de repaus e tranquilitat, e pausa la vianda de lu sorbicios leons.	And command the patient to rest and be calm, and provide him with small sips of liquid.
E si extimas que ja es alterada la figura en alcuna manieyra, lahoras tu te coyta e deslia aquel al tertz dia; e aprop rectifica aquo que ja es alterat de lu e emplaustra aquel am polvera de moli, am album de huou, o am farina de cisami, pus que tu auras ostat le cerot de lu, e pausa sobre le emplastra lana leon.	And if you suspect that the shape has been altered in any way, then hide it and wait until the third day; and then adjust what is altered with powder of ash, milk-powder, or flour of chamomile, so that you will have to remove the wax from it, and place it on a woollen cloth.
E adonc cum sta annex e ajustat aquel emplastre sobre lu, e la disposicio del os no es alterada, layssa aquel, que no le deslies entro que sia sanat e strenh la fractura; quar motas veguadas aquesta fractura es streyta en tres sempmanas.	Then, when it is stable and the position of the bone has not changed, leave it alone, unless it is painful and the fracture seems to be healing, for the fracture becomes stiff in three weeks.
E si autra veguada accida apostema caut, lahoras administra aquo que havem dit motas veguadas en la sedacio de lu entro que sia sanat, e sia remaugut aquel apostema.	And if another outbreak of fever occurs, then administer the oil that we have mentioned to soothe it and treat it; also use a poultice.
E si la fractura es am plagua, lahoras considera si es pessa del os separada o satagias, lahoras tu te subtilia que ostes aquelas satagias am aquo que conveneys ad aquo en la remocio de aquelas dels sturmentz.	And if the fracture is infected, then consider whether it is a small fracture or a large one; then administer oil to those that hurt from the movement of their weapons.
E si le orrifici de la plagua es streyt, lahoras tu le amplifique am le fleubotomi segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	And if the hole of the infection is small, then enlarge it with a scalpel according to the quantity of your need.
E aprop quan tu auras ostat aquelas satagias, e de aquelas no sira remaugut re, lahoras tu cos le orrifici de la plagua si es ampla; e sino, pausa sobre aquela un dels emplaustres que conveneysso ad aquo e encarnan aquela, entro que sia sanada.	Then, when you have removed those that hurt, and if the hole is wide, then close it up with a poultice so that it heals; otherwise, place something between them that will prevent movement and allow oil to reach it.
Capitol .v.	Chapter.v.
De restauracio de la furcula quan es trinquada.	On the restoration of the fork (furcula) when it is dislocated.
Motas veguadas es trencada la furcula de la partida denant deves le muscle, e aquela fractura es fayta en una de tres manieyras.	The fork (furcula) is broken in one of the three ways.
Quar o es trencada, o seperada, o es seperada en doas partz otra que no accidan satagias; e es leugier a la restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que accideysso en lu satagias, e es dificil a restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que la fractura es am plagua.	It is broken either in one piece or separated into two pieces, but not both ways, so that it does not cause pain; or else the fracture occurs when it is separated, which makes the recovery difficult, or when it is infected.
E la operacio en aquela, quan la fractura es ses plagua, es que tu fassas esser present dos ministres, per so que la un tengua le adjutori e siegua la furcula trencada, e l’autre extenda le col ves aquela partida.	Then the operation on this is that you prepare two ministers; so that one may hold the fork that has been broken in half, and the other may extend the neck of the patient at the end that is separated.
E aprop enguala la fractura am les tieus ditz entro que sia fayta la forma de lu segon que cove, e no sia en lu eminencia pauca ni concavitat.	Then insert the points of the fork into the teeth, so that it takes the shape of the patient's mouth, and not be in its little prominence or concavity.
E si indigeysses mes de extencio, lahoras cove que pauses dejos le titillic del malaute spera de drap o de lana, e sia la grandesa de lu segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat; e exten e eleva la furcula e coarta la spera am la tua ma entro que enguales la frectura segon que cove.	And if you are too weak to hold the fork, then place a cloth or wool over your hand and hold it firmly; then extend and raise the fork and cut it with your hand above your head so that it cuts according to its length.
E si no podes atirar la extremitat de la furcula a las partidas defora, per so quar es pervenguda al preon, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sua cervitz, e pauses sobre le muscle de lu un coyssi migier en grandeza.	And if you cannot reach the end of the fork to the outside ends, because it reaches too far forward; then place the patient on their back and pause a small cloth over the neck, and hold it down with your hand.
E le ministre prema le muscle de lu a las partidas dejos entro que l’os de la furcula sia elevat que es en le preon en sus, e lahoras tu rectifique la fractura e enguala aquela am les tieus ditz.	Then the minister presses the neck muscles on the side that is separated from the patient, so that the bone of the fork is raised up to the place where it should be; and then adjust the fracture and insert the points with your teeth.
Mays si sentes satagias de la furcula e so maugudas, lahoras cove que fendes sobre aquela e extraguas aquelas satagias am facilitat.	Then, if you feel pain in the fork, then cut it off and remove those that hurt with ease.
E si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu ingenia inscisio de lu am un dels inscissoris les quals has apparelhatz ad aquo, pus que havias pausat dejos la furcula le sturment que serve le ciphac; e es sturment de fust o de ferr del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And if it is stuck in the bone, then use an invention of yours with one of the cutters that you have already used on water, because you have held it aside from the fork; and this cutter can be made of wood or iron, of which this is the shape:
E es semblant a culier del qual aquesta es la concavitat; e sia la sua latitut segon aquo que has necessitat de lu, segon la grandeza del os o la pauqueza de lu.	And it resembles a scythe whose concave shape matches this one; and its length should match what you have needed from it, according to the size of the bone or the width of it.
Mays la longitut de lu sia segon que es a tu possible a la operacio; que haja doas extremitatz ayssi cum vezes, e la una extremitat sia ample e l’autre streyta.	Then its length should be suitable for the operation; that there are two ends like this, and one end is wide and the other narrow.
E si la disrupcio de la plagua la qual has inscidida quan has extraytas la satagia del os es ampla, e yest segur de apostema caut, lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura.	And if the outbreak of infection which you have cut off from the bone is wide, and be sure to treat it with poultice; then adjust the two lips of the infection with sutures.
E si la disrupcio es pauca, o temes apostema caut, lahoras tu uemple la plagua am draps e pulvils segon la quantitat de la scissura de la plagua.	And if the disruption is small, or you fear an outbreak of infection, then use cloth and powder according to the quantity of the wound's opening.
E si accideys apostema caut, lahoras infon drap en vi agre e oli rozat e vi, e pausa sobre aquel.	And if an outbreak of infection occurs, then dip a cloth in vinegar and olive oil, and place it on it.
Mays la strictura del os quan es ses plagua e ses seccio, es que pauses emplastre fayt de farina de moli am album de huou, e pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e aprop pausa la spera dejos le titillic de lu, si indigeyssas de aquela, e aprop pren humemate, so es torca la qual teno les Sarrazis , que sia mot longua, e sia latitut de lu de un palm o entorn aquel; e aprop pausa pulvils duplicatz sobre la stopa e l’emplastre; e aprop pren una stela de taula subtil de la qual la latitut d’ela sia de tres ditz e en longitut semblantment; e aprop envolopa aquela en drap, e aprop envolopa aquel drap am la stela en lo loc sobre le loc de la fractura; e aprop pausa humemati ayssi cum es revout, e revol aquela sobre le col de lu e dejos le titillic de lu sa e dejos le titillic de lu malaute, e reduzeys aquela sobre tota partida, e quan vezes que la strictura de la fractura am strictura descent, e es aquo que no es occultat sobre tu.	Then the tightness of the bone when it is broken and sectioned off, is that you place a poultice made of flour with milk, and place it on the neck's knot, and turn the patient so that their face looks up; then, when you want to loosen the stricture of the fracture according to its tightness, then take two seeds of fennel, which should be long and wide; and its length should be about three fingers; and place them on the poultice; and then wrap the cloth around it; and then tie the cloth tightly; and then wrap that cloth around the patient's neck and back, and turn them so that their face is towards the ground.
E tot, que no sia mauguda la stelha desobre le os trencat; e per so cove que tu vejas le malaute quascun dia, que quan le liament es mollificat o vezas la stela ja esser remauguda, lahoras tu rectifica aquo e strenh la liadura.	And all this should be done so that the patient's jaw does not tighten; and therefore, when you see the ligature become soft or the stings are loosened, then adjust it and strengthen the ligature.
E aprop pausa le dormir del malaute sobre le col de lu, e pausa dejos le titillic de lu deves le dormir de lu en la nueyt un petit coyssi; per so que am aquel sia elevat le adjutori de lu del latz de aquel, e donc es elevada la la fractura de la furcula a elevacio del muscle; o sia le bras de lu liat al col de aquel.	Then place the patient to sleep on their neck, and pause a little cloth over their throat, so that it does not touch their neck completely; but so that it is raised a little from their neck, and then raise the fork up to the muscle' position; or hold it at the end of the neck.
E no deslies le liament si no accideys en le loc prusiment o apostema, entro a xii dias.	And do not remove the ligature if it does not happen in the place immediately or apoplexy, within twelve days.
E aprop renovelha le emplastre si has vista la facia de lu ad aquo, e ajusta en la strictura e restaura aquel e layssa entro que sia restaurat e sia coagulat la fractura de la furcula.	Then replace the plaster if you see the face of it moistened by water, and adjust it in the constriction and restore that, and leave it until it is restored and the fracture of the femur is coagulated.
E es strenguda e comfortada segon le mes en xxviii dias, e alcunas veguadas en alcus homes es fayt en mens de temps de aquel.	Then strengthen it and comforted according to the measure in twenty-eight days, and some witnessed in some men is done in the period of time from that.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter VI.
De restauracio de fractura de la spalla.	On the Restoration of a Fracture of the Shoulder Blade.
Spatula tart es trencada en le loc lat de lu e no so trencatz de lu sino les marges.	The spatula pie is broken in the place of the shoulder blade and are not broken from it but the edges.
E donc quan es trencat le loc de lu — e es trencat en le mieg loc de lu — e no es conogut sino per tocament, lahoras segon que es la figura de la fractura sforsa te la preparacio de lu e reduzir aquela segon la figura natural en tota manieyra de engen la qual es a tu possible.	And when the place of the shoulder blade is broken— and is broken in the middle of the shoulder blade— and is not known except by touching, then according to that it is the figure of the fracture dislocated I prepare it and reduce that according to the natural figure in all ways by preventing the which is possible.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc polvera de moli am album de huou e stopa leon; e aprop pausa pulvil de drap duplicat; e aprop pausa sobre lu stela lada de taula subtil segon la quantitat de la spatula tota o mays un pauc.	Then place over the place powder of flour white of wool and stops lion; and place a towel doubled; and place on it a thin board according to the quantity of the spatula whole or less a little.
Mays si dejos la stela es concavitat en alcu dels locs de la spatula, lahoras tu enguala aquela concavitat am stopa leon, e aprop pueja la stela segon equalitat.	More if the place is concave in some of the places of the spatula, then you fill that concave with lion's stop; and place the board according to equality.
E aprop strenh desus am humemati longua ab constriccio decent e am fermesa de la stela entro que no sia remauguda del sieu loc.	Then strengthen it above it with a long handle of string tight and secure the board within that is not remounted from its place.
E considera le liament en quascun dia; e totas veguadas que sia mollificat, lia autra veguada e stren le e equa la stela si es remauguda del sieu loc.	And consider the ligature in every day; and all witnessed that is softened, change it and strengthen the board if it is remounted from its place.
E jagua le malaute sobre le sieu latz sa.	And strike the patient on his back slowly.
E la spatula es restaurada en xx dias o en .xxv.	And the spatula is restored in twenty days or in .twenty-five.
E donc quan es complit aquest nombre, lahoras tu dissolveys le liament, e que tu scias ensegurat quar aquela es dels osses dels quals la cominicio no es temuda ni lor dissolucio.	And when this number is completed, then you dissolve the ligature, and that you know assuredly because that is of the bones of which the beginning is not wounded nor its dissolution.
E si procezeys del loc del os pessa e pongeys dejos la codena, lahoras tu scindeys sobre lu, e osta le, e fay segon que havem dit en la fractura de la furcula de sadacio de apostema caut si accideys aqui.	And if you make a hole in the place of the bone heavy and put away from it the chisel, then you split it above it, and stop it, and do according to what we have said in the fracture of the femur of sadacio of apoplexy caut if it happens here.
