More if the twist has already occurred in advance and it is very strong and has become a wound that must be treated with iron, then it is because it has already been softened, and the continuation of the bone has been dissolved, and it is cut where there is excess of the injury of that member, with a sharp knife, also considering the smallness of the knife, and applying ease in treating it and studying it.
Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter 23
De sermo en dislocacio.	Of speech in a dislocation.
Dislocacio es eyssiment de alcuna de las juncturas del sieu loc, per que es prohibida de movement, e es orrezada la figura del membre, e fa venir sobre le malaute dolors e lesios grans.	Dislocation is that the member has been moved out of its place, so it is prohibited from moving, and the figure of the member changes, causing great pain and major injuries.
Donc quan accideys ad alcu dislocacio, lahoras cove tantost perforsar que sia reduzit, e no tarde aquela reduzir, quar si es tardada, le loc es apostemat e fort leu am aquo es fayta dificil la reduccio de dislocaccio.	And so when there is a dislocation, let them soon pierce to the point that it is reduced, and do not delay that reduction, for if it is delayed, then the dislocation becomes fixed and difficult to reduce.
E per aysso no cove que sia maugut ni stendut en la hora de la apostemacio, quar motas veguadas fa venir spasme e dolors ledentz.	And so do not cover or stretch it at the time of the injection, for if you do, then the muscles will be strained and spasms and pains will occur in them.
Mays quan aquo accideys, lahoras cove que tu te coytes a la flaubotomia del malaute, e aprop sia layssat entro que repause le apostema; e aprop le membre sia embrocat am aygua cauda e oli, e aprop sia reduzit am facilitat.	And if it happens to you, then let them cut the skin of the thigh, and place it so that the injection is not given until it is in place; and the limb is smeared with oil and water, and reduced easily.
E tot membre sia curat am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra en son loc.	And let all of the limbs be cleaned with the water in which the memory will come to its place.
E yeu ja e ordenatz les capitols de dislocacio segon que es precedit en fractura; de la partida del cos pus sobirana entro a la partida pus dejos.	And you have already ordered that the joints of dislocation be taken care of according to what is followed in fracture; from the top of the body to the bottom.
Capitol .xxiiii.	Chapter.
De curacio de dislocacio de la mandibula dejos.	Of treatment of a dislocation of the jaw.
So dislocadas las doas mandibulas si no tart; e la dislocacio de amdos es fayta segon una de dos manieyras: que o son remaugudas de lurs locs per pauca remocio, e so mollificadas un petit; o so dislocadas per entiera dislocacio e complida, entro que sian mollificadas a la partida de la junctura entro que corro saliva del malaute e que no puesca tenir aquela ni puesca claure la sua boca, e la lengua de lu sia envolopada en sa paraula.	So the two jaws are not treated; and the dislocation of both is done according to one of two ways: that either they are taken out of their places by a small movement, and then they are softened a little; or they are dislocated completely and fully, until they are softened at the joint at the beginning, so that saliva does not come from the patient's mouth and his tongue is not wrapped up in it.
Mays quan la dislocacio de lu es pauca, lahoras en las majors disposicios retorna per si an pauca causa.	And if the dislocation of him is little, then let them return to their usual position by themselves for a little cause.
Mays si la dislocacio es entiera e complida, lahoras cove que sia administrada reduccio de lu leugierament, e no sia tardada de tot.	And if the dislocation is entire and full, then let them be reduced gently, and do not delay at all.
E es que·l ministre tengua le cap del malaute, e entrometa lo metge le dit pous de la una sieua ma en la razit de la dislocacio de la mandibula dedintz la boca de lu, si la dislocacio es de la una part; o que entrometa les sieus dos pouzes ensemps, si la dislocacio es de doas partz, e les autres ditz de las mas de lu sian defora am les quals enguale; e comanda al malaute que cesse las suas mandibulas e absolva aquelas anar de quascuna partida; e le metge engualhe la mandibula e enpellisca la mandibula entro que retorne al sieu loc.	And the minister has the head of the patient, and inserts it between the teeth of one half of the jaw inside the mouth of him, if the dislocation is on one side; or he inserts both sides together, if the dislocation is on two sides, and the others are outside where they belong; and orders the patient to cease his jaws and return them to their places; and inserts the jaw and wraps it up until it returns to its place.
E si dificil es la reducio de lu, e majorment si amdos las mandibulas so essemps dislocadas, lahoras aministra evoporacio am aygua cauda e oli, entro que sia fayta leugiera la reduccio de amdos e no tardes la reduccio de amdos de tot, ayssi quo havem dit.	And if the reduction of him is difficult, and mostly if both jaws are completely dislocated, then administer evaporation with oil and water, until the reduction of both is easy, and do not delay the reduction of both at all, as we have said.
E donc cum retornam e so engualadas, e es clausa la boca del malaute e no es mollificada, lahoras pausa sobre aquelas polvils de drap am cerot, e sia fayt de cera e oli rozat; e aprop sia liat am facilitat am liamens mols.	And then when they return and are wrapped up again, and the mouth of the patient is closed and is not softened, then place them on a cloth for protection, and let wax be made from oil and rosin; and let it be stretched easily with a soft hand.
E sia le dormir del malaute sobre le sieu dos, e·l cap de lu sia stant entre dos aurelhes, per so que no maugue aquel a la partida dreyta ni a la sinistra; e no li fassas per forsa masteguar alcuna causa; habans la sieua vianda sia forbicio leon, entro que quan las dolors sian remaugudas e las mandibulas so nozadas, lahoras maugue aquo que vol.	And let the patient sleep on his back, and let the head of him be between two pillows, so that he does not wake up to the right or left; and do not force him to eat for any reason; have a hard pillow under him, so that when the pains are returned and the jaws are locked, then let him wake up who wants.
E aquo sia aministrat am facilita, e no trebalhe sobre la apercio de la boca deves la comestio e beure e ocitatio, entro que la mandibula sia nozada e sanada.	And let it be administered easily, and do not work on the opening of the mouth before eating, drinking, or speaking; so that the jaw is locked and healed.
E si es dificil la reduccio de duas mandibulas quan so dislocadas en alcuna hora e no so convertidas als lors locs, lahoras motas veguadas accideysso febres e soda assidua, e fort leu es alerguat le ventre del malaute, e fort leu e vomeys colera pura.	And if the reduction of two jaws is difficult when they are dislocated at any time and are not returned to their places, then let sudden fever and frequent vomiting occur, and let strong pain arise in the abdomen of the patient, and strong diarrhea.
E quan tu vezes aquo, lahoras sapias que es perdicio; e motas veguadas mor aquel al qual accideys aquo en x dias.	And when you see this, then know that it is a loss; and let sudden death come to the one who experiences this in five days.
Capitol .xxv.	Chapter.
De reduccio de la dislocacio de la furcula e de la extremitat del muscle.	Of reduction of a dislocation of the clavicle and the end of the muscle.
Furcula no es dislocada del latz dedintz per la sua continuacio am le pietz; e alcunas veguadas es dislocada a la partida defora, e aquo es declarat al sentiment.	The furcola is not dislocated from behind by its continuity with the leg; and some are dislocated at the end outside, and this is announced to the feeling.
E la restauracio de lu es que·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu dos e extenda les sieus brasses.	And the restoration of him is that the patient lies on his back and stretches his arms.
E aprop coarta le loc am la tua palma am fort coartacio, quar ela retornara.	Then cut the place with your thumb firmly, for it will return.
E aprop pausa sobre aquela emplastre e pulvils e strenh aquela.	And then place on that ointment and cloth, and strengthen it.
Mays la extremitat de aquel que siec le coyde e·s continuat am aquel, no es dislocada en alcun dia; lahoras cove que sia reduzida e engualhada segon que havem dit e segon que es a tu aparelhat.	Then the end of him that seizes is not dislocated in any day; then let it be reduced and wrapped up according to what we have said, and according to your apparatus.
E aprop pausa sobre aquela emplastre, e pulvils, e extrictura, e comanda al malaute adherir a trenquilitat e a repaus entro que sia sanat.	And then place on that ointment, and cloth, and tighten it, and order the patient to stay quiet and at rest until he is healed.
E am aquesta meteyssa curacio es reduzida la extremita del muscle quan es separada del sieu loc.	And in this cure, the end of the muscle is reduced when it is separated from its place.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter.
De la reduccio de la dislocacio del muscle.	Of reduction of a dislocation of the muscle.
Sapias que·l muscle no es dislocat sino segon tres manieras, de las quals es la una que sia dislocat a la partida del titillic a la partida dejos.	Know that the muscle is not dislocated unless it is according to three ways, of which one is dislocated at the end of the rib at the beginning; and the other two are dislocated at both ends.
E la segonda es que sia dislocat a la partida desus del muscle, e aquo es fayt tart; e no es dislocat a las partidas detras per la spalla; e no es dislocat a las partidas denant per les nervis.	And the second is that it is dislocated at the end of its rib, and this is not difficult; and it is not dislocated behind by the shoulder; and it is not dislocated before by nerves.
E majorment es dislocat e defora eyssit a las partidas dejos deves le titillic, e majorment en aquels dels quals las carns son paucas, leugierament es dislocat; mays en aquels en les quals so motas carns, es eyssit fora am dificultat.	And most of the time it is dislocated and goes out from behind at the beginning of the rib, and most of the time it is dislocated slightly; but in those where the flesh is thick, it is dislocated easily; but in those where the flesh is little, it goes out with difficulty.
E fort leu accideys ad alcus homes percussio o cazement, e le muscle de lu es apostemat de apostema caut, e es cujat per aquo que ja sia dislocat.	Then sudden pain occurs in some men by a blow or accident, and the muscle of him is torn from its place; and it is recognized by the pain that has already been dislocated.
Adonc cove que tu sproes aquo entro que estias sobre-sertetut de lu, e lahoras procesiscas en la curacio de lu.	And then let them not be too worried about him, for you are already relieved from worry; and proceed to the cure of him.
E es conoguda la dislocacio de lu quan es a las partidas dejos deves le titillic; per so que distingescas entre le muscle dislocat e·l muscle sa, quar tu atrobas entre aquels diversitat manifesta; e atrobas en le cap del muscle concavitat e dejos le titillic deves le tocament del cap del muscle ayssi quo un huou, e al malaute no pot redusir la sua ma a la sieua aurelha, ni maure aquela per totz movementz.	And it is clear that the dislocation of him is at the beginning of the rib; but so that you can distinguish between the dislocated muscle and the other, for you see a great difference between them; and you feel a depression in the top of the muscle, and to the patient's ear, he cannot reduce his jaw to its place by all his movements.
Si es dislocat deves le pietz o ensus, e tu lahoras atrobas manifest tocament, e no es amaguat.	If it is dislocated, then let them feel a firm touch, and do not be afraid.
E de aquesta dislocacio es fayta leugiera reduccio quan es fresca e le malaute es enfant.	And of this dislocation, a slight reduction is made when it is fresh, and the patient is child.
E la reduccio de lu es que·l ministre eleva la ma de lu a las partidas desus; e aprop pause les tieus pouses dejos le titillic de lu, e eleva la junctura am fortaleza en sus al sieu loc, e·l ministre eleva la ma de lu, e extenda aquela en sus; e aprop pausa aquela dejos quar ela retorna leugierament.	And the reduction of him is that the minister raises his hand to the top of it; and then places the ties on both sides of his rib at its end, and tightens it with force in its place; and the minister raises the patient' hand, and extends it forward; and then places the ties on both sides as they return slightly; for they return easily.
Mays si per aquo que havem dit no retorna, e so del comensament que accidic la dislocacio, motz dias, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia banhat en aygua cauda e sia aministrada enbrocacio que mollifique e liniesca ayssi cum si so coytz razitz de altea, e fenugrec, e melillot en aygua, e sia administrada.	And if, by the way that I have said, it does not return, then let it be from the beginning where dislocation occurs; and let them be bathed in oil and water, and let them be given a massage with hot stones; and let oil be applied to the whole body as if they were being stripped of their clothes; and let fenugrec and mielot be added to the water, and administered.
E aprop le malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu dos e sia pausat dejos le titillic de lu espera de lana que sia engual entre levitat e strictura, e aprop le metge pause le sieu talo sobre la spera, e eleva le cap del muscle am vertut, e atire la ma del malaute per que no sia mauguda a las partidas dejos, e autre ministre tengua le cap del malaute, que no sia maugut a las partidas dejos, quar aquela tantost retorna al sieu loc.	And then the patient is placed on his back and his legs are raised slightly with cloth; and the doctor tightens it with force, and waits for him to relax; and he places his leg on the spine, and lifts the top of the muscle with his hand, and throws the patient' head so that it does not touch the ground, and another minister holds the patient' head, so that it does not touch the ground either; because this one returns to its place quickly.
E si voles, reduzeys aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu fassas esser prezent un home le qual sia pus lonc que·l malaute, e estia de la part de aquel latz, e entrometa le sieu muscle dejos le titillic del malaute e eleve le titillic de lu a las partidas desus entro que·l malaute sia suspendut en ayre, e autre ministre tire la ma del malaute de las partidas dejos del sieu ventre.	And if you wish, reduce this second in such a way: and it is that you being present a man who was longer than the patient, and stood on this side of the latter, and entrenches his muscle between the titillic of the patient and raises the titallic of him to the split within that the patient be suspended in air, and another minister pulls the patient's hand from the splits of his belly.
Mays si le malaute es leugier, lahoras cove que am lu que autre causa sia suspenduda, per so que grave aquel, quar la dislocacio retorna tantost.	If the patient is loose, then know that another cause is suspended, so that this one, for so much as the dislocation returns soon.
E es reduzit eysament segon autra manieyra: e es que sia ficat en terra un fust lonc le cap del qual sia redon de figura, ayssi cum pilo de mortier, que no sia gros ni subtil, e aprop sia pausat dejos le malaute; pus que so pausatz sobre·l cap del fust draps leons, e·l malaute sia stant segon la longitut del fust, e aprop sia extenduda la ma de lu a las partidas dejos del autra part; e sia extendut le cos de lu del autre part am fortaleza, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	And it is reduced with care according to another way: and it is that he be laid on the ground a pole long enough whose top be round of form, thus with a mortar's head, that not be thick nor thin, and be placed from behind the patient; for they are placed on the top of the pole lions' skins, and the patient stands according to its length, and his hand is extended from behind him at the split; and his legs are extended from the other side with strength, because the joint returns to its place quickly.
E si es dificil reduccio de lu per totas las causas que havem ditas, lahoras usa de aquesta cura: e es que tu prenguas un fust la quantitat del qual sia en le lonc de dos brasses, e latitut de aquel sia de quatre ditz, e la grossetut de lu sia aleujat en le preon del tittilic segon aquesta forma:	And if the reduction of him is difficult for all the causes that we have said, then use this cure: and it is that you take a pole whose quantity be in its length of two brases, and its width of four dizes, and its thickness be separated in the preon of the titillic according to this form:
E aprop sobre le cap redon sian liatz drap leons per so que·l fust no ledesca le malaute.	And they are placed on the top round skin is tied on the pole so that it does not slip the patient.
E aprop sia pausat dejos le titillic del malaute, e sia extenduda la ma o le bras sobre·l fust entro a las partidas dejos, e sia liat le fust sobre le adjutori e le bras e la extremitat de la ma.	And they are placed from behind the titilic of the patient, and his hand or his leg is extended on the pole within the splits, and it is tied the pole on the helpers and the arm and the end of the hand.
Aprop sia pausat le bras sobre un scalo de scala segon la latitut, e la ma sia extenduda a las partidas dejos, e l’autre cos sia suspendut de l’autre part, quar la junctura intra tantost.	Then they are placed the arm on a step according to its width, and his hand is extended from behind him at the splits, and the other side is suspended from the other side, because the joint returns soon.
E cum le intrament de lu es complit segon quascuna maniera que es a tu possibla, e lahoras cove que tu pauses dejos le titillic spera de lana de engual quantitat; e aprop pauza emplastre perparat de polvera de moli am enses e album de huou sobre tot le muscle, ayssi quo es revolvut desus, e aprop strenh dejos le titillic am strictura decent; e le liament sia revolvut sobre le emplastre, e la ma de lu sia annectida al col de lu, e sia leyssat, e no sia mauguda la ma de lu per vii dias.	And with the instrument of him is completed according to each way that it is possible to you, and then know that you leave from behind the titilic a length of wool; and they are placed a paste prepared of mortar' dust and white of egg on all the muscle, thus being turned down it, and then tighten from behind the titilic with a force; and the joint is turned over the paste, and his hand is joined to its neck, and it is tied, and not be loosened his hand for seven days.
E cove que sia pausada la vianda del malaute pauca, entro que·l membre sia confortat, quar es pus leugier a la sanacio de lu.	And then that the patient's food is little placed, within that the member is comforted, because it has been longer to its cure.
E aprop la vianda sia donada major aprop vii o v e sia exercitat un movement; e donc si es fermat e no es mollificat, lahoras ja es sanat.	And then the food is given more often than seven days or it is exercised a movement; and if it stops and does not be softened, then it already is healed.
Mays si la junctura es dislocada motas veguadas per humiditat que accideys a lu o per autra causa, lahoras cove que en aquela sia administrat cauteri am tres traucs, segon que denant es dit en le capitol de cauteri.	If the joint is dislocated there are seen by moisture that happens to him or for another cause, then know that in this one is administered cauterization with three cuts according to what was said before in the chapter of cauterization.
E si tot aysso es fayt e aprop vii dias es desliat le liament e la junctura no es fermada, e le emplastre e la strictura son reduzitz sobre lu alcunas veguadas, e no es fermada e catz e no pot elevar aquel bras a las partidas desus, lahoras sapias que·ls nervis de lu, les quals so al cap del muscle, ja so inscizes o extendutz o mollificatz, e sapia que la junctura nul temps no sira ficada en loc sieu.	And if all this is not done and seven days are passed it is separated the joint and the cauterization and the stricture are reduced on him some times, and it does not be fixed and the skin and not can raise that arm at the splits, then know that its nerves, which are to the top of the muscle, already have been cut or extended or softened; and you know that the joint will never remain in its place.
De la dislocacio de aquela qu’es fayta deves le pietz e la mamilha o las partidas detras, la reduccio es fayta am impulcio e extencio am las mas, entro que retorne.	From the dislocation of that which is done deves the foot and the nipple or the splits behind, the reduction is made with an impulsion and an extension to the more, within that it returns.
E sia administrada en aquela l’autra strictura, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And be administered in that one another stricture, and cure that one within that it is healed.

And if it happens near the healing gravity in the member and delay in the movement of him, then the patient uses bath water that is separated by the gravity and returns to its natural form first.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter.xxvii.
De curacio de dislocacio del coyde.	Of cure of dislocation of the hip.
Sapias que la junctura del coyde es dislocada am difficultat e semblantment retorna am difficultat; e aquela es dislocada a totas partidas, e majorment a la partida denant a la partida detras, e la dislocacio de lu no es amaguada a tu quar es cazent dejos le vezement o dejos le tocament segon qualque figura sia dislocat, e quan ajustes le coyde disloguat am le sa, aquo es a tu declarat manifestament, quar la junctura es concavada e no pot doblar le bras, ni tocar am aquel le sieu muscle.	You know that the hip' joint is dislocated with difficulty and seems to return with difficulty; and it is dislocated at all splits, especially in the front split to the back, and the dislocation of him is not covered by your skin or by your touch according to some shape is dislocated, and when you adjust the hip dislocated with the hand with which you hit, then it is declared manifestly, because the joint is bent and cannot bend the arm, nor can touch on its muscle.
E cove que·t coytes, e reduzescas la dislocacio tantost denant que vengua a lu apostema caut, quar si ve a lu apostema caut, dificil es la reduccio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot; e majorment quan es a las partidas detras, quar pus mala es de totas las autras specias de dislocacio, e de major dolor, e motas veguadas deyssen am aquela la mort.	And then your heels, and reduce the dislocation as soon as possible before that it comes to him a puss of cauterization, because if it sees to him a puss of cauterization, the reduction is difficult for him, and fort painful does not heal completely; and especially when it is in the back splits, because it is worse of all the other dislocations, and of greater pain, and causes some times to die.
E la restauracio de lu, quan es aquela que es possibla reduzir, es que la ma de lu sia extenduda am doas mas, e le bras de lu sia expandut, e las mas del metge sian sobre le coyde e dejos lu, e el empellisca la junctura am les pouzes de las suas mas ensemps, o am la razit de la sua palma entro que torne en son loc.	And the recovery of him, when it is that one possible to reduce it, is that his hand be extended with two hands, and its arms are expanded, and the sides of the body are over the hip and away from him, and he pushes the joint with his knuckles together or with the heel of his palm as soon as it returns to its place.
Mays si la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras retorna ayssi que dobla la ma am la sua ma, entro que percuta le coyde am la razit de la sua palma.	If the dislocation is in the front splits, then return this way that it doubles his hand with his own hand, within that it hits on the hip with the heel of his palm.
E si la dislocacio no obezeys a la reduccio, lahoras aministra vehement extencio e mot fort.	And if the dislocation does not obey to the reduction, then administer violent extension and do it hard.
E es que dos ministres extendan le bras, e tenguan aquel eyssament dos ministres per so que no sia remaugut deves la extencio.	It is that two ministers extend the arms, and have him a puss of two ministers for so that it does not be turned again after extension.
E aprop sia revolvut le bras deves tota part, pus que es envolopat drap doblat lonc sobre la ma de lu, o liament.	And then they are turned the arms before all its parts, because they are wrapped skin that is folded long on his hand, or joint.
E quant le metge toca la junctura am la sua ma, unte aquela am alcun oli per so que aquo sia aquelas causas las quals ajudan en lubricitat de la junctura am facilitat; e aprop empellesca la junctura am empulcio vehement entro que retorne.	And when the body touches the joint with his hand, anoint that one with some oil for so that it is those causes which help in lubrification of the joint with ease; and then push the joint with a violent impulsion as soon as it returns to its place.
E aprop la reduccio de lu cove que sia pausat sobre aquela empastre en le qual sia stipticitat e excequacio am album de huou, e sia extrenhut am strictura descent, e·l bras sia suspendut del col, e sia layssat per alcus dias.	And then the reduction of him is placed over that paste in which there is rigor and execution with white of egg, and it is extended with a force downward, and his hand is joined to its neck, and it is left for some days.
E aprop sia desliat; e donc si la junctura es formada en le sieu loc, lahoras tu deslia le liament de lu e layssa aquela.	And then it is separated; and if the joint is formed in its place, then your hand separates the joint from him and leaves that one.
E si vezas la junctura no be strenher, lahoras tu itera le emplastre e·l liament, e layssa aquela per alcus dias entro que sia extrenhuda; e aprop deslia aquela.	And if you see the joint is not stronger, then your hand iterates the paste and the joint, and leaves that one for some days within that it is extended; and then separate that one.
Mays si accideys a lu gravitat aprop la reduccio de la junctura, e la disposicio de lu es en movement, lahoras aministra humectacio en banh e fricacio subtil, e comprecio, entro que sia aleujat; o pausa sobre la junctura aleliati, so es coyssa de moto grassa; e aprop sia liada, e layssa aquela sobre le os le dia e la nueyt.	If it happens near the reduction of the joint gravity, and the disposition of him is in movement, then administer bath with humidity and a subtle friction, and compression within that it is separated; or pause on the joint with a weight, so it is left from movement; and then tie it, and leave that one for a day and a night.
E aprop osta aquela, e met aquel en banh; e quan suza, lahoras tu fregua la junctura am fricacio temprada, e aprop itera sobre aquela aleliati, so es ronhonal de moto, una veguada, e la segonda, e la .iii.a.,	And then tie that one, and put that one in bath; and when it is warm, then your hand rubs the joint with a strong friction, and then iterates on that one with a weight, so it is heard a noise of movement, once, and the second, and the third;
corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denolam intrament de banh, entro que sia linit.	Corruption has already come about on the denouement of the bath, unless it is liminary.
E si voles, pausa sobre aquela fenda de vaca humida e scalfada am boder e stren sobre aquel; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas, quar aquela es humida e reduzeys a la sua disposicio.	And if you wish, pause on that cow' split with wet and sharp friction against him; and you make some times to it, because that one is wet and reduces its disposition.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter .xxviii.
De curacio de dislocacio de malassen, so es de la junctura que es entre·l bras e la ma.	On the Treatment of Dislocation of the Shoulder, if it is at the joint where the arm meets the body.
Malassen de la ma alcunas vetz es deslocada, e la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es leugiera, e·l contrari es de las autras juncturas, mays empero cove que sia velocitat en la reduccio de lu en la hora en la qual es deslocada, denant que le loc sia apostemat o que accida en lu apostema caut.	If the shoulder is dislocated, and the reduction (re-position) is slow, and conversely for the other joints; nevertheless it is necessary to hurry in reducing it at the moment when it has been displaced, before a lump forms or an ulcer appears from the impact.
E la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es que tu pauses la junctura de la ma del malaute sobre una taula e le ministre extenda la ma de aquel, e le metge pause la sua ma o o la sua palma sobre la iminencia de la junctura, e empellisca aquela entro que retorne al sieu loc.	And for reducing the dislocated shoulder; you should place the shoulder of the patient onto a table, and have a minister extend the patient's arm, and the doctor places their hand or palm on the joint, and pushes gently to bring it back into place.
Mays empero cove que sia considerat si la palma ja es ostada al ventre de la ma, lahoras le malaute pause le dos de la sua ma sobre una taula deves la extencio e la reduccio; e si la dislocacio es precedent deves le dos de la ma, lahoras sia la posicio de la ma de aquel intrinicequement sobre la taula, per so que la ma del metge caja sobre aquela iminencia de la junctura.	However, if the palm is already held by the patient towards their stomach, then have the patient extend their arm onto a table for extension and reduction; but if the dislocation is previous, then hold the patient's hand firmly upon the table, so that the doctor's hand rests on the joint in question.
E donc si retorna tantost, bon es; e sino, lahoras strenh aquela am empastre cedant le apostema e layssa aquel; e no iteres aquo, quar sino, no soferta ni no podes sobre la reduccio de lu pus que passan a lu dias.	And if it returns soon, then it is good; but if not, then strengthen that one with plasters while there is an ulcer; and do not repeat this, for unless the reduction is quick, it will not work and it will not be possible to reduce it except by waiting a few days.
Mays empero la junctura roman segon la sua tortuositat; e no notz al malaute alcuna causa, sino que la ma es mollificada e no pot strenher alcuna causa; lahoras sapias que les nervis son trincatz o trissatz, e lahoras no es engen en lu sino que sia strenhuda am cauteri prop le cazament de lu e fort leu aquo confereys alcuna causa.	However, the Roman joint is second only in its tortuousness; and there is no cause for the patient to feel weak, but rather their muscles are relaxed and do not hold themselves; then you should know that the nerves are torn or stretched, and it is not possible to treat them except by a strong cauterization near the joint and firm pressure thereon; then apply some cause.
Donc cum malassem es retornada, lahoras pausa sobre lu empastre le qual havem recomtat, e sia layssat e strenhut per v dias; e aprop sia desliat e sia layssat e la ma de lu sia excercitada.	Then, if the malady returns after having been remedied with plasters, then allow it to rest and strengthen for a few days; and then remove them and exercise the hand.
Mays si le movement de lu es ostat e accideys en lu alcuna gravitat, lahoras leniys aquela am aygua cauda e am fricacio alcunas veguadas, entro que sia alleujat.	But if the movement is excessive and causes pain, then have that one rest with their hand in water and apply friction to some areas, so that it feels better.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter 29.
De la curacio de dislocacio dels ditz.	On the Treatment of Dislocation of the Fingers.
Alcunas veguadas so dislocatz les ditz a tota partida.	Some joints are dislocated at their very beginnings.
E quan es dislocat alcun dit de aquels al dos de la palma o al ventre de lu, lahoras sten le dit e impelleys la dislocacio de lu am les tieus pouses, entro que retorne.	And when any finger of these is dislocated at the joint with the palm or at the base of the finger, then bend the finger and push it back into place, so that it does not return to its original position.
E aprop sostenta le cap del dit, e suspen aquel deves la part a la qual es dislocat, e layssa aquel per dos dias.	Then support the end of the finger, and suspend it from the part where it is dislocated, and leave it for two days.
E aprop suspen aquel e exten aquel entro que dreyt sia engualhat en aquel sieu dia.	Then hang that one up and extend that joint so that it may be reabsorbed by the body in a day or two.
E quan sira noyt, lia aquel segon aquela narracio, e no cesses desliar aquel en le dia e exercitar am movement, e lia aquel en la noyt; e fay aquo per alcus dias entro que sia streyt.	And when the pain subsides, then follow the previous instructions, and do not stop exercising the movement, and keep it extended at night; and make sure to be patient.
E fay semblant am aquo, si es dislocat al ventre de la ma, e lia aquel ad aquela partida e fay am aquo la tieua primiera operacio, entro que sia sanat.	And if it is dislocated at the base of the finger, then bend that one back, and follow the same instructions as before; and if it does not improve, then apply a different treatment, so that it heals.
E semblantment fay am aquo quan es dislocat a las autres partidas.	And in the same way, if it is dislocated at any other joint.
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter 30.
De la curacio de dislocacio dels spondils del dos.	On the Treatment of Dislocation of the Vertebrae in the Back.
Quan accideys ad alcun dels spondils del dos o del col dislocacio complida, e so remaugutz motz spondils de lors locs, lahoras en aquela no es curacio, quar la mort se coyta al malaute.	And when a dislocation of the vertebrae in the back or neck occurs completely, and one or more vertebrae are dislocated from their position, then there is no cure for this patient; death comes quickly.
E senhal de aquo es que la egestio del malaute es fora-eyssida ses voluntat, e no pot retenir aquela; e motas veguadas so mollificatz alcus membres de lu o doas cambas de lu o dos brasses de lu, o un de aquels; o es remaugut un spondil de son loc, quar motas veguadas es remaugut e motas veguadas es fayta la remocio de aquels a quatre partidas.	This is to say that the patient's vomit can be forced out of their will, and they cannot hold it in; or several members of the body become weak, or two limbs or two arms are dislocated from their joints, for some limbs or two arms are dislocated from their joints. For some limbs are dislocated from their joints and fall to the ground, and some limbs become withered.
Donc aquela ja es remauguda a las partidas detras e es nompnada gelbozitat.	Then that one has already fallen in four parts behind; this is called a "gelbow".
Mays la curacio de lu es que lahoras consideras si la gelbozitat accidey de puerissia, quar lahoras en aquela no es curacio ni de aquela no es sanacio de tot.	However, the cure for this is that you should consider whether it has happened because of a disease of the body; because in this case there will be no cure or healing for it completely.
Mays en aquela que ve per cazement o per percussio o per semblant ad aquels, ja diyssero les Antics las manieras de curacio am sermo prolixs, del qual lo mays retorna am profieyt; mays yeu ja e abreujat de aquel del qual lo pauc escusa del trop de lu, per la mieua propinquitat a la entencio mieua exposicio, am la qual he aquo expausat et format ex instrument divers de aquel am le qual mostrero aquo e espausero aquel.	However, in those that happen by accident or impact or seem to be affected by them; the ancient books speak at length about their cures, some of which do return after a long time has passed, and others are new creations made from an instrument that is not usually used; one that I have found useful and that I will share with you.
E dic que en gelbosita que accideys de la partida denant en le pietz, no es engen ni sanacio de aquela; e semblantment en aquela que es fayta a dos latz.	And it is said that if the dislocation occurs from the front of the foot, there will be no cure or healing for that one; and in a similar way, if it happens to two feet.
E de aquelas no es curada sino aquela que accideys en le dos propriament am aquo que yeu recomti.	And those cannot be cured except by water; that is what I have recommended.
E es que·l malaute sia extendut sobre la sua cara sobre pug engual prop de paret, e sia extendut dejos lu esturment molh per so que no sia lidit le pietz de lu.	And the patient be placed on their face, extended over a table with their feet hanging over the edge, and a wet instrument held near their toes.
E aprop un fust dreyt sia pausat, ficat en la terra en la extremitat del pug entorn le cap de lu, e autra fust en aviro les pes de lu en l’autra extremitat del pueg.	Then a long stick be placed on the ground at the end of the foot near the heel of the patient's hand, and another one held up by their toes in the other end of the table.
E·l ministre tengua le fust, e no sia fermat en fossa; e autre ministre tengua l’autre segon aquela forma.	The minister should hold the stick, and not be placed in a pit; and another minister should hold the other one in this way.
E aprop envolopa sobre le cap del malaute e dejos les titillic liamen leon ferm; e exten la extremitat del liamel al fust le qual es deves le cap de lu, e lia aquel en lu; e aprop strenh l’autre liament sobre las ancas de lu les denols de lu, e deves las cambas de lu; e aprop ajusta totz les liamentz e lia aquels en l’autre fust le qual es deves les pes de lu.	Then wrap the cap of the patient around your neck and let the little fingers touch the ground in front of you, and extend that end of the limb with the stick; and then strengthen the other limb by holding its extremities together and keeping them apart, and then adjust all the limbs, and place those on the other stick that is meant for the feet.
E aprop le ministre cascu extenda le liament a la partida del fust, e no sian remaugutz les dos fustz e les liamentz dels sieus locs en les quals son ficatz, mays empero no so fermatz ayssi cum havem dit.	Then the minister should drop the limb onto the end of the stick, and not let them hang in mid-air; however, they should not be held like this permanently.
E le metge pause las suas palmas sobre le spondil am fortaleza entro que retorne, o que pause sobre aquela una taula, e aprop que ajuste sobre la taula les sieus pes entro que retorne.	And the doctor should place their palms onto the spine with force, so that it returns to its original position, or they should place it on a table, and then adjust their legs onto the table as well.
Mays si no retorna per aquesta forma, lahoras pren una taula de la qual la latitut o la longitut sia en aviro de tres brassas, e cava en la paret de la qual havem dit que es prop le malaute un loc en le qual intre la extremitat de la taula.	However, if it does not return by this method, then you should find a table whose height or length is at an angle to three bras; and dig into the wall where I have said that it is convenient for the patient to stand with their feet on either side of the table.
E aprop pausa la maytat de la taula sobre le spondilh, e·l metge pause les sieus pes sobre l’autre extremitat, e estrenha be entro que le spondil sia coartat e que retorne al sieu loc.	Then the minister should place the end of the table onto the spine, and the doctor should place their legs onto the other end of the table, and then adjust it so that the spine is straightened, and then release it back into its original position.
E si tu voles, obre am torn le qual es revolvut am la ma; e es que tu fiques en terra deves le cap del malaute en le derier del pug dos fustz, la longitut dels quals sia d’un bras, e deves le cap de lu en le derier del pug eyssament dos fustz; e sia la longitut que es entre quascun fust un palm, e ja es fayt en quascun fust trauc en le qual corr torn, e quascun sia mot fermat en terra per so que no sia maugut.	And if you wish, then open the door by which one enters; and it is that the cap of the patient be placed at the back of two poles, whose length is a palm, and the cap of the patient in the back of two poles; and it is that the length between each pole be a palm, and so it is done in each pole above the ground, so that one can run back into the room, and someone stop them from running out by holding them on the ground.
E sia mes un fust redon en le qual es le torn, e sia revolvut en les dos traucs dels dos fustz.	And there should be a long stick that is turned around at both ends of the two poles; and it is that this long stick be held between the two poles, so that one end is at the door where people enter, and the other end be turned around to the back of the two poles, so that it touches the ground.
E en la extremitat de lu es un trauc en le qual es format le fust, la longueza del qual es un palm am aquo que es revolvut; e en les dos autres fustz es semblant de aquel.	And at the end of it is a pole that forms the stick, whose length is a palm, and in the other two poles is similar to this one.
E aprop strenh les liamentz que has streyt en le pietz del malaute en le trau le qual es deves le cap de lu, e les liamentz que has streyts en las coyssas de lu en le torn le qual es deves les pes de lu.	And tighten the ligaments that you have stretched in the foot of the patient in the bed where his head is, and the ligaments that you have stretched in his thighs in the turn where his feet are.
E aprop deves quascun torn e stia un ministre que torssa le torn am la sua ma, e le metge engualhe le spondil segon que havem dit.	And place a servant in each turn and the doctor rubs the spine according to what we have said.
E aquesta es la forma del torn:	This is the way the turn is done:
E aprop pus que le spondil es retornat, e le loc es engualhat, lahoras cove que pauses empastre exciccatiu am album de huou, e aprop estopa; e aprop pause sobre le empastre astela de taula de la qual la latitut sia de tres ditz o enviro aquels, e la longitut de lu sia quantitat que prengua le loc de la gelbositat, e sobre la partida del spondil sa.	And then that the spine is returned and the place is closed, it is necessary to apply a dry and stiff plaster of white calamine on the back, and then cover it; and place over the plaster an ovoid or circular board whose length is three hands or more than those, and whose width is the amount that takes up the space of the swelling, and on the top of the spine.
E aprop sia liat am liament le qual havem dit, e uze le malaute de nutriment subtil entro que sia sanat.	And then tie with a ligature the member that we have said, and use the patient's nutrition for it to heal.
E si roman alcuna iminencia en le loc en la fi de la sanacio, lahoras cove que sian aministradas medicinas que moilifico e liniscan am aministracio de la taula per lonc temps, la qual havem recomtada; e ja es aministrada en aquel loc lamina de plom.	And if there is any imminence in the place at the end of the cure, then when the medicine that softens and smoothes has been administered to the patient for a long time, which we have recommended; and it is given in that place a plate of lead.
E alcunas veguadas accideys imminencia en le derier dels spondils del dos, e es cujat per aquela dislocacio; e es aquel os le qual ja imineys per que no cove que sia fayta prosompcio a lu am aquesta medicina, quar fort leu fara a tu accidir mort.	And in some cases there is imminent danger in the last of the spine of the two, and it is caused by that dislocation; and it is that bone which you have already mentioned because it does not require that medicine to be given to it, for it would make the patient die.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter 31.
De curacio de anca dislocada.	Of Cure of a Hip Joint Dislocation
Sapias que la junctura del ancha e la junctura del muscle no endeve sino dislocacio tant solament, e no accideys ad aquelas aquo que accideys a las autras juncturas de petita remocio e concavitat.	Know that the hip joint and the muscle joint do not cause anything except dislocation when they move slightly and have a cavity, and those who happen to them are not like those who happen to other joints of small movement and curvature.
E la junctura de la ancha es dislocada segon quatre manieyras, quar es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, o a las partidas defora, o a las partidas denant, o a las partidas detras.	And the hip joint is dislocated according to four ways, because it is dislocated in the inner parts, or in the outer parts, or in the front parts, or in the back parts.
E majorment es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, e pauc a las partidas denant o a las partidas detras.	And mostly it is dislocated in the inner parts, and rarely in the front or back parts.
E senhal de la dislocacio de lu a las partidas de dintz es quar, quan tu ajustas la camba del malaute sana am la malaute, es pus longua e·l denolh es pus heminent que de la sana, e·l malaute no pot doblar le sieu pe deves le lenguonar, e es le loc que siec le lengonar apostemat de apostema caut, per so que·l cap de la coyssa ja es pervengut aqui.	And the sign of the dislocation of it in the inner parts is that when you adjust the patient's back with a curve, it becomes longer and the nape is closer to the spine, and the patient cannot bend his neck as it is stuck at the top of the thigh.
E·l senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio es a las partidas defora, es que les accidentz de lu so contraris ad aquest accident.	And the sign of that person who has dislocated his hip is in the outer parts, that is, if he has an accident, his opposite will be like this accident.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas denant es quar expan la camba sieua segon compliment, mays empero no dobla aquela ses dolor que es en le denol, e si se perforsa ad anar e no pot sobre aquo a las partidas denant; e la urina de lu es retenguda e l’engonar de lu es apostemat, e deves la ambulacio de lu sobre le talo.	And the sign of that person who has dislocated his hip to the front is that he expands his back according to the complement, but moreover he does not bend that pain which is in the nape, and if he walks he cannot reach the front parts; and his urine is repressed and his skin becomes swollen, and his walk is on tiptoe.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas detras es que no expande le denol, ni no puesca doblar aquel denant que doble le engonar, e la camba de lu es pus breva que l’autra, e l’engonar es mollificat, e·l cap de la coyssa es deves aquel loc.	And the sign of that person who has dislocated his hip to the back is that he does not expand his nape, nor can he bend that neck which bends his back more than its opposite, and his back is shorter than the other, and his skin becomes soft, and the top of the thigh is the place.
Mays reduccio de las specias de aquesta dislocacio es que tu consideras, lahoras, si la dislocacio es vetusta et antiqua, que ja es anticada am le havent aquela aprop tu aministras reduccio de lu e roman segon la sua disposicio, lahoras no es en aquela curacio de tot; e adonc no cove que en aquela sia fayta prosompcio.	But the reduction of these spices of this dislocation is that you consider, then, if the dislocation is old and ancient, that it has already been cured with that medicine which you have recommended to administer to it and arranged according to its position; then it is not a cure of all. And then it does not require that medicine to be given to it, for it would make the patient die.
Mays en aquel del qual la dislocacio es recent, e es una de las quatre specias de dislocacio, lahoras te coyta ad aquo que volvas la junctura e extendas aquela a las partidas dedintz e a las partidas defora, e mau aquela a la dextra e sinistra, quar fort leu retorna e no indigeys de autra cura.	But in that person whose dislocation is recent and is one of the four species of dislocation, you should bind him so that you restore the joint to its inner parts and outer parts, and place him on his right and left sides, because it returns with great force and does not require another cure.
Mays, si no retorna en aquesta manieyra, lahoras cove que tu prepares ministre fort e extendas la camba de lu de la partida pus dejos, o am las suas mas, o am liament lo qual es liat sobre la camba desus le denol; e autre ministre extenda la ma de aquel desus enayssi que meta las suas mas dejos les titillics de lu; e aprop strenha am liament leon sobre la razit de la coyssa, e tengua autre ministre ters le extremitat del liament.	But if it does not return in this way, then you should prepare a strong servant and extend the patient' back from the front part, or between his legs, or with a ligament that is tied above his spine; and another servant extends the patient' hand from behind, so that it touches its opposite leg at the tips of its toes; and place another servant below the spine, so that it does not touch its opposite leg. And then tighten the ligament on top of the spine, and hold the server's hand with a strong grip.
E sia extencio de lu o de la partida dedintz a l’angonar a la partida de la furcula, o de la partida detras a la partida del dos.	And it is extended from him or from the inner part to the swelled part, or from the back part to the hip joint.
E sia la extencio de totz aquels en una veguada entro que·l malaute sia elevat am le sieu cos de terra e que romangua pendent.	And it is all of those in one way that the patient is lifted by his head to the ground and his feet are hanging.
E aquesta specia de extencio es specia cominal a totas quatre.	This species of extension is specific to all four.
E donc si la dislocacio retorna am aquo que havem dit, sira bo; e sino, lahoras es necessari a tota specia aquo que dire de la propria curacio.	And so if the dislocation returns to the medicine that we have said, it is good; otherwise, then all species of medicine that describe the cure of themselves are necessary.
En la reduccio de lu propria, quan es dislocada, e la dislocacio es a las partidas dedintz, cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu latz sa; e aprop pausa les liamentz sobre la razit de la coyssa en aquel loc le qual entre le cap de la coyssa e·l loc que es dejos le langonar; e aprop exten le liament en sus de la part del angonar a la pus auta partida de la furcula.	In the reduction of itself when it is dislocated, and the dislocation is in the inner parts, then the patient is raised on his back; and place the ligaments on the top of the spine in that place where the top of the thigh is and where it is swollen; and extend the ligament behind the hip joint to the front part of the thigh.
E aprop autre ministre fort prengua les brasses de lu, e amerme le loc gros de la coyssa malaute e extenda a las partidas deforo per extencio vehement, quar aquela retorna en le sieu loc.	And another strong server takes hold of the patient' arms, and extends his back part by violent extension, because that returns to its own place.
E aquesta specia es de pus leugiera curacio am la qual aquest membre es reduzit que las autres specias.	And this cure is the lightest specific cure with which this member is reduced from the other species.
Mays si es excusat sobre tu e no obezeys al entrament am aquesta specia de curacio de tot, lahoras cove que sian liatz les dos pes del malaute ensemps am liament fort, leugier, sobre amdos les talos e amdos les denols.	But if it does not agree with you and does not obey this cure of all species, then bind the two legs together with a strong ligament on both sides of the hips and on both backsides.
E sia la longitut de quascun de son par la quantitat de quatre ditz, e sia la camba malaute extenduda mays que l’autre per quantitat de dos ditz.	And be the length of each one of them as much as four fingers, and be the patient' back extended more than the other by two fingers.
E aprop le malaute sia suspendut sobre le cap del fust, e que sia en la mayso; e sia la longitut de lu de la terra la quantitat de dos brasses.	And then the patient be suspended on his head, and be high up; and be the length of him from the ground as much as two arms.
E aprop comanda a un jove fort que minuesca le cap de la coyssa, e sia suspendut am le malaute autre jove, e l’autre jove minuent la coysa am fortaleza empellesca, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	And then order a strong youth to lower the top of the thigh, and another to raise it high on the patient; and the other youth lowers the thigh with an iron girdle because the joint returns to its place with great speed.
Mays en la reducio propria, quan es dislocacio a la partida defora, cove que·l malaute jaga sobre pug segon que havem recomtat en le havent gelbozitat; e sia strenhut le liament sobre la camba malauta propriament e sobre le pietz de lu.	But in the self-reduction when it is dislocated to the front parts, then the patient remains on one leg according to what we have said; and be bound tightly on top of the spine itself and on its feet.
E aprop dos fustz sian pausatz, la un als pes de lu, e l’autre al cap; e aprop sian pausatz fustz ajustatz al mieg del pueg ficat sobre·l qual draps humitz sian envolopatz, per so que·l malaute no sia dampnajat per que·l fust sia entre las coyssas de lu, per que deves la extencio a las partidas dejos no sia atirat.	And two youths are placed, one on each side of the patient, and another on top; and place strong fust between the thighs of the patient, so that it is not dampened by it; and place it in such a way that the extension to the front parts is not pulled out.
E aprop quascun ministre extenda a la sua part, e·l metge am la sua ma enguala la reduccio segon l’art.	And each servant extends to its part, and the doctor covers it with his hand according to the art.
Donc, si obezeys a revercio, sira bo grandament; e sino, pausa sobre aquela diligentment e ayssi quo havem dit en gelbozitat per aquela engualment.	And so, if you obey in reverse, it is good greatly; and otherwise, then place it carefully and then administer as we have said for binding.
Mays cove que·l malaute jagua sobre les sieus latz sa quetament.	But the patient remains on his side and quietly.
E quan la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras cove que la camba sia extenduda leugierament, e es segon aquesta meteyssa narracio sobre pueg; e le metge pause la palma de la sua ma dreyta sobre·l langonar malaute, e aprop coarte aquel am l’autra ma, e am aquela coartacio pausa aquel extendut a las partidas dejos a la partida del denol.	And when the dislocation is in the front parts, then the back is extended slightly; and it follows this account of the story about the puget; and the doctor places his right hand on the patient' spine, and then turns that hand to the left, and another to the right, and so turns those two hands, and places a strong girdle around the patient' neck; and thus it is bound tightly.
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas detras, lahoras no cove que·l malaute sia extendut a las partidas dejos, e es elevat sobre la terra; habantz cove que sia pausat sobre causa dura, ayssi cum cove le eyssament si l’ancha de lu es dislocada a las partidas defora, segon aquo que havem dit del jasement de lu sobre dos anchas; e es sobre la sua cara e les liamentz sian extendutz, segon que havem dit, no ha guayre.	And if the dislocation is at the front of the legs, then do not cover that the patient is extended to the front legs, and is raised above the ground; let be that it is placed on a hard surface, so that the examination if the broad of him is dislocated at the sides outside, according as that we have said about the Jasement of him over two broads; and it is over his face and the ligaments are extended, according to what we have said, there is no danger.
E cove que sia aministrada compressio am taula sobre le loc al qual yeys la junctura.	Then let be administered a compression with table on the place which you have the junction.
Donc cum la reducio es complida segon que cove — e·l senhal de la reduccio de lu no es amaguat a tu, e es que tu extendas del malaute doas cambas, e quan tu vezes aquelas enguals e le malaute extrenh la sieua camba e expandeys aquela ses excusacio, lahoras sapias que·l membre segon que cove es retornat — e lahoras tu ajusta doas coyssas e pausa empastre e extrenh am benda ayssi que la ancha no sia mauguda en alcuna de las partidas; e adheresca le malaute a repaus per tres dias o per quatre.	And when the reduction is completed according to that you— and the signal of the reduction of him it is not covered up to you, and it is that you extend two broads of the patient, and when you see those enguals and the patient extrenh its broad and expands that one of his excuses, then you will know that the member according to that you is returned— and then you adjusts two cushions and pauses a pad and extrenh a cloth so that the broad is not mauguda in any of the sides; and attaches the patient to rest for three days or four.
E aprop deslia le liament e l’empastre, e compara la una camba am l’autra.	Then return the ligament and the pad, and compare one broad with another.
Lahoras, si vezas aquelas enguals en vustament, lahoras sapias que la dislocacio ja es fermada, e adonc layssa le malaute anar.	And if you see those enguals in your hand, then know that the dislocation already is closed, and let leave the patient to go away.
E si vezas alcuna causa de mollificacio, lahoras tu retorna e emplastra aquel, e extrenh aquel segon la tua primiera strectura, e layssa aquel en tres dias.	And if you see any cause of mollification, then you returns and pad that one, and extrenh it that according to your first stretching, and leaves that in three days.
E aprop deslia aquel, e fay aquel tardar en ambulacio sobre quascu per alcus dias, entro que sia confortat.	Then return that one, and let that one wait to walk on every side of some days, until it is comforted.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter.
De curacio de dislocacio del denolh.	On the treatment of a dislocation of the foot.
Le denolh es dislocat segon tres manieyras, quar es dislocat a las partidas defora, e a las partidas dedintz, e a las partidas dejos mays a las partidas detras; e a las partidas denant no es dislocat.	The foot is dislocated according to three ways, because it is dislocated at the sides outside, and inside, and at the front legs more than at the back ones; and is not dislocated in front.
E le senhal de dislocacio de lu es que comandes al malaute que aplique la sua camba am la coyssa; lahoras sapias que·l denol es dislocat.	And the signal of a dislocation of him is that you command to the patient that it applies its broad to the cushion; then know that the foot is dislocated.
E la restauracio de totas las manieyras de lu es que fassas cezer le malaute dreyt, enayssi que ja extenda la sieua camba, si pot sobre aquo; adherir le tieu dos a la cara de lu, e pausa le pe de lu entre les tieus pes; e aprop fay adherir le denol de lu am las tuas palmas, e rete aquelas entre les tieus ditz sobre le denolh de lu am fortaleza, e autre ministre extenda le sieu pe entro que·l denol retorne a son loc.	And the restoration of all ways of him is that you pass over right the patient, then extends its broad, if it can on this one; attach the two to the face of him, and pause the foot of him between the two feet; and if it is necessary that you pass over those between the two feet over the foot of him with strength, and other minister extend his foot until the foot returns to its place.
E senhal de reddicio de lu es que la sua camba adharesca am la coyssa am levitat no-laboroza.	And the signal of a cure of him is that its broad attaches to the cushion with a levitating non-laborious.
E aprop emplastra aquel e fay adhirir la camba am la coyssa, e aprop lia aquelas emsemps am una benda per tres dias o per quatre, e aprop deslia aquelas.	Then return that one and pad that one, and if it is necessary attach the broad to the cushion, and if it is necessary pass over those by means of a cloth for three days or four, and then return them.
E no uze le malaute de ambulacio per alcus dias, entro que sia sanat e cofortat.	And does not use the patient to walk on every side of some days, until it is healed and comforted.
Mays si la reduccio de lu a tu es excusada, lahoras aministra fort extencio am liamentz dels quals en la curacio de la hancha precedit narracio.	More if the reduction of him to you is excused, then administer a strong compression with the ligaments in the cure of the foot preceded a narrative.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter.
De la curacio de la dislocacio del talo.	On the treatment of a dislocation of the ankle.
Le talo alcunas veguadas es remaugut per petita remocio, e alcunas veguadas es dislocat segon compliment, e la dislocacio de lu es fayta o a las partidas dedintz o a las partidas deforo.	The foot sometimes gets up by small removal, and sometimes is dislocated according to complement, and the dislocation of it is made at the sides inside or outside.
E le senhal de la dislocacio de lu es que vezes le talo imflat procedent a la partida a la qual es dislocat.	And the signal of a dislocation of it is that you see the foot inflating according to the side where it is dislocated.
Mays la curacio de la remocio de lu es de leugiera reddicio, e es que sia extendut am facilitat am las mas e sia engualhat entro que retorne.	More if the cure of a removal of it is of easy recovery, and it is that it is extended with ease to the side and enguals until it returns.
Mays en la curacio de lu quan es dislocat segon compliment, cove que fasses cezer le malaute dreyt, e tengua aquel un ministre fort e valent de la partida detras del dos de aquel en le mieg loc de lu.	More if the cure of it is made according to complement, do not make right the patient, and has another minister strong and valiant of the side behind the two of it in its place.
E aprop te tu am la tieua ma dreyta le pe de la pus sobirana part, e am la tua ma sinistra de la part pus dejos del pe en le loc de la cavilha.	Then return to you on the right foot of the superior part, and on the left one of the inferior part in the place of the nail.
E aprop atira le pe a tu am la tua ma dreyta, e aprop am la sinistra per dos veguadas, e aprop exten am la sinistra; e empelleys le pietz del pe am la dreyta deves la camba ses trebalh.	Then return the foot to you on the right side, and then on the left for two times, and if it is necessary extend it on the left side; and pad with the right hand opposite to the broad that is working.
E fay aquo doas veguadas segon que havem comtat.	Then make two times according as we have counted.
E aprop empelleys le pietz del pe a la camba la tersa veguada, e tu es a la cavilha.	Then return the foot to the broad on the third time, and you are in the nail.
Donc si retorna en una veguada o en dos segon aquesta manieyra, e si vezes le pe engualhat, es bo; e sino, lahoras sobre lu itera la operacio, quar aquel retorna.	Then return on one time or two according to this way, and if you see the foot engaging, is good; and if not, then perform again the operation, because that one returns.
Mays si a tu es prohibida la reduccio de lu am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu dos sobre terra, e estrenh un paysel mot en terra fermat, e que caja entre las coyssas de lu, e tu ja has envolopat sobre lu drap per so que no ledesca le malaute.	More if to you it is prohibited to reduce the foot according to water that we have recommended, then make the patient lie on its two sides on the ground, and extend a cloth mot in the ground, and let it fall between the cushions of him, and you have wrapped over him with a drap so that he does not come out the patient.
E aprop le ministre de lu tengua las suas coyssas, e aprop autre ministre extenda le pe am las suas mas o am liament que lie sobre le col del pe; e aprop extenda aquel quascun ministre contre extencio del sieu par, e le payssel sia extant entre las coyssas del malaute retinent aquel, per so que·l cos de lu no sia atirat a las partidas dejos deves la sua extencio.	Then the minister of him holds its cushions, and another minister extends the foot to his side or to the ligament that it lies on the back of the foot; then extend that one any minister against extension of the broad of him, and the payssel is extended between the cushions of the patient, keeping that one so that its toe is not drawn out at the sides outside its extension.
E aprop le metge enguala la dislocacio am las sieuas mas, e autre ministre tengua la coyssa sana a las partidas dejos, quar la dislocacio retorna am la facilitat.	Then the doctor enguals the dislocation with his hand, and another minister holds the cushion of him on the sides, because the dislocation returns with ease.
E donc cum retorna la dislocacio e es declarada a tu la sanetat de la reduccio de lu, lahoras pausa emplastre e extrenh aquela am liamentz fortment, e ligua le pe am liament a la camba.	And if it returns the dislocation and is declared to you the cure of the reduction of him, then pause pad that one with a strong compression, and attach the foot to the broad.
E cove que temes o te guardes dels nervis les quals so detras sobre le talo, per que le liament sobre aquel no sia vehement e leda aquel fortment.	And if you are afraid or watch out of the nerves which they are behind on the foot, because the ligament over that one is not violent and that one strongly.
E aprop layssa aquel per dos dias o per tres; e si le liament es mollificat, extrenh aquel.	Then leave that one for two days or three; and if the ligament is mollified, extelh that one.
E aprop deslia aquel en le ters dia o en le quart, e prohibeys le malaute de anament per xl dias.	Then return that one in the third day or in the fourth, and prohibit the patient to walk on for ten days.
Mays si es forsat de anar denant aquel spazi, no es fayta segurtat que la dislocacio no sia sobre lu dissolvuda e corrumpuda, e aprop aquo que no recipia curacio.	More if it is forced to go on a space that one, does not need that the dislocation is over him dissolved and corrupted, then return what it is cured.
E si accideys a lu apostema caut, lahoras cove que tu aministre en la cedacio de lu aquo en lo qual precedic la nostra narracio, en autre loc de curacio e de embrocacio, entro que sia remauguda.	And if it happens to him an apoplexy of caution, then know that you administer in the cure of him here where we preceded our narrative, in another place of cure and of preparation, until it is re-raised.
Capitol .xxxiiii.	Chapter.
De curacio de dislocacio dels ditz dels pes.	On the treatment of a dislocation of the toes.
Cove que aquel qu’es dislocat sia engualhat am pauca extencio ses trebal; e aquo que no es dificil, abantz es leugier.	And that which is dislocated is engaged by little removal is difficult, and this one before it is easy.
Mays si la dislocacio es en alcus nozes del dos del pe, lahoras cove que fassas cezer le malaute le sieu pe sobre loc engual de la terra o sobre taula, e sia estant ayssi cum si anava.	More if the dislocation is in two of the feet, then know that you pass over right the patient his foot on a place on the ground or on a table, and is being there like this one goes away.
E aprop tu sta de pes, e pausa le tieu pe sobre aquo que imineys de las juncturas, e aprop calca aquel am le tieu pe am vertut entro que retorne, e que vejas aquel ja engualhat e no aparesca en le loc eminencia.	Then return the feet to you, and pause the two feet on this one that it inflates from the joints, and if they are not engaged, then return them.
E aprop pausa dejos le ventre del pe de lu una taula que prengua tot le pe, a la qual sian dos caps, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent e ferma per tres dias; e aprop deslia aquel e fay aquel repausar de ambulacio per motz dias, entro que sia estrenhut e de reddicio sia assegurat.	Then pause the stomach of the foot on a table that it holds all the foot, to which are two tops, and then tighten that one with a strong and firm compression for three days; and then return that one and make that one rest to walk on every side of some days, until it is engaged and if the recovery is assured.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter .xxix.
De las specias de dislocacio que sian faytas am plagua o am fractura o am quascuna ensemps.	About the different types of fractures that may occur due to pain or injury.
Quan accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, e tu te perforssas en la curacio de aquela e en la restauracio de lu, motas veguadas succezeys la mort.	When any such cause occurs, and you attempt the cure of that and the restoration thereof, be mindful that death may result.
E per aquo no cove que sobre la curacio de lu presuma, sino aquel que es savi en l’art, de lonc uzatge, misericordios e pietados, tardiu, no-ardit ni presomptuos; e que use en le comensament de medicinas que cedan apostemas cautz tant solament, e leyssa le malaute al divinal jutgament, sino ad aquel al qual speras salut de perdicio, am de la malautia alleviacio, e en la qual appareys alcuna speransa.	And do not presume to undertake the cure of it, but he who is skilled in the art, long-suffering, merciful and compassionate, tardy, not impatient, and who uses remedies that yield only somewhat, and leaves the patient to divine judgment, but addresses himself to the patient with hope for salvation from destruction, with relief for the illness, and where there seems to be some hope.
E adonc esforsa te tantost far de lu la reduccio en le comensament de la causa, denant que endevengua apostema caut.	And then endeavor as much as possible to restore it at the very beginning of the cause, before it develops into a plague.
E adonc si le membre retorna segon que volem, lahoras aministra regiment le qual ceda apostema caut e cura la plagua am aquo que conveneys a lu dels enguentz desiccatius.	And then if the member returns as it should, then administer the remedy that yields only somewhat and cures the plague associated with it, using the enguenttes desiccatius.
E si dislocacio es am fractura e accideys en le os satagias separadas, lahoras tu perforsa le stement de lor, e fay en aquo so que havem dit en las malautias simplas de aquo que es precedit en les locz de aquels.	And if the fracture is caused by a dislocation and the bones separate, then you should attempt to set them back into place, and perform the procedure of simple malady on those that precede in location to those that occur in the body.
E guarda e esquiva segon la tua vertut aquel del intrament en las vias de temor segon que a tu es precedida la mia predicacio; quar aquo es milhor a tu deves le tieu Creator, e mays permanent a la tua gloria, e mays saludos al tieu cos verays aquels en le tieu temps.	And guard and avoid according to your virtue that instrument in the ways of terror according to which I precede you in predication; for you should desire your own Creator, and persist more firmly in your glory, and offer up more prayers to your true God at all times.
Ayssi fineysso las paraulas de Albucasim perfieytament de las quals Dieus ne sia benezeyt.	Thus ends the words of Al-BuCaSim clearly explaining what God wills.
Amen.	Amen.
